reviews.review: Interesting Place to visit. It's and interesting spot. Very crowded with many restaurants and drinking spots. Wear confortable and anti-slippery shoes.

Must visit - felt like a more authentic neighbourhood. I thoroughly enjoyed this neighbourhood - felt more authentic - there aren't hustles of souvenir shops and crowds or people trying to sell you something. We had a stroll through it coming from Campo de Fiori and making our way to the piazza. There were many lunch options here too. Make sure you make one of your meals here so you can enjoy wandering around here.
Must visit. This part of Rome is charming , working, the real Rome, no frills, great place to stay and visit, the most authentic place to eat and drink, in my opoinion
Fantastic evening strolling area. Near Vatican, lots of busy streets. Tons of restaurants and pubs. Lots of friendly people eating, drinking, socializing.
Wander the streets. Nice place to wander around during the day and stop at a restaurant for lunch or early evening prosecco.

A real gem away from the maddening crowds. We stayed at Le Relais Clarisse and were able to walk amongst the amazing small streets and alleyways and at each turning there was an interesting view. The Basilica of Santa Maria in Trastevere is well worth a visit and to have a meal in one of the restaurants on the sides of the piazza in front of the Basilica in the evening is an experience with lots of street entertainers.
Al fresco Roma. You will be spoilt for choice if you are looking for somewhere to eat and drink or just to walk round and soak up the atmosphere of la dolce vita a Roma.
Amazing !. It was such a nice place. You can relax and walk.. full of trees and it's give you the chance to row in a lake there ! Try it !

Charming area of Rome . With so many choices of restaurants and bars in this area you will not be disappointed. Set in the back streets, its a great setup for dining without listening to cars and scooters whizzing by.

Best place to stay in Rome. This is the cooler district of Rome, although not in temperature. Small, criss-crossed roads, bars, restaurants, gelaterias. Easy to get into and out of the main part of Rome, and probably the best place to stay.

Lovely neighbourhood. I'm sure togets can give a better description and recommendations of the area, but standingat the Ponte Sisto at twilight watching the birds dance across the sky i huge numbers before settling in for the night, was truly a beautiful experience. And seeing the sun setting at Ponte Sisto is by any standards not the worst you can do, and there are plenty of bars where you can have a drink before dinner close by.

Beautiful architecture and very good restaurants. A very beautiful part of the city, a poetic one. Very good restaurants are located there. It is not possible to reach it by metro, but you can go there by bus/taxi etc.

Best area of entire time . In my five days in Rome. I visited almost all areas. Testaccio, campo de fiori, piazza navona, termini, areas near Vatican, and colosseum, Trevi fountain. And we were just walking all over the place. Believe me. The best area to live in is trastevere. I mean so busy and great food and shopping as well. All small shops. Such a bloody charming area. And just one more thing. People who love area like trastevere would love positano over sorrento and amalfi. I mentioning this out of context. Stay in positano. It's beautiful. Have a happy journey.
Great place to see history and eat.... We walked along all the streets and had a wonderful lunch by great people...we would highly recommend getting a taste of history...

Great area of Rome. Trastevere is a great little part of Rome offering lots of great restaurants ranging from Italian to Sushi, lots of gelato options, and lots of cute/unique little shops and boutiques.

Love it, Love it, Love it!. I left my heart in Trastevere!It is the Roman Version of the French Artist Quarter with centuries old homes, shops, eateries oozing charm. It felt like we were stepping back in time and was a delight to all senses.If you sit at an outdoor establishment beware of beggars and gypsies as they work very stealthily.

Family visit. The best place to stay in Rome! Seriously! The second time I stayed here and again it was great! The atmosphere,especially at night/in the evening, is awesome. Well, when you like late dinners and sitting around and having a wine or two. Really would recommend to stay in this neighborhood when you're planning to go to Rome!
A taste of Rome. This neighborhood constitutes for many the real Rome, the place where the Roman food, character, and spirit can still be found.
Great area. Lots to do and see. Great local restaurants with traditional cuisine along side tourite but you dont get hassled. So many beautiful buildings definitely take your camera
ANOTHER PLACE TO SEE. REALLY NICE PLACES TO EATnarrow streets but perfect to walk thru to explore RomeJust follow one road that will take you to another one and have your camera ready

Truly Exciting to stay here - be ready for the night-time noise. :-). Loved the vibrant streets here as well as the sites of pure Roma; the designer shops & cafes appearing once the garage-like graffitied roller-doors are opened up with clothes out drying on overhead lines up some streets, trees growing out of the cobbles at some places and pedestrians bikes and cars all moving along the narrow streets together.Wonderful atmosphere with street performers out at night in the many squares and playing to the outdoor cafe/restaurant tables.May be good to have double glazing on some windows if you are staying above a square...

Lovely neighborhood. We spent a pleasant evening wandering through the narrow streets and scenic squares of Trastevere. Lots of great restaurants and interesting shops. Lots of tourists too, but fewer than in the downtown areas.

Worth visiting. On the opposite side of the river to most of the main attractions, Trastevere is a quaint area with narrow streets, little squares and a lovely cathedral. It is popular with locals, and when we visited on a Saturday lunchtime it was busy but with good atmosphere. We found it hard in Rome to find a restaurant that served light snacks at lunchtime as most are geared towards full meals or pizzas, but there were several nice options in Trastevere. We ate in Samovar, just off the square with the Cathedral, and they had lovely toasted bread buns made with pizza dough and various fillings. I had the roast vegatables with hoummus fillings and they were really nice. I also found a lovely bakery in the narrow streets, and bought some treats to take back to the hotel for afternoon tea breaks.

Rome as a village. Take one of the recommended strolls to slow down from the hectic life around the attractions. Take a seat, enjoy the views from Monte Gianicolo, and/or enjoy a glass of wine in one of the charming "enotecas".

The Place To Be. Forget about other areas of Rome. You want to hang out with the locals in Trastevere. The vibe is electric here. There are more excellent restaurants and bars here than you could visit in 10 trips, featuring fantastic food and wine, all at very reasonable prices. Access to other parts of the city is easy. Staying here is the difference between a "good" .vacation and a "great" one.
What an interesting quarter. The atmosphere here has to be seen to be believed. It is very lively and there are musicians playing at every corner, lots of eating places. Great atmosphere.

Walk through rome.. If you have a day to relax this area is the best place to visit. The narrow streets are amazing and there are a lot of nice restaurants to put colors to your visit. It a very nice place to spend a full afternoon fading through the streets.
A great suburb to get lost in . We stayed in Trastevere and it's a great suburb. Walking distance to the centre (30mins) or catch the tram. Great restaurants too.
it has its charm. It's a charming district of Rome which is really good for strolls and for Italian dining - good restaurants with nice prices.
Breathtaking view. When in Rome, it is the place never to be missed! The restaurants, the shops, cafes...Just wonderful.
Best walk in Rome. By far the warmest and most graphic place to walk arround. You can easily let yourself get lost in the several little roads and try one of the trattorias with very nice food...
Cute neighbourhood - great food. Something different from the rest of Rome. Easy to get to. It's a great place for food (lunch or dinner). We had the best pizza ever there.

Quaint area of Rome. We stayed in Trastevere and found this to be a very quaint and safe area of Rome to stay in. Lots of interesting areas, restaurants & very beautiful & interesting for taking pictures. It is also very accessable to the rest of Rome and very walkable.

Wonderful stroll through a great suburb of Rome. We have heard so much about Trastevere we spent a day walking around the area. The area by the river is beautiful. There a number of great restaurants and places for espresso. We thoroughly enjoyed the charm of the area.
Best area in Rome. Great neighborhood to get lost in the small streets, try tasty italian food, coffee and hospitality. The architecture here is fantastic.

Perfect evening. The area is beautiful, with many bylanes, coffee shops, restaurants, eateries, bars and musicians playing good music. We spent the whole evening there just walking and visiting various cafes etc

Very average. I had read a bit about Trastevere so I suppose I got my expectations up too much, and admittedly it was a rainy day but I couldn't see anything out of the ordinary, even in the main square. It was a nice area but nothing out of the box

Cozy Roma. Rome on a smaller scale. Definitely something to include with several days in Rome. Many good small and personal restaurants. One of the most exquisite sites in Rome, Santa Maria in Trastevere basilica with mind blowing mosaics.

Most vibrant quarter in Rome. Where locals eat...for a good reason. Many nice and cosy small restaurants and bars offering all different kinds of street food or Italian resto style food. Must see when visiting Rome.

Superb vibrant area in the Centre of Rome. The area is full of lively Bars, Coffee shops, Restaurants, Sandwich & Pizza Kiosks. Market stalls, musicians, small Churches, and Clothes shops. Many short lanes to stroll down.
The roads are still 'cobbled' adding to the Rustic feel to the area.
Fabulous area to spend hours just 'chilling' out with a few 'refreshment' stops to unwind.

Best area to go out for food and drink. We visited Trastevere in October 2016 for some food and drink. The taxi driver stopped across the bridge and we had to cross that which leads to an island and then to the bridge which takes you to the tram lines. As you enter it doesn't look like anything is there however if you keep going you will find dozens of cozy, local and friendly bars/restaurants. The friendliest place we went in Rome. Unfortunately it was our last night that we discovered this place on recommendation from the receptionist. I would advise asking where the best restaurants are or you won't get to enjoy the food to its full potential. We ate at Gino 51, the food and service was great and exactly what you want as a guest in someone's country. We then went for a few glasses of wine in nearby bars until we ran out of cash then got a taxi home. I highly recommend this place to couples looking for a nice intimate meal and drinks in an authentic area. I'm told this is the best place to get really Italian food and that there are only a few good restaurants dotted around the city elsewhere. Take a taxi or bus there and stroll around and enjoy the atmosphere, food and drink. You won't be disappointed.

Must walk there. You can't miss this beautiful area ! The feeling is like walking in a small village full of narrow roads,small shops and cafes and tiny restaurants in small squares .Here and there there are churches that you should visit as they have the most amazing mosaics .Don't forget to go to Biscottificio artigiano INNOCENTI as they still make wonderful biscuits and 'crostate' as they used to make more than a 100 years ago.

Beautiful Rome. We recently visited Rome and it was impressive. So much history. Everyone should visit. History and art enthusiast. Even though we went at the end of September it was very humid. The tours we took were amazing. The guides always made sure that when we stopped that the group was in the shade. We did a tour of the coliseum, Forum, Paltine Hill, that also included Caesar Augustus home. Was truly amazing and worth doing. We also tour the Borgessie and Vatican City. Both of those are worth buying the tickets ahead of time so you can skip the line. The tour promoters send people out to get you to buy there tickets and they are literally in your face constantly. I recommend that you go online to the museums website directly and buy your tickets. This can be time consuming, but worth the effort and is much cheaper than going through one of the tour company.
Great area to get lost in. Beautiful area across the river from the busy centre of Rome. Loads to see just wandering around the narrow streets!

The other side of Rome. We took a self guided walking tour in Trastevere. It was a great experience because we saw a different side of Rome. It is very quaint, but be prepared for some very uneven cobble stones! Great area to sit at an outdoor cafe and people watch. We went on a Sunday and tried the flea market just across the bridge. This is definitely not worth the bother. Just stall after stall of junk.
Enchanted place. Trastevere is just an amazing and truly romantic place to explore. Everywhere you look around there is something nice. Great entertainment and very good restaurants around.

West of the river, and a view of the "real" Rome. We spent three days exploring Trastevere at leisure; the restaurants, the cafes, the architecture and meeting the locals (with the scant bits of Italian we'd learned)..Fortunately, our three days included a Sunday, and whilst talking to a few locals, they pointed us towards a Roman restaurant, not often visited by tourists, but a firm favourite of the local inhabitants.We stepped in gingerly, but we immediately welcomed by the restauranteur and his staff, seated well and among Roman families, out for their Sunday lunch after church. This was a unique experience; we were included as instant "friends", introduced to other guests, offered glasses of prosecco, to try dishes we'd never heard of, and we enjoyed every minute.Lunch lasted around three hours, with coffee and grappa provided gratis by the restaurant, and the bill was unbelievably small; around €60 for the two of us.Northern Europeans don't expect this type of spontaneous generosity and friendliness, but we'll remember our visit to Trastevere for many years to come.

Different from old town. Less palaces, lower houses, narrower streets. I love this area of Rome, eventhough it became more crowdy already. It's great for strolling around, lots of small cafes & bars, nice restaurants, less expensive than old town.
Real roman tastes. Trastevere is a lovely place, visited by tourist and romans, here you can still feel the real roman tradition and atmosphere, one of the last places in the city.
Get your piece of the pie.. A friend of mine suggested this part of Rome. There are plenty of alfresco cafes where you can have pizza, pasta, and cappuccinos.
Lovely neighborhood with a lot to offer. Super charming neighborhood with lots to see and do within walking distance. Great central location in Rome.

Great if you don't go (or want to go) to Naples. Nice little winding alleys, but many tourists. For us, this was Naples without the graffiti or the energy. We looked at the churches to find the Caravaggios - saw one that wasn't his best work and had difficulty finding the other. It could be quite a nice place to stay, but for us, a bit out of the way. I know others won't agree with this assessment, but it just seemed to lack life (better if we had visited before Naples).

Spend some hours here while in Rome. This is a charming area for exploring on foot, with dozens (or more) attractive places to drink or dine. (I wandered into a small bar, occupied entirely by young Italians, and was introduced to the local cocktail by a friendly bartender). And do not miss the Basilica of Santa Maria de Trastevere, one of the oldest and most beautiful churches in Rome, mostly unspoiled by Barroque exceces. The mosaics are truly lovely. A side chapel by the Boromini-inspired sculptor Gherardi is admittedly out of place, but nonetheless spectacular, showing how the new style can make even tiny spaces appear spacious.
Wonderful area. My favourite part of Rome; just to wander the streets is a joy.Great bars and restaurants everywhere.
A place for everything.. This is a nice neiborhood both for staying and strolling aroung.It is picturesque, safe and live with many places to eat or have a drink.

Very Quaint Historic Area. Trastevere is the old quarter just next to the historic quarter of the centre of Rome. It has wide streets, square street corners and few Vicoli in comparison to the centre of Rome where there are lots of laneways. There are lots of eateries bars and shops. one can still hear the old Roman language. In decades gone by it was largely a working mans' residential area however these days has many celebrities who reside there.

Interesting and less tourists. After a morning of sight seeing popular sights, we decided to head to Trastevere for lunch. After crossing the river at Ponte Cisteo we wandered the interesting cobbled streets, enjoyed lunch and people watching. It was good to get away from the crods for a while, but believe this place is very busy at night
Great area. This is my favorite area in Rome. You can easily find great food and have a nice drinks here. Saturday night there is a great experience.

Great Neighborhood. A somewhat quieter neighborhood with many outstanding eateries that will fit all budgets. Worth a visit. Saw this neighborhood doing a walking tour. This is a great way to see the area and to get familiar with the great food in the are.
Hip neighborhood. Trastevere is a really hip and fun neighborhood to walk around and unwind after a busy day of sightseeing. Lots of outdoor bars and cafes and lots of locals.

The hip neighborhood. Run down and often ignored for decades, Trastevere is undergoing a renaissance with some of the best restaurants in the city, night life and easy access to the heart of ancient Roma without as much tourist crowding.

Roms charmigaste stadsdel - Trastevere. Rom's old working class area, today gentrified, so charming, picturesque, friendly and just awesome. Find a hotel here, and make visits to the city centre. There are plenty of B&B:s, small hotels, restaurants and bars, winding streets, and a great park up on a hill. You easily get here from the airport by taking the local train (FR 1), it´s seven stops/half an hour, and you're in Trastevere. My visit was in the first week of October, the weather was perfect for walks and sitting outside at verandas etc. I wouldn't go in the summer, it's to hot.
Lively area. This area is full of stalls and eateries. It is a delightful part of Rome and makes a good day trip when combined with Campo Di Fiori on the other side of the Tiber.

Passion apon passion. After exploring the Centro Storica of Rome cross the Tiber in the evening to add another passionate dimension to this wonderful city. Trastevere mean across the Tiber. Piazza Santa Maris in Trastevere is a must before wandering the narrow streets and stumbling upon a gem to eat at
Really Quirky!. A lovely area of Rome. Beautiful restaurants, lovely buildings and a great vibe. Good idea to look in depth for restaurants, those on show are stunning, but quite expensive.

Quaint part of Rome. Trastevere is an interesting part of Rome, just across the river from the Centro Storico (the historical centre). It is full of little restaurants, bars and shops lining small cobblestone streets. Each eating and shopping place is different to the mainstream places you can find the Centre or near the Vatican. It is like a little village within Rome with its own character and charme. Trastevere also contains the botanical gardens, the Villa Farnesina and a few other interesting museums and buildings. . Definitely worth a stroll through if not a longer visit.
Lively, fun place to stay. Trastevere is filled with restaurants, market stalls, people and bars. It is lively, and so much fun. Whichever way you turn there is something to see and do.
Stayed in an airbnb. Stayed in an airbnb here in early October. Fantastic neighbourhood. Lots of restaurants,cafes, bars and street vendors. Great atmosphere!

Tucked away from the center, but still bustling. This is more than a neighborhood, its a whole district adjacent to the old center. If you stay here, it probably costs less than the center and you are only 10-15 minutes walk from the attractions. Like many tourist areas, the food is inconsistent, so refer to other TA reviews for more advice. Walkability is a great benefit, with many possible reasons to stop and eat/drink/buy. It doesn't have a corso (main street), but coming from Ponte Sisto will put you in the middle of things.
My favorite area in rome. Very tipical area in Rome, nice houses, small, a different neighborhood them you see in Rome. Very nice restaurants were you can eat outside, I do recommend this place
Trastevere. If your wanting to see real Italian charm you must visit Trastevere. It's a beautiful walk near the river with lots of cute cafe's and restaurants.

I love this place!!!!!. Loved Trastevere! A little jaunt over the bridge to this wee suburb and you are out of the beeping cars, speeding motorbikes, shouting, fumes and craziness of Rome centre. Much lighter in traffic and lighter in human traffic too..with a huge array of bars and restaurants. We made our own food tour here and had one of our best days in Rome! Tiny quiet cobbled streets are orange-lit in the evening and lead to loads of little gems to find. Be aware restaurants almost all close from about 3 til about 7.

The Real Rome. This is a charming area of Rome, rich in history and with a bohemian atmosphere. There is an abundance of great value authentic Italian restaurants and it's where the locals hang out. We saw it by both day and night and I would recommend that to any visitor wanting a Rome experience away from the tourist areas.No Metro service there but it is well serviced by buses, taxis and Uber.
Fun area. Great restaurants in this area. Lots of entertainment. Area is happening late night. Lots of cute shopping with vendors.
A lovely part of old Rome. Small streets, lots of trattorias, several good churches and lots of street life. Fun place to walk around in.

Best Italian neighborhood!. Amazing place with great modern Italian environment and culture at the same time. This is the place to stay in Rome, close to all the attractions by walking distance and very well connected.
Well worth the time. I like this area. It seems more authentic than the piazza Navona. Quirky restaurants like six ducks and in general a must see for all that it contains!

Lovely part of Rome. You can wander the streets here day and night and get completely different experiences, you have to wander and see where you feel like stopping for a beer, a coffee or for some food. Beware of the street sellers they are everywhere, we visited this area on a cycle tour and then went back for a stroll day and night. The Metro doesn't go to this area but plenty of taxis, a good walk to the nearest metro but the trams do go here. Definitely worth a look

Go att night & enjoy the activity!. This place is a hangout for all walks of life. Once a run down & unsafe neighborhood, it is now a buzz of activity. Many students live & plsy in the area. Musisians & local artisans enrich the main square.

Get away from the city crowds.. Go see Villa Farnesina and then the Museo Orto Botanico gardens for something different in Rome The Trastevere area is quiet area. You can see a church or two, find great food and gelato and enjoy an area of Rome that is a little off the beaten path.

Great place to spend a day. Nice area, closed off to cars, lots of restaurants, bars and little gelateria. One central square you can sit at for hours. After visiting trastevere, we walked up to nearby Gianicorlo, a hill with a panoramic view of Rome. If you are done doing touristy things, a great place to unwind.
Walk it. They say that Rome is a very walkable city. Trastevere is. Enjoy the narrow streets and little places.

Maybe I went down the wrong roads.. Unfortunately I was not as impressed with this area as I was hoping to be. Maybe we just took the wrong roads as I did not find it particularily nice. I suppose it is worth a visit and on my next trip I will try to capture the atmosphere that others have. This was our first trip to Rome with just 3 nights so we were probably in too much of a hurry to see as much as possible.

A lovely place to explore. We wandered around from the island in the Tiber through the little piazzas and streets. We loved the old houses and the intimate but understated feel of the area. Santa Maria in Trastevere was wonderful!I really recommend then following Via Garibaldi up to the top of the Janiculum Hill in Piazzale Garibaldi for its great views over Rome.

Lovely area.. Cross the oldest bridge in rome on the tiber island and walk into a truly vibrant area of rome.A lovely vibe eminates from these narrow cobbled streets.A delightful area to get away from the hustle of central rome.

An "edgy" part of Rome, full of Character, wonderful during the day and lively at night.. This part of Town is in the process of gentrification with some great Bars and Restaurants but still has an interesting atmosphere. A bit off the Tourist track and lovey if sometimes still shabby narrow streets and traditional architecture.

South of the Vatican and west of the Tiber. Meaning over the river, this area gives you the chance to see a Roman neighbourhood without the legions of tourists. The Monteverdi area is quite trendy with nice restaurants and bars. If you can stay here you will save some money and see a different side of Rome. The number 8 train/tram takes you directly into the centre in miuntes.
very romantic area. lots of bars cafes and restaurants to choose from in a small area , easy access by tram or bus, lots of local churches to visit, best to read menus before you sit down,
Fun place to walk and shop and drink. Lots of nice shops, bars, eateries all over.Go up top to the Gianicolo for an excellent view of Rome- worth the steps, and there are a lot

Great neighborhood filled with little restaurants and shops. We are glad we visited Trastevere while staying in Rome. It is especially lovely on Sundays when the local artists are selling their wares. Several nice restaurants especially in the Jewish Ghetto area. Friendly people and much less expensive than most other areas in Rome.
LIVE NIGHT TIME!. At night is very live. One of the preffered dine places for Italians and tourists. Restaurants for all tastes and budgets.

Excellent Are to Wander Around. It is worth while crossing the river from the hustle and bustle of the city to the Trastevere area. It is full of small narrow street filled with restaurants and bars. There is alo a large square in front of the cathedral. There are restaurants here where it is very pleasant to sit and listen to the musicians while having a snack or meal. Highly recommend a visit.
Local haven. Fun local area with good restaurants and bars. Friendly environment and robust night life. Excellent prices for food and shopping as compared to the tourist center

If you go to Rome stay here. I've been to Rome a few times and this location, in the old Jewish quarter, in my opinion, has most of the best authentic Italian restaurants. Very small cobbled streets/lanes (think flat shoes) full of wonderful "one off" shops selling everything from jewellery to antiques to pasta, spices, carving. Graffiti everywhere. The food is fantastic. Nothing grand but if you want great pasta or Pizza here it is. My favourite restaurant in Trastevere is Da Othello. Please try it, but book beforehand, it's a favourite with locals and when they start singing, well you just have to join in.

A Gem over the Tiber!. You will relish the reduced pace in comparison to the rest of Rome. Pull up a chair at any of the cafe bars and enjoy the ambiance of this peaceful location. Totally relaxing after a day's walking around the sites.
Winding streets and great atmosphere. Don't miss a visit in this part of the city. Especially great in the evening for a romantic dinner in one of the many small restaurants with tables outside.

Very picturesque - and good food. This is the photogenic part of Rome with less tourists than the main center. Come here and enjoy the charms (and you will have many opportunities for great photos in the small allies). And great food - don t miss the pizza bakery La Renella while strolling through Trastevere. And Fatamorgana serves creative ice cream flavours (and yes, it is "real" ice cream and you can even choose organic versions to suit almost any dietary needs). This is a great neighbourhood to just wander and relax.

Make the time if you have it. A lovely little piazza outside of the crazy tourist madness...great to sit and have a espresso and watch the people and world pass by..you will hear the Bells ringing and perhaps offer your own prays in the quaint little church of San Maria ..

Real Rome adventure. If you visit Rome should spend a few days in Trastevere. You may even stay there. Restaurants are very Roman:) Real Roman restaurants. Not expensive, good food and friendly people.

It's less crowded with a nice funky feel . I met friends here for lunch and had a great meal on a non touristy cafe. The shops were more interesting and a bit different. I wished I'd found this area sooner and didn't get as much of a chance to explore as much as I would've liked.

Foodies. We took a foodie walking tour in this neighborhood and had some of the best food on our vacation. Twilight Trastevere, foodie Tour. Dario our guide was exceptional! Company name, Eating Italy.

Charming Rome neighborhood. So glad we crossed the river to visit this charming and photogenic neighborhood. While on the other side of the river I heard more people speaking English and languages other than Italian, so crossing over to Trastevere made me finally feel I was in Italy. Many great places for drinks and dinner - the part of Rome where people live.

The best place for lunch and rest after busy sightseenig of Vatikan. One of the oldest place in Rome with charming atmosphere from the old days.
Despite tourists everything is going lazy and calm.
Marvelous little places for lunch and rest.

Go for a coffee, dinner or the view. We were staying near Piazza Navona and enjoyed the walk over the bridge and along the colourful streets of the part of Trastevere that is near the river. Sitting outside a cafe enjoying good coffee was a great place to people watch. There is a beautiful vhurch in the main square here too. Can't recall the name. Later we climbed up the hill to the Garibaldi monument and enjoyed views over Rome.

just an amazing place. we have visited Rome before and stayed in different areas, but the Trastevere area is my favoritea really nice central area with great shops, eats, people and lots to dowish we had more time!

This was our third time in Trastevere...... and we walk back into the area of ancient houses. It was magical. The ivy and greens growing on the old houses were special. From here we walked to The Ghetto, where we ate 2 separate dinners at Nona Betta. Jerusalem styled artichoke - yummy!
Nice residential area of Rome. Filled with restaurants and shops - we ate in this area at Vizi Capitale and were not disappointed. The cab ride from central Rome is about 15 minutes / 10 Euros.

Rue de Boucher of Rome. Here you find a wide range of restaurants. They have some very good ones, but also the tourist traps are to be found here. It's the best place to end a walk to the panoramic viewpoint at the garibaldi statue (between Trastevere and Vatican). Typically you go there at sunset, so you arrive hungry and thirsty at the restaurant.

Good bustling area for nightlife and eating out!!. A great place to visit for restaurants and cafe's with a nice ambience, busy, but if feels quite safe to amble around.Just watch your prices with some of the side restaurants who prey on tourists, however there are good meals and times to be had!!
Lovely area. Very nice area it is not as touristic as the center of Rome although you will see many tourists around, still keeps a bit of local charm. Very nice buildings and atmo

In its own world. Trastevere is a lovely area across the Tiber river from central Rome. It was very busy on a Sunday but nevertheless very enjoyable to walk the lovely little streets. Quite a different feel to the other side of the river - more communal and less grandiose.

Best part of Rome. I just love this part of the city! The most authentic and romantic place of Rome! Those streets and houses and locals - just the best experience ever! There are even not so many tourists, especially if you go deeper and further from the riverbank. If you just go and explore Trastevere, you can find real diamonds ourt there. I would really love to live in the place like that

Do NOT miss this area. can not say enough good things about this area - wonderful authentic Rome - from the small streets crowded in the evening with people enjoying the merchants music street performers wine food - loved it so much that we stayed at a quaint little hotel for 4 days

cool market. we spent a few hours looking around the flea market. lots of bits and bobs. we bought some vegetable seeds from a stall and we have been enjoying the veg this summer. it is quite a busy market so be prepared to take your time.
Really nice neighbourhood!. I loved this very much. It's a small cosy very italian area which is worth visiting for sure. Maybe together with a walk near the bridges.
Beautiful place to wander around, eat and stay in. Stayed in B&B here, and it was fantastic, narrow streets, full of bars and restaurants, great buildings, squares and fountains

So glad we went. Wanted to check out the restaurants in this area and found many cute shops and a street market with lots of items. Food choices were abundant and we found a great place for lunch with great food and drinks. The next day we went back to find a place for dinner and it was super busy even being a Sunday night. We first went into one of the wine bars and had a drink this wine bar had a buffet that came with certain wine and you could also purchase it for $5 with any other drink, I really wish we discovered this place sooner because the buffet looked great but we were saving up for our last night's dinner so we didn't get it. This area also had a lot of historic sites and wish we had more time to explore more of it.
interesting old Rome. found a good resto on the little square and just enjoyed the architecture and mostly Roman people, not too touristy
Why pay more for "fashionable areas of Rome.. Classic narrow twisting alleys and reasonable restaurants with character. Santa Maria of Trastevere and its square is a centerpiece.

lively area. we went to dinner in this neighborhood on the recommendation of our tour guide who says this is where the locals go. The area is lively and didn't seem to be dying down as we started our walk home around midnight.
Hipster Area of Rome. Lovely central piazza with pretty church that lights up at night. Entertaining crowds. Great food. Fun community

Wonderful . This is a fabulous area to visit and spend some time in the many little bars and ristorantes. Cobbled lined narrow streets that are a maze of interesting and varied places a must if you are planning a visit to Roma.

Should be a part of everyone's trip to Rome. This is a charming area and has a more quiet peaceful and local vibe compared to the hustle and bustle of the more popular parts of central Rome. It is located just West of the River Tiber and is also a good excuse to cross the river. Get here by bus, taxi or simply walk - it is just a 15 minute walk here from The Pantheon for example. I would first head for the road Vicolo del Cinque in Trastevere by crossing the Ponte Sisto bridge but you could also get here by crossing the Ponte Garibaldi. The area is full of restaurants, shops, bars, cafes and gelaterias - just wander round and explore. You'll be glad you did!

Stay on the tram to see the real Rome. Stayed on the tram to the last stop on the line, venturing through the more urban side of Rome, with dirt, graffiti, squalid homes, the real Romans .... Easy to get back on tram to watch scenery change to ancient architecture ....

Mix of old and new. Our hotel is in this area which is very much a mix of a patchwork of cobbled streets where real people live and work, a collection of fascinating medieval churches (some of the best in Rome) and a proliferation of fashionable clubs, restaurants and boutique shops. I am not sure it really works that well but it is still much better than staying the other side of the Tiber.
Scouting for diner. It's a sheer pleasure to walk around this area in search for a restaurant. There are so many nice places, streets, alleys, you will love it. Definitely a go to place.

One of the Rome's picturesque neighborhoods. When I decided to visit this place I've just read that is the special italian neighborhood that is not visited by tourists. But it wasn't true. This district was full of turists due to The Church St Mary in Trastevere (one of the first christian church of the world), Borghese Galleries (with wonderful works of art made by Rafael) or The Church St. Pietro in Montorio. But, first of all, turists came here for the local specialty food, italian drinks and for strolling on the narrow and shady streets, and to admire the specific roman architecture.

Should be a Top Ten.. The proprietor of our B&B recommended that we visit Trastevere. It is where the real Romans seem to live. The streets are narrower and the cobblestones are more uneven. It is a charming area that we are glad to have spent time in. There is no Metro station nearby but the buses run through here. Many restaurants and bars.
Great walk and visit. A great day trip. So many little shops to eat and snack at. We put together our own foodie tour and just purchased a couple items at each location to share. Had a great time.
Dining in Rome. A beautiful quarter of Rome, full of small restaurants and enjoyable walks.You will find many good restaurants here.

Dining in Rome. A beautiful quarter of Rome, full of small restaurants and enjoyable walks.
You will find many good restaurants here.

Away from the busy streets of Rome in Rome. This place is away from the busyness of Rome. Lots to see and do. So many restaurants and pizza huts to choose from. The neighbourhood, the cobble stone streets, the Italian laid back life style... We took the local bus there and then took a taxi back to our hotel on our first visit. Subsequent visit we actually walked over and taxied back.
Neighbourhood with a Great Vibe. Great place for a night out with heaps of restaurants and wine bars. The area has a good vibe and you don't feel you are in the tourist trap.

A great place to experience!. This is a busy neighborhood with lot's of interesting characters, places to eat, things to see and musicians to listen to. Be sure to visit the Santa Maria Chapel and eat in one of the many small cafes or bistros. Take a few minutes to grab a gelato and do some people watching.

Off the Grid and Fun. This area is an interesting part of Rome. There are many outdoor shops, old churches, and quaint eating places. It is not far to walk there from Trevi Fountain. I would definitely plan to visit this area.
Wonderful. Wonderful neighbourhood, really worth visiting, really good restaurants as well and wonderful views from the bridges.

Charming. Although Trastevere isn't what it used to be, I believe it's still very beautiful and charming. People I've talked to explained to me that, before, Trastevere didn't get any tourist attention, or at least not nearly as much as it gets today. That gradually changed and Trastevere became packed with tourists, looking for a true, italian neighbourhood - full of small alleys and colorful houses covered with ivy and flowers. From my understanding, many people these days try their luck in the neighbourhood of Monti, or even some other neighbourhoods, because of the numerous tourists in Trastevere, who're ruining the fundamental atmosphere. Nevertheless, I believe everyone should visit Trastevere.

Worth visiting. Just across the river, trasterve is well worth a visit. A maze of medieval cobble streets. Lots of bars and cafes. Very peaceful by day, but it is popular with the young ones and can get very busy by night. Drink and food is slightly cheaper here too. It's worth visiting the basilica in the main square.

Beautiful area of rome to visit. we read about this place before our visit to Rome and were determined to visit it. Everything we read was right this place was lovely. Cobbled streets, lots of cafes, bars and restaurants. Lovely little boutiques as well as street vendors. The atmosphere is fabulous and so worth a visit.

Hip neighborhood worth seeing. Loved walking around Trastevere, fantastic neighborhood, very different feel than other areas of Rome. It feels young and hip and slightly gritty in a hipster way, although this may be a huge oversimplification. Check it out for sure!

Picturesque Roman are-must visit!. Beautiful area in Rome full of small streets and amazing restaurants-represents Italian style truly! Very alive and colorful, wit a street-musicians; romantic for a dinner or a walk...
Come here for a night out!. Came here for a night out - a fantastic choice of bars and restaurants - the place was buzzing - when we left at 2am there was no sign of things quieting down.

Spend an afternoon!. Beautiful trastevere! You must eat pizza at dar poeta - best pizza in Rome. Stroll through he piazza and little streets or visit the market on sundays. Beautiful part of Rome just across the river!
Sunday markets. The markets are on here every Sunday, well worth a stroll if you love the market thing, your sure to walk out with a bargain.

First day in Rome. We visited Trastevere on our first day. There was a quaint restaurant where we ate for dinner. It was AMAZING! I recommend doing some research on the area. We really didn't know what to do or see while we were there. Plus jet lag....

Great Part of Rome. This is such a vibrant part of Rome---you must make it part of your stop in Rome. I took a food tour that took me to Trastevere, and it was awesome!!!!Great food and awesome nightlife and people watching. I walked here from Barberini and it was a beautiful walk. You have to go here!!!!!!Totally different from the other more touristy parts of Rome!!!!!

beautiful area of Rome. a must see on any visit to Rome, absolutely charming pocket of Rome, narrow cobbled streets, and small piazzas buzzing with locals and tourists alike, but with a laid back vibe - loads of lovely bars and restaurants, absolutely loved it. Tram 8 stops nearby.

Charming departure from typical Rome.. Our visit to Trastevere was long overdue, we thought some of the reviews were perhaps overselling it, but we weren't disappointed in the slightest. Beautiful old streets full of character and SO photogenic. Definitely worth a visit or two.
Good walk and history. We did a food walking tour which took us to the Trastevere and Jewish Ghetto. Good history and good food. I enjoyed the combination of history and tasting of food.

Such a cute corner of Rome!. Lots of nice spots to eat, walk around, pick up some dessert, or just take photos! Come for an evening and enjoy the street vendors too! We got lost getting here, recommend mapping the route before going. It's just across the river.

Rome central for a great night out. So much to enjoy, so little time.
Away from the city traffic, places to eat everywhere.
Classic architecture with the world of people passing thru.

Trastevere twilight food tour . More than expected regards excellentfood quality and quantity and wine to match .Up close and personal introduction to artisans in their shops/ restaurants ... And of course the wonderful guide Lucca who is so much fun while being very knowledgeable about the origin of food and the historical background to the various places you visit on this tour Lucca makes sure everyone enjoys this experience .you leave feeling like friends with other diners on the tour . A MUST DO !
Area where we stayed during our vacation. stayed Piazza Sant'Apollonia, . within walking distance Vatican, Parthenon, Collosseum, Porta Portese, Orange Garden, Campo de Fiori. Restaurants

Trastevere , by the river .. One of my favotite places to eat , and stroll around . Not usually flooded with tourists , you can escape some of the hussle and bustle of Rome , while being right downtown . some really great , smaller cafes and restaurants , beautiful patios . Great place for a quiet rommantic dinner , or a group of friends .

Super cool vibe!. We came to Trastavere on the recommendation of two different tour guides during our trip to Rome. They told us that it would be the best place for a good dinner on our last evening. Spent only part of an evening here, but it was a Friday evening, so pretty busy with people happy to have the week concluded. Such a fun area. I can't put my finger on it, but the whole neighborhood felt a lot more vibrant than life on the other side of the river. Lots of music in the street, fun restaurants, people laughing and relaxed. We had drinks and snacks at a cool wine bar called, Antico Caffe del Morro. We loved it! Wish we had discovered Trastavere (accent on the second syllable, not the first or third) sooner, instead of on our last evening in Rome.
Eat like a local. Fabulous local snacks & food shopping, great fresh fruit & vege market. Fill your water bottle from the street faucet without fear of water borne disease.
A great place to be. Trastevere is one of the best places from rome.The atmosphere here is so relaxed, the only thing I can say is go there talk a easy walk and enjoy.

Great art work. IF you love art and religious history don't miss this stop. It's not the Vatican but you may think is a small version. I can't write a review on anything we saw in Rome without telling about the architecture the detail and beauty of the buildings both inside and out., statues, fountains,columns.

I love Trastevere!. We rented an apartment in Trastevere for our stay and I am so glad we did! It is an amazing place to be at any time of the day, but especially at night. The nightlife here is great. Basilica de Santa Maria en Trastevere is here and a must see. There are ample cafes and restaurants in the area.At night in the Piazza de Santa Maria, there are magicians, artists, musicians, and, of course, people watching. We also went down by the Tiber River where a whole tent city exists with vendors and cafes. The river entertainment shuts down at 2:30 in morning. During the day, the area is easily accessible by public transportation and you can easily get to the big tourist areas by the same transportation. It is a great location for access to the day activities and the main spot for night life in Rome is right outside your door.

Interesting alleys. We went there in the evening for dinner. There was a lot of street action but very few nice places for dinner. We finally settled for one with outside seating. All in all this are is a bit touristy.

A great escape from Tourist Ville. Trastevere is a great place to head to in Rome for an AUTHENTIC and delicious inexpensive meal. So much better than the pushy tourist joints on the other side of the river.
Food tour. Fantastic sights food and tour guide Dominique Beautiful sights along the way. About 4 hour tour with different food stops along the trip

magical. This is the area of Rome I liked best, a myriad of cobbled streets with plenty eateries and entertainment. Be aware that some places charge by weight for fish and meat so be careful. that said this place is like a crystal maze something different around each corner

Great food, and plenty of walking!. Be prepeared to eat you way theought the cobbled streets of The Trastevere. Take your phrase book if you a not familar with the language, off the beaten track it is not touristy and the the locala do not speak English nor why would they! The food is off the charts. Local pizza slices and fabulous gelato.....need I say more...
Nice romantic part of Rome!. Nice cosy and narrow streets, lots of restaurants and lots of people. Performers everywhere. Very romantic.

Us this as your Rome base. This part of Rome is the place to stay if you were to explore Rome on foot. A very important place during Roman Times due to the sustenance it provided to the city during that period. Away from the throngs but close to everything. Nice to come back to after day out and visit the many restaurants... Do the food tours!

not any longer what it was. Trastevere is still a nice area to visit but unfortunately is invaded by cheap tourists that invade any angle of the place......the restaurant are very commercial and touristic and you will not find any fine cucine .

Excellent area for food tour. This was an exceptional food tour. The Roman Guy (Alfredo) showed us the history, culture, and top notch places to eat. None of this we would have found on our own as first time visitors.
Nice experience. Old traditional road and houses. Many restaurants that serve delicious italian food.Nice walk for nights
Very pretty. We went with a tour guide here. It is a pretty area with quaint streets. We visited Villa Farnesina with a tour guide. Beautiful!

Favorite area to stay in Rome . This district, if that is the proper name, but it is my favorite place to stay. Cute neighborhood. You feel transported to the 1600's. Lots of restaurants, both where the locals go and for tourist. It is also walking distance from the most important places in Rome.

Walking through the streets of History. I stayed in Trastevere on my recent visit to Rome. It is a food lover paradise. It is an easy walk from the historical area of Rome, just over the river to this great place to walk, drink and eat. It has a great vibe, and everyone I met was friendly and welcoming. If you find your self in Rome do not miss this gem of an area.

Charming!. I think it's a must to spend some time in Trastevere. Not only it's packed with great restaurants and interesting little stores it is also packed with history. It's great to walk along Via Guilia which was laid out during the reign of Pope Julius II (1503-13) where you can also see Raphael's house. The street is also lined with antiques stores.
cool neighborhood. There are so many cute little restaurants and bars in this area. We took a bike tour and really enjoyed this neighborhood.

Narrow streets and tasty food. Trastevere has been found by a lot of tourists and no wonder. The narrow streets lined by colourful buildings are beautiful. There are nice restaurants all over the place and the atmosphere seems to be more laid back than just across the bridge.

Unbelievably cool area. Trastevere should not be missed on a visit to Rome. The winding streets and little shops were so charming. We visited several restaurants and wine bars there - all very good. It is clearly the hipster area of Rome.

vacation 2016. We walked through the old town, stopped in a nice trattoria for a great pasta, and artichoke appetizer. The wine was excellent to accompany the meal. Walked through the small boutiques and made our way to the gelato counter. Very nice historic walk through

Peaceful area to spend an afternoon. Nice area with lots of restaurants. Main attraction being the church of Santa Maria. Check for the prices on the menus. Some restaurants are pricey for the same kind of food.

Across the Tiber river. By walking in Rome one can do, see a whole lot of things, but after having seen most of the tourists attractions, like Trevi fountaine, or Colosseum, walk across the Tiber river...great!

Wonderfull for dinning and enjoying a nice evening. Besides visiting the church St Maria de Trastevere, this neighborhood has a lot of small very nice family restaurants, with only a couple of tables. I had the best pasta and house wine in Rome there, so I highly recommend it.
Many hidden gems. There were many hidden shops and interesting finds along the streets. Definitely a place for people who love to explore and find joy in the unknown.
So glad I was recommended !. I would never have gone to this a bit off the beaten path of ROME... It is truly my favorite place to wonder and get lost and find a place for wine / dinner (&night life)

Authentic and vibrant!. Trastevere is only a twenty-minute walk from the main attractions and provides a nice setting for a wonderful evening, away from the crouds. Lots of excellent restaurants and terraces.

Trastevere, a hidden gem of Rome, avoid the crowds.. If you like travel but a re not a tourist and want to experience the real Rome, head to the Trastevere area of Rome. Off the beaten track you will find the "Real Rome" great architecture, street art, people, cafes and restaurants with a coo vibe.
nice area. This is a nice area. Buzzy, busy, full of shops and cafes and ristorantes. Very worth walking through and enjoying that lovely Italian architecture.

One afternoon in Trastevere to find out the real atmosphere of Rome. Maybe the best point of Rome during the late afternoon and night.Visit the church of Santa Maria Of Trastevere.Complete different from all the other churches in Rome with an amazing template.The place in front of it full of people around the stores nat trattorias.Visiting the narrow roads you will meet all the kind of man,bars,restaurants,stores of traditional goods and a very happy mood of the people around you.

trip to Rome. Rome ks an amazing city with so much to see and this is a must. Walking through the streets of Rome gives you such a feeling of the old city and its culture. The architect is totally amazing and when you stop to think most of it was done by hand it makes you appreciate it even more.
Cute little town. Our tour guide took us here and showed us the town. Very cute and the church is gorgeous. We would consider staying here the next time we are in Rome
Absolutely should visit. Among the historical atmosphere of Roma, you can spend your night and have a tasteful dinner at Trastevere. The streets are open for surprises like steet musicians and etc.

Restaurants galore and more.. We stayed on the other side of the river in Rome, and each night wandered across the bridge to explore the many restaurants in Trastevere. So many to choose from. Then later in the evening strolled along the river bank where dozens of pop-up stalls offering all sorts of goods were set up. Don't plan to eat early though. The sun sets late in summer and we found most restaurants don't open before 8pm or so.
Always fun. This a great place to wander and eat food. It is full of life, street stalls and performers. We often seemed to end up here and running for the tram to get home.

The happening place in Rome. We selected a rental property in Trastevere as on our prior trip and in reading it appeared to be the hip place to be in Rome. Indeed, the place came alive a night with the streets packed with people - the piazza's filled with musicians. There are a multitude of excellent and interesting restaurants. Plus it's walkable to pretty much all of Rome without being in the city central (we walked to the Borghese Gallery in about an hour). The tram runs from central Rome to Trastevere and you can take it to the train station if you'll be traveling out of Rome or to the airport.

A nice change to the old part of Rome. We were told that this is where the real people of Rome live. Lots of restaurants and bars, less tourists; we enjoyed a lot and it's a nice walk, e.g. from Piazza Navona
Lively and enchanting, even for Seniors. Away from the Main Street of Viale di Trastevere are narrow streets and alleys with wonderful restaurants and food shops. Felt very safe, even very late.
People watching in square. Loved this area. Enjoyed the little square with its cafes, gorgeous basilica and quaint buildings. My favourite.

Very interesting area to wander, day or night. We lived near by and was so glad. Great streets to wander around. Enjoyed the street vendors with tables outside at night. So many choices of where to eat and shop

A Village in the middle of Rome!. Trastevere will remind you a little the Village in Manhattan because of his own atmosphere, and the small streets full of restaurants, little shops and cafes.You won't find any McDonalds or Zara store, not even a Starbucks!!!You might like it or not, at night gets really busy with a young crowd, it is mostly frequented at lunch/dinner time due to the huge number of small restaurants, many of them for tourists, but try to seat on the stairs in Piazza Trilussa, looking at Ponte Sisto, the pedestrian bridge, and you will see a world of people passing in front of you.Maybe grab a slice of pizza at Boccaccia, just around the corner, or a Gelato at Checco el carrettiere, on Via Benedetta.Or go to eat where the locals go, at Hosteria Da Corrado, and you will have Massimo and his son Simone serving you with Angela and Roberta cooking: very poor decor, but real Roman food at a great price ( via Della Pelliccia).This is a small world of real Roman life that you can't miss!

Beautiful area, but almost too crowded to enjoy properly. We went to Trastevere really excited after hearing so many people in love with the area, but ended up a little disappointed due to the insane crowds.It was a very pretty area, but just make sure you prepare for a lot of people :)
One of my fav area. Trastevere has everything - special atmosphere, ancient beautiful churches, special shops , and great restaurants. You can spend there entire day alone..
Make time to go to Trastevere. Restaurants excellent here and the atmosphere was great. Bit tough to get there but it was worth it in the end

Unless I was staying nearby I would not visit. There is so much to see in Rome that with hindsight we would not have visited Trastevere. Yes, it is enjoyable to walk around the roads but you can do similar in the city. We did have a very good meal here for a reasonable price.
Wonderful to wander around. This was as I expected, with lots of little roads, beautiful architecture and inviting little bars and cafes around every corner

Amazing! . This is the area to stay in Rome! Far enough away from tourist stuff but within a 30 minute walk of everything. I love the atmosphere here. Kind of artsy and hip. All of the Italian come here to eat, drink and party. During the evening it's so happening here I loved it. So many great places to eat and drink at fantastic prices. I read a couple of reviews regarding graffiti and garbage. Graffiti yes there is a lot of it but it's part of the charm. Garbage no way it! It was very clean. Trust me this is the place to stay here. . Find yourself a great airbnb like we did. You won't regret it. More for younger crowd.
Have a wander!. This is an overlooked area of town. Full of life, bars, restaurants and shops. Great in the evening, very vibrant. I'd suggest just spending some time wandering around.

Fave Neighborhood of Rome!. We visited Rome for the first time toward the end of Aug., 2016 and this was our fave neighborhood of Rome. It's basically a hipsterish area, which gets really fun and cool in the evenings and feels very safe too. We came here both Thurs and Fri evenings and hit up a few bars and eateries. It's only some 15 mins walk from the center of Rome and it never feels unsafe.

The Heart of Rome. This area is a hidden gem, in the day you would pass & think nothing of it yet at night it is the place to be. Lots of great places to eat, good restaurants with authentic Italian food, funky bars with great tapas & sharing platters or street food at competitive prices with the hustle & bustle of local market stalls with jewelry crafts accessories etc every other corner you turn. It's very much like Venice with its narrow streets & being able to lose your sense of direction. Although I was pregnant & couldn't enjoy the alcoholic delights the cocktails in lots of bars looked amazing!It's over the river & a little out of the way but definitely worth a visit.
The best in roma . If you're a fan of small cosy streets full of flowers and vintage style... this is a place for you. Really lovely, with a lot of restaurants terrace across corners. Peaceful area
Best area of Rome at night. Trastevere is absolutely the place to be after sunset. A lot of street artists, music, local people and bars.

The Medieval Rome. If your visit in Rome is more than a few days, then you should have a walk in this old area. As it says its name, Transtevere, you have to cross the river to get there. It isn't far away from the center and it could be a nice stroll along its streets. The area doesn't have the monuments you can find everywhere in Rome, but you can visit the church Santa Maria di Transtevere and have a rest in one of the restaurants there. In my opinion you should go there in the evening when there are a lot of people and the place is full of life. We were there on a Saturday morning , around 11, and the place seemed empty and lifeless. But be aware that it isn't as impressive as the other part of the city.

Worth a visit. This suburb has quaint laneways with interesting shops and piazzas. It is also a bit quieter as it it a little way away from the touristy areas. It was a warm day and it was very pleasant walking down the shaded laneways discovering the shops

A Bit of Bohemian Rome. An interesting place to stroll around. Plenty of good people watching, shopping opportunities, eating/drinking options, and architectural details. Not as many art galleries as I expected. But you feel the vibe that many residents are into alternative lifestyles.

Overrated. I think this area was a bit overrated or maybe it should come with a disclaimer. If you want to stay up all night...every night and hear yelling, screaming and partying all night, THIS is the perfect place to stay. The house wine was great in every restaurant but we found better food outside of this area. Venture out. Staying central to attractions is cool but you can stay in other areas and still be close to attractions.
Good to see and feel. This district is really nice and lively part of Rome. I suggest not to miss it and feel the vibe of Trastevere.
Must Eat Here. Great area off the main attractions. Excellent food and service at better prices than the high traffic tour areas. Would highly recommend.

Place to relax . On the other side of the Tiber river, you'll find the right place to raise a pause, relax and enjoy your trip. Walk without purpose between the narrow streets, wonder around between the unique shops, have a drink and something to eat and I'll guarantee you want regret your visit.
Great little part of Rome. We visited one evening and walked around on the narrow streets and enjoyed all the sights and smells of the different restaurants.

Vibrant neighborhood with lovely shops and restaurants. We were directed to this part of Rome by the driver who picked us up at the airport. He spoke little English but wanted to make sure we saw this part of his city. Trastevere literally means across the river. We took a leisurely walk to reach the area and were entertained by the unique parking jobs we saw along the way. The restaurants and shops are not on the main road but must be reached by going through some small alleys and reminded me a bit of Harry Potter world at Universal Orlando in that this whole area seems hidden but then opens up with so much to see!
Must. Go walk and get lost in this beautiful neighbourhood/part of rome. Great coffee and restaurants and lovely atmosphere. The best part was thet it was peaceful compared to the old city.
See the Rome the Locals do. Great break from the designer boutiques around Spanish steps and crowds of the Vatican. Local shops, restaurants, markets, and walks. Excellent in evening.

Busy, cool, fun. It's a vibrant area, especially in the evenings. Loads of bars and restaurants, people milling, shops open until late. We were lucky to have more-or-less randomly booked an apartment in the area, and loved being in the heart of a neighbourhood with a clear sense of identity.
Beautiful area of Rome. A little off the beaten path, but a beautiful area by the river with lots of nice restaurants, it's a good break from the hustle and bustle of Rome.

The place to stay when in Rome!. I had never been to Rome before and did plenty of research to find a good place for us to stay while in Rome. Trastevere, is like the name says, across the river Tiber from ancient Rome and its many stupendous attractions. I wanted to stay close in, with ease of transport, both to and from the airport, and within Rome using trams, metro, and buses to get around, plus the key ingredient, where locals actually live. The great benefit is the ease of finding great places to eat without paying the tourist surcharge and sometimes finding the mediocre dressed up to impress. Trastevere is full of tourists to be sure, but also has neighborhoods where grabbing panini and cappuccino elbow up to the bar at 1000 with a dozen locals catching up on morning news and talk is far more fun than being overcharged for the same being surrounded by tourists.

Fun way to get away from tourists . My husband and I went to dinner at Ristorante le Mani in pasta. The food was amazing, service was good. The seating was a little weird, it's a small place so be ready to sit right next to other people. After dinner we walked into a little tavern called the hole. We had a great time, the staff was super friendly.

Most Charming . Loved this part of Rome! It's maze like streets are lined up with small artisans boutique stores, cafes and mom and pop restaurants. It is absolutely charming! It's worth getting lost in its streets!
.. Nice to see and enjoy.. Must visit when in Rome ! Had a nice lunch in nearby osteria.. Very recommended!
Cute little streest. cafes, little stores, amazing food, wonderful feeling. cats, laundry hanging outside, beautiful buildings and apartments. lucky Romans!

Beautiful Town. This is a beautiful Roma town ,if you want to see life go in the evening ,full of life, take a walk through old Roman times streets,there are are lots of shops,eating places. Don't miss the walk arount the Tiber river,lots of shops and restaurant. Lots of churches and very narrow beautiful alleys to explore.

Interesting. Lovely area with bars, restaurants and some shops (craft stalls, etc). Visited during a rainy evening. Most bars had outdoor, under cover seating, with tall gas heaters to add comfort for guests.Nice place for a casual meal and evening drinks.

Best place for food - nice walk along the Tiber too.. We went during the evening and there was a huge fair along the river side (Aug 2016). From the Monumento a Vittorio Emanuele II it's an easy walk to the Trastevere area.

Wander and enjoy. Great place to take in the local culture. Wander the streets, stop for a coffee, and ice cream or a wine. Plenty to see, check out the architecture, the narrow streets are a joy for walkers, something new at every turn.
Amazing. Such a lovely area, plenty of great places to eat, drink, sit & enjoy. Small streets, packed with amazing architecture. Really worth exploring
Gorgeous area of Rome. I highly recommend a visit to Trastevere. The cobbled streets lined with eateries, greenery and coffee shops are lovely.

Fantastic base to explore Rome. We stumbled across Trastevere on our previous visit to Rome and loved it so it was our first choice for somewhere to stay during our recent trip to Rome last month. It has everything - stunning old buildings, ancient cobbled streets, a huge range of well priced cafes, bars, restaurants and shops. Trastevere is next to river and is well connected by public transport. Despite being close to everything it is not overrun by tourists and maintains an authentic, relaxed Italian vibe.
Nothing spectacular but makes you think. Amazing to see the streets and buildings and to think how it has changed since its original construction.
Great neighborhood. Stayed in an Air B&B in this neighborhood. We felt very safe at all times. Great restaurants. Made our trip to Rome great!

Beautiful and more traditional. Absolutely loved walking around Trastevere, lovely little roads and lot of bars and restaurants. Feels much less 'touristy'. Make sure you visit the botanical gardens (orto botanico) as there are great views over Rome

My favourite part of Roma!. If you ever are lucky enough to visit Rome, then you must stay in Trastevere. You must!Full of history, quiet AND busy areas. Restaurants, bars and life, it cannot be bettered.

Vibrant and fun. This is an excellent area to head to in the evening. It is full of restaurants and bars which would appeal to a variety of people. Spent two nights here and they were the best of our trip!

Amazing!. Recently stayed here for three nights with my boyfriend! It's amazing! It's a part of Rome that comes alive at night. A plethora of bars, restaurants, cafes, and gelato places that are wonderful and open well into the night.10 Minute walk to Castel Sant Angelo - where connections to everything else in the city is available.

Bars taverns cafes. Although there is no metro station nearby, this location had many and very nice taverns and bars. Not all of them are good and due to the river nearby there is a smells of humidity in some neighbourhoods. the square with santa maria de trastevere is really nice with street musicians and happenings. Great food and great time there

Best 'hood in Rome. Artists neighborhood in the heart of Rome with tons of character. This is where the night life lives. Lots of local people & easy to walk or take the tram "8". It's next to the river where there's shopping & some interesting & weird restaurants.

A Little Gem. The character of the places changes from relaxed and peaceful in the afternoon suitable for a light lunch and exploring the town to a busy, vibrant and exciting place in the evening ideal for dinner or a drink. The places comes alive after dark but still has an atmosphere where it is confortable to be with children. Well worth a visit or several that is easily reached by bus or tram.

Fantastic way to spend the evening. Our family wandered around here and it was amazing. Tons of outdoor cafes, shops, a market along the river. Walking along cobblestone streets in this charming, ancient area was a highlite. We went around 6:00pm and it was lovely. It is about a 20 min walk from Piazza Venezia, cross one of the bridges and you are there.
The goat. Very nice place to go and hang out, with freinds, nice terrace, good music, and terrific service, place to be in Rome.

Swarming nightlife. We went here to have some drinks and to see where all the young people of Rome go out to party. Apparently this was the place. But EVERYONE was out. We went there mid august, and all the streets were crowded. Once we moved further into the area, there were a lot more bars and the age of the people were lower than 35. In Rome during the summer until October I think, they have sort of a city-rule about no drinking outside. But it seems this doesn't count for Trastevere, or restaurants in general. The drinks further into Trastevere are prices around 5-9 €. Well worth visiting for a night out in Rome

One stop shopping for great meals and drinks. This area of Rome, just across the Tiber river on the West Bank, is full of excellent restaurants and bars. The social scene is going on every night. Even on a Monday night, the streets were full of couples, groups of friends, and families strolling and enjoying the food and drink opportunities. We went back a second night after having such a fun time on our first night there. It would be hard to recommend a restaurant, as every place we ate was really good, and there did not seem to be any places that were not full of tourists as well as locals, all seemingly enjoying themselves.
Very Disappointing. Saw Trastevere on a panoramic night tour. Wasnt very impressed. Much nicer near The Trevi Fountain. Probably in day light it might to show to offer more.

Trastevere a little gem in the centre of Rome.. Trastevere is delightful. Restaurants, outdoor seating areas, rooftop gardens and hanging greenery amid so much history makes this area a pleasant place to spent the day. After two visits to Rome I have decided it Is my most favourite place to visit and stay.

Great base to stay when visiting Rome. Easy access to centre of Rome, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, the Vatican etc via Tram. Great restaurants and bars in the area, all within walking distance. Felt safe walking there even at night time. Gorgeous buildings and amazing architecture.Plenty cafes, bank machines, you can buy Tram tickets from the Tabacchi shops dotted all around.Walk down away from the centre of Rome, there are some clothing shops too.

Our Favorite place for dinner. a wonderful fun piazza atmosphere with great restaurants, especially Grazia's and the Maitre D Angelo! Also the restaurant Tommarelo right across from it...they are owned by the same Italian family

Buzzing Night time area. We came to Trestavere 2 nights running to take in the night time atmosphere and street entertainment, and to eat. Great atmosphere and a wide variety of food and price options. A walk along the riverbank is a must also....

Different. Relatively short walk ( 3/4 hour from Colosseum easy going ) gets you to a completely different are over the river. Interesting area that used to be relatively poor. Good restaurants and pleasant wander.

Spectaclar character and architecture. Walking the streets in Trastevere is an enjoyment in itself. The beautiful blend of architecture, greenery, that is maintained by residents and the blend of architecture still make this a wonderful place to walk around (and eat of course!).

A charmming place.. Trastevere is a very cool place in Rome. It gethers many diferent bars, restaurants and stores. It is nice to walk around and maybe pick a place to sit and have fun with your friends. Or have a romantic dinner. It is really full of great options.
Disappointed. Ostaria restaurant very expensive didn't know sea bass by weight meal was over £100 for 3! Ouch area appears to be better for large groups at night in bars
Beautiful place. This is one of the best place of Rome, really nice. it's not far from the center, easy to walk. We suggest to see it

Lovely to get lost in. We spent an afternoon just getting lost round here. It was wonderful. We stopped for lunch in Pimms Good and later had a gelato whilst resting in some steps. Lovely buildings and cute shops.

You should stay here!. We spent 4 days here! Although the place is more like Monastiraki in Greece you can find many places to eat or have a coffee or a drink at night! There are many budget friendly appartments to rent there.

Beautiful District. Quaint district, take the tram from Piazza Venezia and discover the little cobbled restaurants and alleys on foot. Lovely little stalls with quirky products and unique shops. A Must visit at least once!

One if my favourite areas in Rome. Only visited on my penultimate day and made sure I returned on the last day too. Great area full of character and great restaurants ; cafes and shops. Highly recommend visiting!
Fun Walk Around. Loved walking through this neighborhood. Wish we could have been there at night for dinner...but didn't make it.

Interesting section of the city. I was sent to this section of the city to find a restaurant recommended by a friend. I got there by train and very much enjoyed wandering through the area, enjoying the architecture and windows.

Cute ,cute ,cute this is ROMA the one in the movies. Amazing lively district with many bars ,cafe and restaurant ,people are super super nice and cool .smilling and the small cafe is nice for aperitivo. Do not hesitate to take a spritz in a terrasse and to walk in all the main and the small streets . Its a super lovely and romantic architecture with goldie colors .

Definitely worth a visit . Easily accessible on foot from centre of Rome by crossing Garibaldi bridge or preferably Sisto bridge if staying near Campo di Fiori, Pantheon, Colosseum or Piazza Venezia. Otherwise take tram line 8 and get off at Belli tram stop (many buses stop here too). Lots of restaurants, cafes, little shops and churches to visit. Sleepy and tranquil during the day for an enjoyable walk, comes alive at night time.

Tonnarello Restaurant a great place. Stopped at this restaurant for a drink. Jimmy and Klaudio were very pleasant and helpful. Had a few beers and they served us chips, peanuts, pizza and french fries ON THE HOUSE. Inside very clean, restaurant very nice and bathrooms clean. Thumbs Up Guys ! Thanks from Canada
Beautiful with bars and restaurants . We like a lot that place because it is full with decent restaurants and bars. Many young people and tourists are there so we suggest it absolutely.
Must visit!. We didn't know about this area prior to our trip but it is a must visit. Live music, good food and a more relaxed Boho feel than the rest of Rome.
Nice area. Trastevere is a nice area with pubs, restaurants, cafes etc. Is a nice area to relax after a long walking day in Rome

great time!...... We went to the botanical park to watch the sunset...it was beautiful and what an amazing view of Rome from above. We came across a fountain on the way "down the hill"....a number of people were sitting on the edge cooling their feet...so we did too! It was a lovely unexpected surprise "find" and one of the best parts of the evening. We had a delicious dinner then walked around ...only to find live music in "the square!" There was quite a crowd of people dancing and having fun...another unexpected and terrific surprise in Trastevere! We never expected to be busting a move to Uptown Funk outside on a beautiful summer night in Italy......AWESOME!!!!

The best of Rome. Trastevere is the Italian side of Rome. The whole neighbourhood is a labyrinth with good restaurants, cafes, shops and music. The Piazza Santa Maria has one of the oldest basilicas. We had to come here to eat finally a good pizza, because in the city centre there is no chance to eat a delicious one. I can recommend the Tonnarello restaurant to eat a really good pizza. It was very hard to go back to our hotel, because there was no public transport after 9o'clock in the evening.

Great place to eat. Was advised to go to this area to eat by our airport taxi driver.
He wasn't wrong as it was a great place to see and eat.
There were loads of restaurants around and the price was pretty reasonable
Would definitely go again

A wonderful discovery. We stayed in nearby Monteverde during our trip, so visited Trastevere a couple of times.
