I'd recommend dining here at least once during your visit - the atmosphere is great; really lively and there are so many good restaurant to choose from. Its probably easier to find somewhere reliable here than in the centro storico - it's less touristy and overpriced. It's worth booking at the weekend as it can get very busy around 9pm with queues for tables.

Nice day stroll or at night. Trastevere is the cool place in Rome. Cafes and shops and small streets. There is a lot to see so I was there a whole day, also a lot of nights. I can´t really descripe it, just go there :)
Neighborhood feel with funky vibe. great break from the daily grind of Rome to wonder through narrow walkways and grab a drink at one of the many cafes and bars.

Wonderful neighbourhood!. We stayed in Trastevere in August 2016 and just love this area of Rome. During the day it is a bit quieter but there is always plenty of life. Evenings are even better - piazzas, great restaurants and the river walk are all wonderful!

Away from the crowds. Beautiful place in the hart of Rome but away from the touristic madness. In August most of the businesses and some restaurants were closed (vacation time for Romans) but we had a great time walking around, shopping and having lunch. Most of the people around us were Italians, some visiting Rome, some locals, so it felt different, more traditional. If you have time take a walk ...

This is where you wanna eat. Trastevere is where you want to have dinner. Wander across the bridge and into the most atmospheric parts of Rome. On every corner there are amazing restaurants and at night the place just comes alive. It's a must.

A Great Meal with Friends. We called last minute and managed to get a table for our party of 8. We really enjoyed our entire meal but the pasta was the highlight. I would encourage you to try their award winning Ravioli. I found it a bit heavy but absolutely delicious. I would advise booking early and getting a spot on the patio!

Average in Rome. Central located. Everything of the most important sights in walking distance. Some good "fine dining" restaurants but not many. Its bautiful like rest of Central Rome but more modern but its not exceptional. You can og there if you are close, but its not a "must see" in Rome,
Nice area to visit.. This area is much less congested with tourists and you can have a wonderful meal for much less. The church is an interesting and quick site.

Younger heart of Rome. This place is so lively, beautiful and full of beauty! Lots of cafes, free spirited people, drinks, delicious food, live music in the streets, beautiful lightings, amazing buildings.. Ideal. My favorite part of Rome for spending evenings. Here u can feel how eclectic the city can be, with (almost) all the major sightseeings on the other side of the river (excluding Vatican City of course), Trastevere still manages to surprise and please you with its uniqueness and sincerity.

The most beautiful part of Rome!. Trastevere is the part of Rome on the other side of the river. You can easily pass across the river through the many beautiful bridges. Tiber is a really nice river and hat a lot of green. Next to the river there are many shops and places to walk. Trastevere is full with little roads and beautiful traditional houses. It is like you are back in time. You must definitely visit it and walk through the streets.

Off The Beaten Track, and So Worth It. When you're sick of the tourist crush, head across the bridge and have a quiet wander. There are loads of small cafes, bars and restaurants that are worth a visit.
Beautiful. Trastevere is a calm getaway from the hectic life in the rest of Rome. Romantic area with restaurants, churches, small shops and gelato. Well worth a visit!
This was real Rome. Trastevere is not easy to get to, but it is a piece of unspoilt Rome. There are small passages with restaurants and bars everywhere. Go and lose yourself.

EXPO - great restaurants. Lots of nice bars and restaurants in this area, so good for walking about in the evening by the river. On our visit, there was an Expo, which meant lots of pop up restaurants to choose from with a great vibe.

Hidden delight... Spent a day walking around Rome and stumbled upon Trastevere. What a delight. This is where the locals hang out. Off the tourist track and well worth a wander around. Best pizza anywhere- sold by weight.

Engaged in Trastevere. We had a lovely experience with Trastevere, starting along the Tiber River with the shops that line the water. From the bruschetta to the pizza, the spaghetti to the house wine and the beautiful alley-ways and wonderful restaurants, this is an absolute charm in Rome. You'll be missing out if you don't go!

Nice place for evening walk, drinks, dinner.. We lived nearby, so we have the opportunity to walk through a few times. Is always nice, specially in the evenings. Lots of good restaurants, gelaterias, etc.

One of our favorite neighborhoods!. I loved walking around this very safe, bustling neighborhood. We enjoyed a couple of fabulous restaurants, and just enjoyed walking around. Across the river from the main highlights of Rome, it is easily accessible by walking or by bus or subway. Lovely part of town.

Favorite Rome Neighborhood To Get Lost In. This neighborhood is TOO cute! Cobble stone streets that just don't stop, peppered with boutiques, restaurants, cafe's and bars. You can easily spend hours (and you SHOULD spend hours) lazily exploring this neighborhood and stopping to get a few refreshments while you watch the wold go by.
My wife&me. Alternative region of Rome to get some hippie places do eat, drink and ice cream!! However not the best area to know of Rome. To eat search better Osteria and Trattoria.
Rocking all through the evening!. Great area for lunch, dinner, drinks or just people watching. Grab yourself an Aperol Spritz and soak up the atmosphere! Very safe for families, relaxed atmosphere!
Food heaven . The best eating in all of Rome ..check out tonnerllo on the corner there's likely a queue but with good reason

One of the most beautyful and full of life in Rome. Trastevere is full of life all the time. You can go to a church, get a drink, eat real italian food or just to get around enjoying the youth atmosphere specially during the sunset. Many artis are around and you can see their work or hear their work and is very pleasure.You need to get around at least one time during you visit to Rome!

Loved it!. A very nice area, small alleys, cafes, restaurants, little shops, a small market, take your time to stroll around and explore this part of the city. Don't forget to go and see the church Sta. Maria in Trastevere, a true gem in the heart of Trastevere, free to enter.

Brilliant!. This part of Rome is incredibly lively, and is without a doubt one of the must sees. There are plenty restaurants available, and there is many artists painting there work. Eating out in this area is also relatively cheap.

Well worth a wander. Best part of Rome by far. Well worth a wander by day and night. There are so many amazing bistros, bars and restaurants to experience. The place comes alive at night and there are numerous piazzas and streets to just explore and soak in; all very beautiful. A lot of the bars are cash only so be prepared.

Great neighbourhood to sit and watch people. The neighbourhood of Trastevere is situated on the other side of the river opposite to the historic center of Rome. This neighbourhood really comes to live in the evening when the streets are filled with tourists and locals alike. There is no metro stop nearby so the only way to get here is either by bus/tram or walking (about 10 minutes from Piazza Navona or 25minutes from the Vatican). You can find all sorts of restaurants here. Pasta, Pizza, Icecreams, enotecas, osterias, panini's etc. Make sure not to miss the little squares and visit all the little streets to find the hidden gems.
Eat where locals eat. Great place to eat we went two nights in a row. Pasta as cheap as 6 euros, we enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. Many restaurants to choose from.

Great place to see and been seen.. Trastevere is a great area to have dinner or just sit drink good wine and watch people. I found this area really nice and upbeat.It could be crowded at time but very easy to walk around.
Quaint and quiet side of Rome. We enjoyed staying in Trastevere. The rates were reasonable, the food fabulous, the staff courteous. We felt like we were in Italy and not a tourist trap!
Nice last afternoon.. Decided rest was needed by last day, had great inTrastevere. We had lunch at da Enzo, it was one of the best meals of the trip!

Always go there. Trastevere is big area in Rome but when you go there you should go down the bridge many tourists the don't know about it there are many cafes and restaurants and small shops,I recommend to go there before the sunset to see the beautiful view.

Great for an evening stroll.. This neighbourhood really comes alive at night -- full of restaurants, little shops and street hawkers. A lot of the restaurants mainly cater to tourists and can be quite pricey. Be sure to check out a few different places before you settle; there are plenty with reasonably priced pizzas and pasta dishes.It seems like most people come out for dinner at 9-10 pm, so come early if you want to guarantee yourself a table!

Terveese. Forgot the fancy restaurant. And take aa walk along the Tibre.There you will find the life of the city many food and drink options..Everyone laughing and. Enjoying Rome, enough with the waiters with. Attitudes

Grazia and Graziella. my daughter and I had a lovely in this small restaraunt in this enchanting area of Rome. The gnocchi and lasagne were delicious, along with a great local wine made for a perfect dinner

True local food experience. Went there on small group (10) Twilight tour - fantastic food and wine experience - great value at 94€ per head - sounds expensive but it's worth it. Four hours of fun in non tourist area. Saw families enjoying themselves at night, all safe and happy. Google Eating Italy Food Tours.

Vibrant and Fun Neighborhood.... Trastevere has become much more popular in the last few years. A great way to see another part of the city without driving. Lively, wonderful nightlife with many good restaurants.

Lovely quaint neighborhood . Loved this neighborhood. Quiet during the day and alive at night. Love that it's more locals and because of the small cobblestone streets, not much traffic. I'd live there for sure!

Lives up to its rep. Enjoyed our stay in Rome, from our little B&B on the 'other side of the Tiber' hence Trastevere's name. Vibrant, quirky, good food and great access points to the city. Listen to Rick Steve's podcast & recommend Arco del Lauro B&B to stay ( clean, comfortable, great service).

nice area. it was a great day
nice basilic
church
little restaurant
little price
every where nice place to rest great area

Fabulous area for bar/restaurant hopping. We lived in Trastevere for the duration of our stay in Rome and I am so pleased we did! Whilst we obviously wanted to see all the main sites, my husband and I also greatly enjoy bar/restaurant hopping and Trastevere is just perfect for this. The small streets are picture perfect and full of atmosphere and there was so much positive energy in the area from dawn till the early hours. After a day of site seeing (we walked everywhere and Trastevere is not a long distance to most places of interest and only 10 mins to the Vatican), it was great to get back and relax in this area. Definitely one of our highlights and would stay in this area again for sure if/when we return to Rome.
A fun place. Trastevere is a fun place to get lost in. Lots to see and do, plenty of places to eat and drink. Should be part of any Rome itinerary.

Quirky worth a visit. We went to Trastevere during afternoon to check it out, if you come in off the pedestrian bridge it starts on street to left and just continues, restuarants a few bars, a few tourist shops and traders selling fake bags etc, if you go right to the end of main street there is a restaurant on left side its by far the cheapest any where in Rome and food is good 5 euros fresh pizzaa couple of beers total 11 euros, you won't get near it on evening its rammed with people. We returned in evening when area explodes with people, fire dancers, musicians a big buzz lots of young people. Restaurants that open in the evening have caught on to popularity of area and its reflected in prices, not great food but acceptable 80-100 euros with wine for two people would be average, worth a visit taxi from Via Del Corso 8-10 euro
Very lively and nice place to have a dinner. Very lively and nice place to have a dinner, in that place so many restaurants and bars, where reasonable prices, tasty Rome cuisine.

quaint cafes, shops and cobblestone streets. This area is known to be older than rome which frequented by tourists located on the other side of the Tiber. Not many toursity relics to see but great place to enjoy a walk, sit down at a cafe and relax. Some of the restaurants in the more touristy parts tends to be a rip off so bes to read a review or two before stepping into one. After a long day at the vatican its nice ot come here and relax. There are no metro stations here so options are walking, bus or tram.

Vibrant. Vibrant neighborhood with lots of good restaurants, and a really good scene at night. We walked over the river to get there which was a lovely walk and very safe and lit. Seems like there are tons of options to be out and about, bars and restaurants all over the place, and I would definitely go back.

Great area to explore. I loved the Trastevere. We were attempting to go to a more local neighborhood to get away from our touristy Pantheon neighborhood. We ended up at a bar that I loved called the Hole. The bartender looked exactly like Gerard Butler (need I say more), but the sad thing is, we went there for a restaurant called Da Enzo next door that was an epic fail. Don't do it if you are American. Over salted pasta that is way too al dente.

Great people, wonderful Tiber river walk. Take a warm weekend stroll down the river. People watching was a blast, seems that this is the local place to go strut on a weekend night. Packed full of great drinks, people and food.

a good neighborhood to see. This is part of Rome very few tourists venture into. it is where romans live and work daily. the cafe's and restaurants are pleanty and the shops are fun. the buildings are amazing. take a walk.. you will be amazed.

Interesting . . .. An interesting area to explore. We walked it rather quickly because of time constraints but wished we had more time. Lots of narrow streets and interesting restaurants. Will definitely go back next trip to this amazing city.

Average. We did a walk through Trastevere .... was ok but would be totally ok to miss it if you are on a short trip. On a longer trip to Rome its a nice side walking tour for a bit of a change of pace
Its the area. Interesting part of Rome here, the flavor of the city really comes through. don't be in a hurry, Rome is quite compact in the center.

Best part of Italy! . I love this area of Italy,it's still busy with tourists but not as hectic as other areas.It's lovely in the evenings to walk around the cobbled streets and find a lovely restaurant to eat at. Or just sit and watch the world go by at a piazza,there's always local street performers around to enjoy the summers evenings!A more local feel to Italy!

The Must-See Romantic Roman Neighborhood!. Everyone must see this lovely, ancient area of Rome! Beautiful churches, succulent aromas from many restaurants, and tons of history to see, as you stroll the ancient narrow streets in this Roman neighborhood. Even better, we booked a walking tour with an English guide, who took us to many quaint and important sights, both historical and romantic. Our tour ended with a fantastic dinner in a private villa in that very neighborhood. It was amazing! Booked this fantastic tour through the Dark Rome website. What an experience!

Not so exciting. While I'm glad we spent some time here, we found it a bit sleepy. The basilica is okay, but after seeing so many, it was not so exciting. If you want to see another "quiet neighborhood," I recommend the area around the Piramide Metro stop. We loved two places especially: Flávio al Velavevodetto for lunch and Volpetti for gourmet food shopping. Also, seeing the pyramid is amazing. There were no tourists in this area when we went and only locals for lunch. I had an amazing rabbit dish after days of eating mostly pizza for lunch.

Excellent Location. We stayed in Trastevere (pronounced Trast-every)for 4 nights on a first visit to Rome for a 40th birthday trip. Quaint, beautiful cobbled streets, lots of locals enjoying outdoors life, plenty of lovely restaurants and bars all lit up at night. Look out for street entertainment, open air cinema in the many Piazza. I believe there was a festival on the last two weeks of July so there was lots going on. Stalls and bars all along the River which was great to walk along in the evening.Take the number 115 bus up the hill for amazing views of Rome where you can also find a couple of bars and snack food. We went just before sunset so where able to enjoy the sunset and Rome lighting up. Continue on this bus down the other side of the hill, get off at the river to walk through to the Vatican Museums. The 115 is circular so you can jump back on it and you will soon be back where you started.The H bus will take you to and fro Roma Termini and Trastevere.Jump on the tram no. 8 just 6 stops to take you into the centre right beside Roman Forum and Colosseum. Although if you don't mind walking it's not far.We flew into Ciampino airport. Bought a bus ticket from the Terravison or SIT bus for around €5 to Roma Termini, then we bought a 72 hour travel pass from Roma Termini which was valid for tram, bus and metro. The H bus took us to Trastevere. There is no metro where we were in Trastevere but buses and trams where very easy and frequent. It was very hot so found hopping on transport saved our strength a little.Fill up your water bottle for free at the "big noses" on the streets which are water fountains which look like fire hydrants. All though there aren't really public toilets there was a toilet in every little bar and restaurant we went to although not always very clean.We loved Rome and Trastevere and would definitely come back.

I have to agree filthy. What a shame the local authorities seem to have such little regard for civic pride. Thank goodness ancient Romans left so much to see. Little else would draw me back, the smell of urine in the streets, peole sleeping in every park and so much litter and ugly graffiti! I have travelled the world and never seen so much squalor in a capital city. The only plus - free water fountains that I trust keep plastic waste levels down. Come on people of Rome have some pride!
Quiet side of Rome. A must to see with alleyways offering ice cream parlours,snack bars, quaint eateries. A getaway from hustle & bustle from central Rome.

Great Neighborhood- This is where our apartment was. Best restaurants, pizzerias, gelato, and cafes.
Comes alive after 8pm. We loved walking the cobblestones and finding little places to eat.

More than just restaurants.. Most people go here just for the restaurants which is definitely worth it but go early morning and walk around the streets and see what real Trastavere is like. It is a lovely neighborhood.

Romantic paradise. Trastevere is one of the most memorable things we have seen in Rome - old shabby streets, full of small local restaurants, wine cellars and vintage shops, flowers and colours... If you are searching for perfect spot for romantic stroll, Trastevere is the right place to aim for.
Great Vibe. Many great restaurants here. Very nice neighborhood with a lot to see. You could walk for hours and enjoy the locals and everything they have to offer. .
Quirky neighbourhood, great at night. We had our last night's dinner in Trastevere - more alternative, smaller and more lively than the big center. Definitely worth a stroll!
An absolute must!!. I would place this right up there with the best sites of Rome. We arrived in Rome at lunch time and then had an afternoon here just having a few drinks and dinner. So cool!!
Good restaurants. It's worth a walk around and got some nice food here. I walked from near the colosseum which was a bit much though

Lots to see, great places to eat. Trastevere is a wonderful area to base yourself to tour Rome. Just across the Tiber from all of the main sites of the city, it also is home to a few jewels of its own: Santa Maria de Trastevere, St. Cecilia and the Church of St. Francis. It also has a lively night life and is a joy just to wander around.

Trastevere - cute area. Trastevere is a super cute area of Rome! Has lots of restaurants and shops to check out. If you're needing an area to stay in, or wanting to find a trendy area, would recommend this area!

Absolute Gem!. Visit this area across the river for a small town feel. Tons of little restaurants, bakeries, and bars nestled in little walkways. Most restaurants are affordable and there is a vibrant nightlife with art vendors, musicians, and dancers. So much fun!

Beautiful and lively neighborhood. We just spent 10 days in Trastevere, and loved its charming narrow alleys and streets, array of excellent trattorias and little family restaurants, and cool shops. My daughter and I felt very safe walking around Trastevere, even late at night. It's location is central, and we walked to Trevino fountain, Pantheon, Vatican, Campo market, Piazza Navona, Gianicolo Hill for the amazing view of the entire city. Dar Poeta has excellent pizza. Mama Frites has the best French fries... Located on Viccolo del Cinque and opened late. There is a little wine bar next door with a Buddha statue inside, the place is so cool, charming and prices are reasonable.

Nice area. Cute area, supposedly where locals go to eat (so we were told) all we could see were tourists wondering around - some very pretty streets and nice restaurants - we also went to see the church Santa Maria Trastevere - stunning old church, otherwise not much else to see in this area

Visit and get lost. We visited and were able to spend a bit of our time just wondering it was one of my favorite activities. We found great seating areas for a drink in the shade while watching the world go by as well as seeing beautiful buildings everywhere we looked.

Wish I spent more time here. Beautiful area of Rome!. We went here at the end of our first day in Rome. We were clearly tired, so we didn't spend much time in Trastevere. Our goal was food, which was easy to find. There are tons of cute restaurants in the area. It is not as touristy as other places in Rome, which was refreshing. Take your time and soak it all in. I wish I did!
Wonderful.. Fabulous area. Lots of old, narrow streets. Lots of places to eat. Excellent restaurant in front of Santa Maria. Sabbatini. Really good.

Terrific area. I've been holidaying in Rome for a few years now and we always stay in this district. It is both lively and 'laid back' at the same time. At festa time it can be very lively - into the small hours, but we have always found it to be very safe - just take the usual precautions. There are a number of highlights in the area -espescially Santa Maria in Trastevere - make sure you see the mosaics inside. There are a number of bars and Caffè in the area along with a great selection of restaurants. If you go a little further in you are more likely to avoid the obvious 'tourist traps', although to be fair, you would be really unfortunate to have a bad meal

Too much graffiti on buildings. Six visits to Rome and never visited this area. Disappointed at graffiti on the buildings and some rundown areas. Had delicious pizza in area but don't have name of restaurant, sorry. I would skip this area if you are short on time
My favorite Roman neighborhood. Trastevere is charming, artistic, different and also very foodie oriented. A real paradise for a buongustaio like me :)

Very quaint!. On one of those days where we walked and walked and then walked some more around the city, we enjoyed an afternoon meandering through Trastevere. It looked like something out of a movie with the cute little cafes and twisted streets. Definitely gives you a different historical feel than other parts of the city. Not a ton of "tourist" sites - more just worthwhile to soak it all in.

A very nice area to explore in Rome!. This neighborhood is full of life, music, people, good food and great places to have a drink. This a good area to just walk around and feel the atmosphere. The small streets are very pedestrian, with only a car or a moped that passes by once in a while. Now that is a nice change from the chaotic traffic of most of Rome! So get over there, chill out and have a good time!

Great way to explore. Great area to just walk around. Lots of small shops and cafes. We enjoyed the area in the afternoon just stopping in at all of the small places. On Friday night here was a street festival and the entire area was really active.

Great atmosphere with great restaurants. If you want to experience life in Rome without just the sightseeing, I'd recommend visiting Trastevere which is very Italian with good restaurants and a great atmosphere overall. It was lovely walking around the area.

Bit disappointed. The area was interesting but not as good to explore or as interesting or as well maintained as the more common central areas around Trevi, Pantheon and Navona etc. If time is limited don't waste it visiting this area.

My favorite neighborhood in Rome. This neighborhood makes me dream.It has an old world charm with the narrow cobble stone streets. it is super romantic to walk around amidst these beautiful ochre and pink color houses, and the beautiful green ivy growing over the walls. There is such a rich character to this neighborhood and personality. You see cats hanging around in their territories, and you really feel like you are almost in some small town in the country side. It is not chaotic amongst all the cars like the other parts of Rome. A lot of the ares is pedestrian only so you can really enjoy a peaceful walk. I recommend walking around early mornings or evenings. Some areas do get a bit more congested with some bars overflowing out into the streets, but its a great area to sit in a cafe and have a drink and people watch.

Cool place. Different feel from most of Rome proper. We enjoyed meandering in the streets here. It is a bit Greenwich Village-ish but cool to visit. We never made it back over at night, which is when everyone says it is at its best. Would recommend it as a stop -- day or night.

Bohemian neighborhood. My favourite neighborhood in Rome. Walking thru it's narrow streets is an attraction itself. Besides it, it has amazing and cheap pasta restaurants (with fresh pasta, some of them cook it in front of you), also cheap beer near the main square (can't remember the name) with live musician.It's like walking thru streets 300 years ago. Well, Rome will make you feel like this all the time, but especially on this neighborhood.To go back to the city center you gotta take a bus, no subway around.
Nice neighbourhood!. Great place to hang out by night, full of good restaurants and entertainments. A place to visit in the city of Rome.

Must Feel. Every step in Rome is unforgetable, but Trastavere is one of the parts that I like the most. It's romantic, amazing... You walk through centuries there... Now I see, it's difficult to describe. You must feel it. Don't miss it!!!

Great place to stay. We stayed in a small hotel near the river in Trastevere and found this area to be more friendly and cheaper than the centre of Rome. Some lovely bars serving really good lunches for set prices and very interesting internal decor!

Best night of my two weeks in Italy!. LOVE this neighborhood in the evening. Go after 8 pm. The food is good. The shops are fun. Great place to wander or just sit and unwind. Hidden treasures around every corner - got some amazing photos here.

A wonderful experience . Trastevere is very much like the St Germain district on the West Bank of the Seine in Paris and it is so alive at night! What a wonderful afternoon and evening we had. We sat out in the piazza and enjoyed the most fantastic ambience. People eating, drinking, talking, laughing. Musicians seeking our euros. Waiters hurrying to serve everybody all the while laughing and joking with us. Just perfetto!!

Excellent restaurants. I went here as part of my group tour during the afternoon. It is a beautiful little gem close to Vatican city. I had dinner here at a fabulous Italian restaurant. Be aware that is it very easy to get lost here!
Love. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this area. The food, the people the ambiance was just lovely. We did quiet a few evening strolls around getting lost then finding our way back to the hotel.

One pleasant evening in Trastevere. Must return.... I was the first time walking in this district of Rome on the west bank of Tiber with my family. Never could imagine to find such area here! Narrow medieval streets, multiple shops and cozy restaurants with local food, small squares with fountains in front of churches full of fun, street musicians and other attractions. Very friendly and unique atmosphere. Great place to walk through in Rome in the evening!
IN LOVE!. The quaintest little town ever! Our concierge told us to go for the food, which was so incredible we went twice, but we walked around for a few hours and took in all the beauty!

Take a foodie tour!. We took a fantastic eating tour in Trastevere and sampled from 8-9 different unique restaurants for cheeses, meats, wines and cookies. Trastevere is known for its food and quieter city life.

Getting lost in the Trastevere. Don't be afraid of getting lost in the Trastevere. On a hot July day, I took a cab from my hotel to San Pietro in Montorio, and from there I meandered. First, I visited the Bramante temple. I recommend spending extra time in the Spanish Academy and entering the neighboring church (with a worthwhile collection of paintings). Meander down the hill and take your time heading toward the Vatican. There is an abundance of coffee shops to peek into, and if you enjoy art - the mosaics at Basilica di Santa Maria are a must. Palazzo Corsini and a climb atop the Gianicolo hill were among highlights before I made my way to the Bernini piazza at the Vatican. Great lazy day in Rome!

My family's birthplace.... Trastevere to me is home first. Then it is Rome notwithstanding the meaning of its name. Across (tras) the river Tiber (Tevere) actually shows how the area was perceived back in the old days - some sort of suburban outskirts. Both my parents were born and brought up here close to San Francesco a Ripa. Until the '90s I would have loved to settle in Trastevere and enjoy its lively atmosphere. Nowadays its popularity and night life have increased too much and turned it into an over-crowded place. Strolling along its vicoli has lost its former genuine charm as I feel more like painfully cueing than walking for pleasure. Nonetheless you can't say you know Rome unless you've come here at least once.
trendy fun neighborhood. We had dinner here and it is just a fun place to eat and enjoy Rome with all the things you come to expect: wine, good food and lots of laughter and occasional singing
An overrated part of Rome. We made a special effort to visit this area, but found that it was disappointing and rather tacky. The traffic was noisy and the stalls could have been anywhere.

Must return ... . So glad we stumbled upon this lively , lovely neighborhood in Rome. Very quaint and beautiful . Many restaurants open at night with all the wonderful food that Italy has to offer!The vibe at night is very lively . My only regret that we didn't too little time , and I would like to visit during the daytime too! Certainly in my list when next in Rome !

Great to wander!. Spent a wonderful morning wandering and taking in the sites, natives do groceries on Saturday mornings, some shops open after 11. Some unique shops and very nice meat and cheese shops

Cozy Neighbourhood on the west Bank og the Tiber River. We took the subway and a bus to get there from Termini area. Ate at a good restaurant and enjoyed the inside of a local church, walked back towards the Tiber. Well worth a visit.
Funny roman part of Rom. A must see, very laid back part of Rom. Quiet, small streets and small shops with local artists as well as others.

The SOHO of Rome. Trastevere is like the SOHO of rome; contained, neighborhood-y and accessible. It's filled with charming streets lined with plenty of restaurants (and gelato!),and piazzas that feature music and performers every evening. A perfect place to wind down from a hot summer day.

A highlight. What a wonderful place and probably not given enough prominence on a Rome visit. Fabulous !!!. Visiting Trastevere sites continually you can still find out a small alley/streets that you might never have noticed before. So many cafes serving great Roman food. . We visited just in time for a Religious procession...badly organised but great atmosphere.Great place to visit.
Nice. Unlike the center of Rome that is always crowded and quite suffocating, this place is great to see a different part of Rome. Go, it's free and very quiet.
Wonderful Neighbourhood!. Lively nightlife! This place gives you a great opportunity to eat and drink like and with the locals. Or just roam around to soak in the local flavours!

The best dining in Rome. Would love to duplicate in Sydney.. Carlomenta was our favourite but there are so many restaurants to choose from. No hard sell, just take your time to choose. Italians start dining at 9pm, so that is when the real feel starts. Look for the locals and you will have an incredible experience.
Great place for food. We enjoyed a fabulous meal at Augusto and highly recommend the rabbit. Strolling around the streets late in the evening was very interesting.

the place to stroll if you have the time. the small alleys the little shops, the Pizza the Gelato the atmosphere. you can visit the Trastervere sites day after day and still find out a small alley/street that you visit for the first time.
and in a hot summer finding the little shady alleys is a nice thing to do while visiting Rome

Stuffed to the gills (Trastevere Food Tour). Okay. Trastevere is worth a trip for the food and shops, but the best way to do it is the 4.5 hour Trastevere Twilight Food Tour. We made 8 stops at the best local eateries. Each food stop was paired with wine. By the time we got to dinner (stop 7) and 3 big bowls of pasta, I was stuffed. Somehow the gelato at the last stop filled in the few empty places left in my tummy. Absolutely awesome small group walking tour; you won't be disappointed. Every bit of food I sampled was divine!

Very interesting and vivid part of Rome !. That is an area in Rome we liked so much. It is located on the right side of the river Tiber, south of Vatican City and St. Angelo Castle. Since we've been with our dwelling in the part of Rome called Monte Mario, north off the Vatican City and St.Peter Basilica, we often used the bus lines, not metro, on this side of Tiber to get to the Trastevere.The name literally means " beyond the Tiber".It is a very characteristic district of Rome, with its typical narrow alleys, cobblestoned, lined by ancient houses. There are a lot of restaurants and also a huge market exists here. Trastevere may boast with the beautiful churches as well, among which distincts strongly, the marvelous Basilica di Santa Maria in Trastevere. Many natives and tourists alike to wander along the narrow streets with aim to

Lovely neighborhood for an evening meal and a stroll. We ended up in the Trastevere after a day at the Vatican. The streets are quaint and packed with restaurants and bars. You can find your pick of cuisine here, and even catch an open air exhibition or musical performance outside the university. Interesting place to spend an evening for sure.
Trast A very - Its important to know how to pronounce it. Beautiful part of Rome, learn its history and appreciate its significance. Loved to walk it streets and appreciate the neighborhood.
Hot. The day that we were there it was 104 degrees. There are very few trees making the heat seem worse. Would love to go back when it isn't so hot.

Great restaurants and huge market.. Travastere is across the River from all the main sites, but is well worth a trip at the weekend. Loads of great restaurants to choose from and a huge market at the weekend, where you can buy anything from old furniture and antiques to clothes, to bags etc.

LOVE Trastevere. The Trastevere area is one of the nicest areas of Rome. Beautiful area with many little cafes and shops. Pretty buildings with ivy and flowers all around We wandered around for hours and loved it so much went back the next day! I would highly recommend going there! We started from Ponte Palatino and walked. I think the best area is between Ponte Girabaldi and Ponte Sisco. So nice!!! Enjoy a beautiful day there!
Great neighborhood day time and night time. Cant miss that neighborhood. it has its ambiance, it's crowd that are different during day time and night time. Both are really worth to enjoy.

Nice Area . Very friendly relaxed area with a smaller local feel such as the Barrios you find in Spain. Has a very different vibe to nearby areas and feels slightly less touristy while being quintessentially Roman. Incredibly niceplace to stroll, people watch and have a coffee before heading back to One of the more full on areas.

Bohemian neighbourhood . Alternative to other areas in Rome, very bohemian, full of character and nice restaurants.
Walking around this neighbourhood is cool, the piazza at night is especially lively, full of entertainment and musicians.
If I ever go back to Rome, I will book a hotel in this neighbourhood.

Truly a Roman adventure!. What FUN! We walked twice (!) from our downtown VRBO apartment across the Tiber River...a fairly substantial walk , but downhill! We also took a guided Food Tour--highly recommend! The next day we revisted several of our previous day's stops and shopped at a few of the stores. Yummy food & a feel for 'real' Rome.
Italy was playing that night. Busy commercially trying to be a unique arty destination but the football was on so possibly different other evenings

Rome with a neighborhood feel. We walked from the Termini area through busy streets and piazzas and across the Tiber to Trastevere. The streets are still busy, and vendors abundant, but there are also artisans and jewelry makers working on their wares at their display tables, and cute shops (shoes!!) that are open late. Trastevere feels small and friendly, with less hustle and bustle, like Rome in an earlier era. We met friends and enjoyed a late, long relaxing dinner before walking back to our hotel.
Chill out in a local atmosphere. Nice to chill out after the sightseeing. Probably will see street artist around main fountain of trastevere.

Pick pocketed. Visited this area with my thre teenage children today. A middle aged couple ran towards us and told us we have bird dropping on our back and started cleaning it with paper napkins, the man cleaned my trouser from the back, I touched on my back pocket, wallet was there. So we came back to our hotel to change clothes, there I learned I lost Euro 100 but my Credit Card was still there in the wallet.It was all an act, there was really no bird dropping but some colored material thrown at us from the back.

Loved this area!. My husband and I walked around this area at night looking for a place to eat. We ended up eating at Mama Frites, which was very good and then we got gelato from Gelateria Regusto, which was also very good. This area is bustling in the evenings and it is just so nice to walk around in. There are so many restaurants and bars!
Very nice. Used Rick Steves audio Europe app while walking around this neighborhood. Highly recommended to use the audio app while exploring this neighborhood.

Get lost in this ancient maze. My girlfriend and I loved to get lost in the maze that are the small streets in Trastevere. You can find aperitive places, and some of the best pizza in this western part of Rome.

Authentic Italian. Trastevere is one of the nicest parts in Rome in my opinion and in the short time I lived in Rome I spent many days relaxing or eating at one of the many restaurants in the area. The streets in Trastevere are small and beautiful with cobbled roads and small quaint shops.The restaurants here are amazing, especially Carlo Menta which does very good authentic pasta dishes.You could spend hours exploring the streets around Trastevere, or walk up above it to some of the fantastic viewpoints giving you sights of the whole of Rome. Trastevere is easy to get to from the centre by either bus or if taking the Metro getting off at Circo Massimo and walking across the river.

Authentic Italian. Trastevere is one of the nicest parts in Rome in my opinion and in the short time I lived in Rome I spent many days relaxing or eating at one of the many restaurants in the area. The streets in Trastevere are small and beautiful with cobbled roads and small quaint shops.The restaurants here are amazing, especially Carlo Menta which does very good authentic pasta dishes.You could spend hours exploring the streets around Trastevere, or walk up above it to some of the fantastic viewpoints giving you sights of the whole of Rome. Trastevere is easy to get to from the centre by either bus or if taking the Metro getting off at Circo Massimo and walking across the river.
Nice visit. Its a nice place to see and very interesting. Its definitely a must visit if your in Rome. Carry a bottle of water and wear good walking shoes.
Beautiful!. We spent the day here during our visit to Rome. It was a great escape from all of the hustle and bustle of Rome.
Well worth a visit . This is the part of Rome where the average Roman lives. The piazza are as beautiful ,but the cafes are full of Italians and the prices more reasonable

Unmissable. During our short stay in Rome, we had dinner very night in Trastevere, and went there a couple of times during the day as well.It is remarkable that such a gorgeous part of Rome managed (so far) the resist redevelopment. Even the ever-present street vendors are very polite, no hard sell. The restaurants are great (Grazia & Graziella was our favourite), as long as you prefer good food, and not into fancy tablecloths and china.

Great spot!. When you arrive to Trastevere you can continue inside a little bit and you're going to find little piazzas where you can have the aperos (so they called it, it's the "happy hour"!)I loved it!

The most charming part of Rome. Winding cobblestone streets, trattotias, gelaterias and cafes at every turn, this is where the locals go to eat, so this is where you should eat too. Constantly buzzing with activity and buskers/street performers, this is especially stunning at night when it is all lit up. The night we had here was a very memorable part of our trip.
across the river. Interesting neighborhood away from the usual attractions. Quaint streets, nice Piazzas good restaurants
Lovely. Great suburb. Felt safe. Interesting architecture everywhere. Lovely shops, restaurants and pizzerias. Easy access across the river to historic Rome

Worth a Visit. This area is wonderful, quaint streets, lots of great places to eat, lots to see and do, the atmosphere is completely different from being across the bridge to the more touristy places of Rome, much more relaxed.

Nice area of Rome for dinner and nightlife.. This is a quaint part of town near the river that is popular for dinner and clubs later in the evening. Dinner typically starts later ~8-9 in Rome, and then it's a short walk to Campo di Fiori where younger crowds congregate on Thurs & Fri evening. The bridges into Trastevere is a nice place to stop and view the sunset.
Seedy part of town. This is not a friendly neighborhood by any stretch. Only visit f you want to see a seedy part of town. be very careful at night
Beautiful neighborhood!. We walked the streets of Trastevere for hours and every turn led to a beautiful spot! So many eateries and cafes to try! A MUST while in Rome!

Picture perfect. In the four days I spent in Rome, 75% of the photographs I took were during my visit to the Trastevere area of Rome. Get lost wandering these streets and you won't regret it.. exactly how I pictured Rome in my head.

A great little traditional area. We came down here for a few,drinks and dinner in the area and absolutely loved it at night time. There were heaps of people out and about in the evening and great service and food around every corner,

Quaint and small town.. Trastevere was my favorite place in Italy this time around. The small town had a lot of charm, ambiance with nice restaurants and stores. We went to Trastevere on the last day of our trip and I regret not having the time to stay there longer. The ambiance was so calm and relaxing. It was a nice way to get away from the tourist and the loudness of the main attractions in Rome. We had dinner at La Prosciutto restaurant. The prosciutto with cantaloupe was the bomb(awesomeness); the other meats were just as tasty. We ordered a simple board for 3 people and it was so good we ordered more prosciutto with melon for 3. It was above and beyond my expectation. Next time i'm in Italy, i'm definitely staying in Trastevere.
Great eating. This is the area to eat great food at great prices. Majority of the restaurants have their menus in English also.

Highly recommend this little hub. My airbnb was in this hood. It's a "must check-out" on the other side of Ponte Sisto. Packed with restaurants and bars. For best pizza, try Dar Poeta. They have a resto and a separate takeout store. One of Rome's best dining spots, Antica Pesa is on Via Garibaldi. A Gem with a hidden courtyard. Expensive but worth it. Piazza di Santa Maria in Trastevere. Fun to hang out at night and watch performers. This area comes alive with people and stall vendors around 5 pm. For a taste of a Piazza used by the locals, make your way to Piazza San Cosimato. Fresh food market there daily till 1 pm. Make your way to the west end of this hood and climb up to find Fontana dell'Acqua Paolo for an exceptional view of Rome.

Why the hype?. In online reviews and articles, the Trastevere neighborhood seemed like a great place for shopping and dining. While there are tons of restaurants, none seem spectacular, very few/none are high-end, and the ambience is clearly past its prime. A few cute cobble-stoned streets are surrounded by many other grungy streets covered in dirt and graffiti. There were tons of tourists (college-aged?) mobbing the main streets around dinner time. Not a must-see neighborhood.

A must see area of Rome . A stroll through Trastevere is an essential thing to do as part of your trip to Rome. The streets really come alive at night with some excellent and affordable restaurants. You can't go wrong!

Get Lost!. Trastevere is a delightful neighborhood that has become one of the trendiest spots in Rome. It's tight, windy streets pull you to unknown treasures like small shops and restaurants. If you can walk more than 60 seconds without seeing a bar, I think you've walked out of Trastevere. It's a joy to visit for a snack, a cocktail or just wandering.
a little more residential. this part of Rome is more residential and so it feels homier. The shops are not aggressive and the people seem friendlier
Great to get away from the crowds. We did a walking food tour with Eating Italy. Was a perfect day! Many wonderful things to taste and learn about in Trastevere.

Right at the heart of Rome! Beware of petty thiefs. Basically, this area could be viewed in two ways.One, a tourist trap. Quite obvious since the number of restaurants and cafes along the area in abundance. Second, the central of Rome where almost every people, tourist or otherwise gathers. Try the local foods, but be critical of the prices. Waiters will be quite persistant inviting you in. It's all your choice really. Since the area is quite crowded, be wary of pickpockets. My friend almost lost a wallet while strolling in this area. He got bumped twice and when he checked, his wallet fell down with a sight of someone hurriedly scurrying away from it, maybe failed at his own attempt.
Must Visit. If you are in Rome and want a feel of the old city combined with excellent places to eat and drink then this is the place. The bye lanes amidst old houses are great to explore on foot.

Charming place. This is a charming place to have a good evening walk, an outdoor romantic dinner, or just simple watch people walking by. In the evening feels like a quiet local neighbourhood with lots of outdoor restaurants.

oldest church In Rome. gorgeous little town-went for lunch and a walk through all the little streets, then walked up the hill for a view of the city.. at night it probably is more lively, but def worth going for lunch . We had lunch opposite the church at the first restaurant and it was delicious.
The most authentic zone in Rome. This is the zone where Romans go to eat and drink. Food is good and authentic, drinks are very well priced and the atmosphere especially at night is AMAZING

A lovely authentic rustic Italian neighborhood, delicious food and very affordable. We had read about Trastevere and knew we wanted to explore the area. We decided to spend an evening in Trastevere, following Rick Steves Trastevere Walk. I recommend the Walk bc he led us down many alleys and interesting sites that we wouldn't have known to look for. Trastevere is full of quaint stores and trattorias- something different around every corner. We also visited ornate Santa Cecelia, a beautiful couch nestled in the neighborhood. After exploring Trastevere for a few hours, we ended up eating at Cave Canem and I recommend it as well- very delicious and extremely affordable! After dinner we walked to the Piazza Santa Maria de Trastevere and sat at the fountain in the center of the piazza, the "neighborhood couch" as it was called by someone who suggested we go. We just sat and people watched and after a while, some performers began entertaining the crowd. I definitely recommend visiting this quaint neighborhood when visiting Rome~

Pretending being local. Each visit in Rome, stating in this neighborhood. For me it is the best place to feel really part of colors and tastes of Rome. Eden for foodies, nightlife, special atmosphere - must visit.My favorite piazza Santa Maria in Trastevere, just enjoying sitting on stares with bottle of beer and pizza to go, pretending being local;)

Great "real" neighborhood. Great "real" Rome neighborhood, lots of students. Smaller scale than some other parts of Rome. Great place for an afternoon walk. Lots of gelato, street vendors and great restaurants and cafes.

worth a stroll. lovely area- we were recommended to visit here and glad we did. Lots of little,twisting streets, cafes, restaurants and squares. well worth a stroll. We did an evening explore and dinner- it was lovely
Very nice and different Rome. Very nice place and it has lot of fine restaurant. Here you can meet the locals and walk small alleys. Easy walk from metrostation.

A stunning little Maze. We had been advised to go here by a friend, and if she hadn't told us then its probable that we would have missed it. Its a gem, quite unlike other areas of Rome we'd walked around.She told us that it was like going to a historical Chelsea, but as I'd never been to London this didn't mean much to me!We all loved it, we meandered around for hours and it had such a lovely feel to it that we could have happily just stayed there all day. Lots of little hidden streets and cafes and the MOST beautiful church which we stumbled across, The church of Santa Ignezia. It had such a calm peaceful feel that it reduced me to tears. So pretty, its a must see even if you feel you've seen enough churches please visit this one. The little bronze trees with the plaques beside them were very touching and we highly recommned you visit. The main square always had something going on, from singers, jugglers, dancers, musicians, and people just sitting on the ground watching made it feel special.

A Place of Urban Attraction at the River Bank of Tevere. It is a pleasant district decorated by the landscape of the River Tevere, urban history, and the activities of closed pedestrian area. Especially in summer time, the district is very lively till midnight.

Not as lovely as testaccio. I really liked Travastevere. It's cobbled streets, cathedrals and the bustling riverside market. However, it is equally filled with tourist trap restaurants, pick pockets and beggars. I prefer the foodie haven of Testaccio right next door.

The most fantastic area in Rome. Differs any other area in Rome. full of restaurants, bars, boutiques, pizzerias, tiny allies and people. Full of life! take a walk in riverside, eat supper in one of the many restaurants in the area and enjoy yourself. don't miss Trastevere when you visit Rome.
Beautiful little village. Fun little village, close to the Vatican. Sweet little stores and trattorias. We would love to spend more time there on our next visit.

Do not miss this neighborhood. We had read a few things about this neighborhood and wanted to spend some time here. We skipped it the first few days because we were tired from touring the attractions. We forced ourselves later one night to "stop" by to check it out. A DEFINITE DO NOT MISS! This is the most beautiful Rome neighborhood. Most of the restaurants and cafes are intimate with wonderful ambiance. We spent many hours here the next few days after.

A nice change. The area, which is known for the student population due to the proximity of the Universities, is hip and cool and feels completely different than the other areas I visited in Rome. The beauty and history surrounds you and the vibe from the people hanging around is young and chill and worth a visit.
Fun eating and shopping!. Enjoy the shops and restaurants of Trastevere. We enjoyed going in the late afternoon, early evening. Beautiful to walk across the bridge and right into Trastevere.

Stunning boho atmosphere and lovely buildings. Beautiful - the best part of Rome for me - dont miss it. Lovely eateries, bohemian atmosphere and a great deal of history too. Lovely walk over the bridge and musicians playing in the square.
Food and beer spectacular - will visit again.

nice area for food and drinks. its a very nice area to have a walk, there are a lot of things happening in this street.
on the main street you can find a band performing , eat at some very good restaurants or have a drink at a bar.

Paradise.... Don't just visit, live it.....well in Trastevere that's what you get.
A real "village" feel, proud and welcoming shop owners and restauranteurs. Wonderful produce in the markets. A food lovers heaven.
Next time I visit Rome I will look to stay here!
Excellent place to wander. Trastevere is a lovely place and has lots of good restaurants and pizzeria. Interesting to wander around. The best time is in the evening when the place comes alive

Stunning, must visit.. Going to this area was the highlight of our trip. The atmosphere was outstanding. Beautiful alleys and buildings everywhere you walk. There are hundreds of restaurants and shops all over. If you want to walk for a few hours wear comfortable shoes as the floors are very lumpy and stoned-pavements. The shops are open till late so its a great spot for late dining and enjoying some wine.

Favourite!. This was a place recommended to me on my first trip to Rome as a place that, once evening rolled in, you could get drunk and buy a pair or earrings! During the day, this place is a little maze of cobbled streets that house tiny restaurants and shops. At night, the street performers roll out and sellers of various wares - whatever the weather. My favourite restaurant in Italy is in Trastevere, which I have reviewed separately (Sabatinis) but an outdoor seat here, opposite the church is a definite recommendation if you have some cash available. If Sabitinis is out of your price range, there is a huge selection of restaurants and bars here and a couple of sports bars too!When you think of italy, this is the place that matches your expectation.
Beautiful - a hidden treat in Rome. Enjoyed meandering through the streets of Trastevere, and having dinner at the streetside restaurants. Highlight of our visit to Rome.

charming suburb. this area is well worth a visit. some lovely restaurants, and amazing gelato from la fonte della salute. the church of Santa Maria was my favourite in Rome. Breathtakingly beautiful, it stirred up lots of emotion! the square directly outside has a lovely little fountain you can sit against, and we were lucky to listen to live music with dancing!

Not What I Thought. I went here thinking it would be like many old towns I've visited before with a rustic charm but sadly this was not the case. Trastevere was very run down with graffiti everywhere, it's not a place i would visit as a solo traveller or at night as it just didn't feel safe. Apart from this a bar and later a restaurant on the main strip was excellent with friendly staff.

Lovely part of Rome off the beaten track. We were told to visit this area which the name means across the bridge. It's just over the tiber river on the south side of Rome. There are many restaurants. It's very lively even going past midnight. There are some nice piazza with entertainment. There are some nice bars along the river. Great place to spend an evening and enjoy wonderful Italian cuisine!
Gem of a Town. What a great town. There was so many beautiful building and restaurants up hundreds of little streets. Very, very historic and would visit again in a heartbeat.

a little less touristy area of Rome. after visiting the traditional sites on two trips to Rome, we headed over to this area, where there were far fewer tourists like ourselves and we could enjoy the shops and restaurants while still taking in the history of this amazing city.
Vibrant Dining Area. The little streets full of restaurants come alive with musicians and sellers peddling there wares. A must visit in Rome!
Fantastic neighborhood, GREAT foodie spots!. The Trastevere neighborhood in Rome is a must see on a trip to Rome. Some of the best restaurants in all of Rome are in this area.

Great area. We spend 2 nights in trastevere and absolutely loved the atomsfere and all. Such an autenthic area with lots of nice restaurants and bars. Recommend it if you want the real Italian experience
Nice. very nice, i like to have a beautiful week-end in Trastevere!More people than i expect!Amazing and line!

Trastevere. Highly recommend seeing this historic neighborhood. We took a late afternoon walking/eating tour with "Walks of Italy." Very reputable company. Not only did we learn of the area's fascinating past, but we sampled all sorts of authentic Roman Italian foods such as porchetta, Italian beer, and other delectable in stores and restaurants along the way. Without a guide, you will miss out on fun facts and details of how Trastevre came to be, Wear comfortable walking shoes. Refill you water bottle at a public fountain. Restrooms only in bars and restaurants.

Spend an afternoon here. A great place to spend an afternoon. We walked here after a visit to the Vatican. It was very nice to get away from the crowded sights and streets of down town Rome. There are lots of small shops, back streets, markets and restaurants. Lovely afternoon.

Another Side of Rome. Visit the city by day and retreat to this "village" at night. The square is teeming with cafes, vendors, artists and life that is big and loud. You can't help but have a good time on this side of the Tiber. Check out the Hotel Santa Maria for an excellent place to stay.
Foodie area. We had foodi tour at Trantevere area. It is not as touristic as in Rome centre itself. Many good restaurants location are here.

Real Rome. Loved the neighborhood. It is very old Rome with lots of little specialty shops for cheese, wine, cookies( biscotti). Great restaurants. But as any traveler should do, Alws be aware of your surroundings ,especially at night. As I write this there is the story of a young American from my state that was murdered in this area by the river. Be aware and you should be ok. I would totally go back to this area.

Home!. I have been living in Trastevere for several months, and going to the other side (city center) of the river just isn't as much fun, despite there being so much to do over there as well. There is a different vibe in Trastevere. Sure, there are a lot of tourists, but there are plenty of locals as well. It's not at all like the areas of Piazza Navona or Piazza Spagna (Spanish Steps), which feel distinctly tourist-y these days. In Trastevere there are so many little restaurants where you can get a good meal, great wine, and just enjoy your afternoon or evening. There are also lots of little shops where you can buy cute things (if that's what you're looking for). The Piazza di Santa Maria in Trastevere comes alive at night with all kinds of various entertainment in the form of street performers/musicians. If you're staying in another part of the city, you need to at least devote a day to Trastevere, as it is a nice way to feel like you're in a semi-different place without having travelled far! I will ONLY stay in Trastevere when I return to Rome, as it truly feels like home!

A little Roma adventure. We heard that Trastevere was a district where the locals prefer to hang out so to avoid tourists and to get a more local touch of the city we went here. Beautiful streets and alleys where trattorias and osterias compete. The one better then the other for much better prices than downtown Roma!
Rome's Gem! Where all the cool kids go!. An early evening walk through Trastevere's beautifully lit, narrow streets, is an absolute must when in Roma! Funky, rustic, urban, hip! Do it.

Authentic Rome But Don't Get the Bus (Murder). We took the H bus from Rome Termini on a weekday afternoon. Don't do this. The bus is infrequent, gets incredibly crowded, and with no windows, becomes hot. Everyone dripping with sweat, with everyone exiting once it arrives in Trastevere. Good selection of restaurants, gelaterias and bars along narrow cobbled streets. Lots of beggars and people selling utter tat to tourists. The night we were there a tourist went missing and was later found murdered. This shouldn't deter you, we had a lovely time and were not murdered.
Holiday. Rome is a very nice place to go on holiday. We visited several places in Rome. Trastevere is a very nice place to eat at night.

A Real Neighborhood. This is where it's at. Trastevere is a great neighborhood, full of activity day a night. It has a bit of everything, old, new and charming. Make sure to walk its streets as you will discover something special at every corner.lots of great eateries, cafes, salumerias, and beautiful homes on the hillside.

Best part of Rome. Beautiful part of Rome. Not very far from the Central Rome by Bus (No Metro). Was definitely worth going there. Gorgeous narrow streets, beautiful restaurants and really good value food. Would love to go back and stay in this part of the city again.,

Excellent base for trip to Rome!. One of Rome's oldest neighborhoods! Our apartment was just a block from the Tiber and the old bridge. Resturants and shopping abound! Taxi stand just up the street and we often just took walked. Trastevere is a happening place at night but in a good way. I don't think we would think of staying anywhere else if we were lucky enough to return!
beautiful rome. Loved the cobblestone alleys, fantastic place to just wander and soak up the atmosphere. Plenty of nightlife and restaurants to choose from with varied prices.

Great neighborhood to stay in Rome. My husband and I stayed in the Trastevere area during our trip to Rome. The location was perfect as we were able to walk to many of the landmarks in under 30 min (Colosseum, Vatican, Treve Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc). The nightlight in Trastevere is great... Very lively and a lot of cool bars. There are also a bunch of side streets where you can stay that our quiet. The food is phenomenal!!! The area in general is less touristy and more authentic.

Excellent ambience and food. We visited Trastevere area with our children in our last day in Rome, we really found a nice area, with a very good ambience for everybody, there are street performers our kids found very enjoyable, lots of restaurants, bars and shops, here everything is more authentic you get a feeling like is not as touristy as the rest of Rome, this is visited more by local people who want to relax and have a good time, this place comes alive by afternoon/ evening, it is ideal after spending a day seeing Rome.Here you will find good food, good service, singers at bars and restaurants, street performers, an ambience more of a small town rather than the capital Rome actually is. Not as crowded like the rest of Rome in summer.

Is perfect. One of those little roman streets that you can feel the roman life, apart from the people jumping and trying to sell you stupid things! It has a great atmosphere! I spend time there during the match between Germany & Italy in QF of Euro 2016! Was great although the Italians have lost!

Wonderful Neighborhood. Great neighborhood with wonderful finds all around the center. Great fun to stroll along the river at night - lots temporary bars, shops, restaurants, and games set up during the summer.
Difficult to get there. Tram number 8 didn´t go when we were in Rome, had to take number 3, then change to a bus... The area is nice, we were there in the afternoon, not too many tourists around
Great little corner. Roman little streets full of cultural things and small stores. Lots of tourists, especially busy I the evenings. Loved it
True Rome expirience. Just walk up and down the narrow streets of this charming neighborhood full of restaurants and bars and enjoy the atmosphere. Easy to get there with tram from Piazza Venezia.
Nice location. Visited twice for dinner. Very nice location with big variety of restaurants, bars and pubs. You need at least to visited once.

Cute youthful place with winding narrow streets and lots of party noise. Went there one eveing for dinner and found it full of young people getting quite drunk. It is noisy and a pary place. The streets are narrow and not that clean. We did find a lovely new restaurant near the entrance whcih was new, clean and cuiet. Food was quite good too.

Over-hyped in travel books. We wanted to try Trastavere after reading about it as an up-and-coming neighborhood, but were disappointed to see it being pretty disheveled (not in a charming way!). Couldn't find a restaurant/area that did it for us, so we took a taxi back across the river to more touristy area of Piazza Navona, and were very happy we did.
Unusual Shops. I couldn't believe there are designer shops here dedicated to selling priests vestments and chalices etc

Quaint Italian Neighborhood- Fine Dining. Trastevere (meaning "beyond the Tiber River" in Latin) is one of Rome's districts. The area houses many good restaurants, offering fine dining in a more relaxed atmosphere. Walking the streets of Trastevere particularly around sunset and evening is very nice, particularly if you can get views of the Tiber River and across at the " Centro Storico" side. Acces is best from the bridge, Pone Sisto, behind the Palazzos Farnese and Spada. One can also access Trastevere from the Ponte Palatino, close to where the Colisseum, Forum and Palatine Hill are. RE: restaurants...Da Enzo has a great reputation , but was serving a very large tour group the night wewere there, so my wife and I ate nearby at Sciapio, which was very delicious. Note of warning...dinners here can be rather expensive- our tab was 57 euros (about $63 which included wine, but well worth it. My personal opinion is that if one can afford flights to Rome, one can afford one very nice , romantic, dinner in Trastevere!

TRUE TASTE OF ITALY!. What a great area to walk around! Some of the shops are small but with many customers and have been in families for generations. This are to me was true Rome. Residents were walking dogs, stopping in a bakery or cheese shop, etc. Beautiful architecture. Authentic Rome away from tourists! (We pretended to be one of them!)
More Alleyways That Leads To A Piazza. Walking around Rome will have you go through a whole lot of alleyways but out of those many, Trastevere stands out. It has its own personality.

You should visit Trastevere to see a different side of Rome. Trastevere is an intimate, tiny neighborhood filled with tiny, narrow streets, cafes, restaurants, shops and boutique hotels. Once you leave the main streets, the traffic almost disappears and is replaced by strolling crowds of both residents and tourists. You will find fewer tourists here and the food can be really excellent. The one major "piazza" is in front of Santa Maria in Trastevere and this church is historically significant and definitely worth your time for a detailed visit. The neighborhood is alive with activity every evening. You are a very short walk to "the other Rome" by just crossing a bridge over the Tiber.

Worth only for the food. Nothing extra-ordinary about this old town except for some exceptionally good restaurant. If you trying to visit this place by yourself using a map of GPS then you might get confused - so better to ask somebody. Once you cross the river the entire stretch of the road is called Trastevere, but you need to stick to the beginning to have a feel of the place. First below the bridge is a long row of eating places and souvenir shops. It looks beautiful during the sunset and even once its lit up. Then you can roam around the lanes - in the evening its not much worth except visit some good restaurants in the lanes.

Romantic, hip and cool. One of the most vibrant neighbourhoods in Rome; perfect for a night out wandering the streets, having a pizza and sipping cocktails. During the day the atmosphere is much more relaxed and almost rustic.
Authentique neighborhood. Nice place to escape the busy centre. Locals come here. Nice restaurants, small streepte, lots to do. Must visit when in Rome.

The SoHo of Rome. Quaint, picturesque and fun to explore! We stayed here for a week on a family vacation and never tired of the enjoyable, neighborhood feel of the place. Restaurants abound, and it is easy to find English-speakers everywhere. The only downside, I find in this area is the amount of graffiti which was sort of distracting to me. This area is definitely worth of consideration for an evening visit or a more prolonged stay.

Charming area in Rome. This was one of our favorite neighborhoods in Rome. Great place to find local and authentic restaurants and shops. Not crazy with tourist with a much more local fell. Full of beautiful streets, buildings and churches. We loved walking around and exploring the area. We found some our favorite little local shops and goodies here! I would highly suggest a visit if you have time! A very different feel than the busy city center of Rome.
A Roman must. If in Rome, you cannot miss visiting the Trastevere neighborhood. Used to be bohemian, now touristy, messy and caotic but fun to be at. Lots of fine dinning places & pizzerias.
Nice quarter of Rome. Do not kiss this rich in piazzi, small streets, fountains area of Rome. Loose yourself there during the day or at night.

Amazing shops and restaurants.. This area is absolutely charming and amazing. This is one of the most original and ancient areas of Rome that still exists as it may have back centuries ago. The food in this area is fantastic and I highly recommend it.

We loved this neighborhood. We actually stayed here for our week long vacation. I was SO happy we chose it. We lived like locals, always felt safe. The food and the shopping was better and significantly less than Rome central. It's within walking distance to Rome central and the attractions. If you stay in Rome take time to walk across the Tiber and check it out.

Summer Evening in Rome. A delightful neighborhood with lots of higher end shops and outstanding eating places. Better to find a restaurant on one of the side streets, which often look like alleyways. Small places, not fancy ambience but great food.
A must visit at night. A nice locality in rome that should be visited in the night. A lot of eating joints with cheap and expensive options.

Hip and cool. It's the place to be if your hip and young are just want to be. Filled with artist and musicians there's more of a bohemian feel to the place. Hike up Gianicolo hill to catch a sunset and then have dinner in a fun restaurant.

Completely other world. If you are sick and tired of crowds in the center of Roma, you should definitely visit Trastevere! It's close to the main tourists attractions, but still omitted by most of visitors. Narrow streets replete with cosy Italian restaurants and pubs, friendly people, lots of beautiful churches to visit... What more could you want?

A vibrant mix of restaurants and street market. I fell in love with this area as soon as we started to wander through. The stalls reminded me of the hippy market we used to visit in Rio De Janiero when I was younger. Like Rio there was a lot of quality handcrafted goods mixed in with the usual cheap tat. Wandering around were lucky to catch a procession along Via Di Santa Dorotea to Chiese Parr Santa Dorotea. An unexpected bonus to our walk around the area. If you decide not to dine in Trastevere you might like some of the pop up bars that line the sides of the Tiber closeby.
Nice dinner at night. Really picturesque neighborhood with a lot of nice pubs, restaurants etc. It really worth visiting it.
stumbled across this area and so glad I did. This is a great place for food and craft shops and just people watching. The place has a really nice atmosphere

Much quieter the centre. We walked over the bridge to the other side of the river to the Trastevere area, lots of narrow streets and squares that had a buzz about them but much quieter than the centre. Really enjoyed our lunch over this side of the river.

Best part of Rome. This area is by far the best in Rome, cheap and good food. A lot of restaurants around the narrow streets. Happy hour at several places from 6pm-10pm. Drinks for 3-4 euro. Its a hip area with both young and old people, the perfect mix! Take a bus to piazza venezia and then the tram from the piazza that will take directly to Trastavere. Enjoy!

A beautiful neighbourhood in Rome!. The best pizza that I had, Roman-style, was in a small local pizzeria here in Trastevere. Charming neighbourhood brimming with locals and tourists alike. Great place to grow walking and people-watching.
The coolest. The coolest neibourhood in Rome Vibrant, live and full of action and good forLate night outings To walk around and get lost in the small alleys is fun
Young part of town. Lovely restaurants, plenty of street vendors, good atmosphere on a Friday evening. Young crowd however.

Friendly people great food . Everything you miss in Rome you find here.great atmosphere.Nice to visit at night , a llot of nice restaurants with normal pricing and great service , lots of old buildings , churches and unique bars and cafe's.

Nice Neighborhood. After reading about this on TripAdvisor, we decided to visit. The narrow streets and old buildings were fun to see, and we loved the view of the Tiber as we crossed into the neighborhood. We enjoyed people watching and caught a bite to eat while we were here. However, if you're limited for time in Rome, I would cross this one off the list.

A great base. Trastevere is a great place to stay, with the River Tiber flowing 50 metres away, the place full of churches to visit, numerous eating joints that remain open well into the night right by the banks of the Tiber and a never-ending flow of tourists. All the principle tourist sites are within walkable distances, including the Vatican (if you are a reasonably fit person), and the walks are really enjoyable.

A must place to explore and find a restaurant where the locals eat.. This is a very romantic part of Rome and easy to get around on foot. Plenty of foodie delights here, specially where the locals are frequenting.

Relax and enjoy. We were recommended this area as a place where the Romans frequent. We visited the Church of Santa Maria then just meandered through the narrow streets, found a bar with outside seating and just watched the world go by over a few beers. A nice break from our more hectic tourist March! The pace of life here slows to a peaceful crawl.

Soul of the Eternal City. Springtime; crossing the Tiber from Testaccio and strolling through Trasteverre, past Bourganvillea blossoms on pink and yellow ochre painted palazzios. Peronis and Spritz with the locals at Bar San Calisto in the golden evening light, passageata en route to dinner.Sublime

Lost some of the magic. We strolled the street several times, at different times of the day. While the daytime seem to be dead and the backstage preparing for the evening performance, the nights were as busy and exciting as ever, even if any originality must have gone a long time ago. Some interesting new fast food places, still excellent flavours in the old restaurants, but a "designed for tourists" flavour. It is still a must see and the spontaneous shows as well as the organized events (tasting of food and wine along the Tiber banks) worth the visit.

Best part of visiting Rome!!!. We loved this neighborhood. There were so many great businesses. It's a wonderful place to stay with the great restaurants (gluten free) and small shops. Easy access anywhere in Rome with public transportation. Can't wait to go back to Trastavere. It made Rome the best part of our Italian Adventure.

One of the great food experience. We took a food tour in Trastevere and our journey was never the same.Wished we did earlier, really was that an eye opener.Local produce are always the best.We really recommend you to find a good food tour service early on and better yet plan ahead and browse online and book far ahead.You'll appreciate this later on the trip that you will strive to find beyond the touristy obvious and be curious to find the local hidden gems to enrich your hard-earned trip.

Here I`m very fine, thank you!. Trastevere has a lot to offer, like nice scenery, lovely restaurants with good food and nice service and some good shops. Even if it is a place for tourists it gives an authentic impression, there are still some Romans doing there everyday affaires in Trastevere, eating, talking, working and having fun.
It's ok but just ok.. This was my second visit to Trastevere and I still don't know what it is that should make this quarter special.

The eternal City. Have you ever been in Rome? If not just plan this trip......So much history to see and amazing places to explore!Trastevere is one of these places with small streets, nice cafe`s and restaurants.
