Lively and popular. This area seems to come to life at night and is very popular for diners seeking something a bit more upbeat than the main parts of the old city. We walked through on a Sunday evening and a number of the restaurants had long queues outside and the streets were very busy.Good fun and a little different from the main tourist areas.
Great Area!. This was a wonderful area for restaurants! We had a very nice dinner and a beautiful walk through this area and back to our hotel. It's worth a walk or a taxi ride.
A quieter part of Rome in daylight. Another area to wander at will but it picks up at night with many local restaurants and bars. Do not miss Santa Maria church in the square.
Lovely. The area is beautiful, better at night. Of course it's a tourist trap, but who cares ? The atmosphere is wonderful, the food is fantastic .. Too bad the Metro doesn't get there.
Cute. nice but not amazing. The food is nice but the place is touristy. The buildings are very beautiful and cozy.

Best explored in the evening!. Trastevere is an area of the city which comes alive in the evening when bars, restaurants and cafe's are 'buzzing'. Many small restaurants in Trastevere offer local cuisine but take care, 'tourist prices' can prove to be a 'bit of a shock' and food standards can be little better than 'OK' rather than great - checkout the 'best' places to eat on TripAdvisor!Enjoy wandering the small (and winding) cobbled streets - wear 'sensible' footwear and browse the unique (often design-led) little shops where you'll find something 'different'. Trastevere is a 'must visit' area of the city!!

The place to stay in Rome. Trastevere is a wonderful place to stay in Rome, close to everything, you can walk to most of the attractions and historical sites. Or take the tram. Restaurants and bars are everywhere and they are great value. The cobblestone streets and wonderful old buildings make you think you are in a movie set. I would recommend Trastevere to anyone staying in this fantastic city.
Great neighbourhood . Great neighbourhood with a lot of bars and restaurants.Come and enjoy the hospitality of the young Italian generation.

Be ready to walk and explore. We were based in Trastevere during our tour of Rome. The area is outside the 'city' of Rome, and was historically where the 'working class' of Rome lived and commuted from. It is a treasure trove of meandering walkways, delightful sights, and the river tiber winding through. Be willing to take a leisurely stroll, and have time to spare. Trastevere is not to be rushed.

Well worth a wander. Loved walking around this area. Still very busy (hard to find anywhere in Rome that isn't!) but nice to be away from all the familiar ancient monuments just for a while to recharge your batteries. Lovely to take some time to relax and just wander and appreciate this very different part of Rome (remember to look up) and there are lots restaurants and bars. Great place to visit during the day and also great atmosphere in the evening. Great for people watching and remember to wear comfortable shoes as the streets are cobbled

Great area!. This is a charming area, loaded with great restaurants, active piazzas and night life, and the beautiful Basilica of Santa Maria. We stayed a week here in an apartment and enjoyed it very much. It is an excellent base for your tour of Rome!

Beautifullll Area. I absolutely loved this small area of Rome has such a lovely atmosphere small stores, restaurants, piazza and live entertainment.Please take the time to visit it, you wont be disappointed.
Great place to stay in Rome. So many restaurants, Giancolo hill, bars, close to the city, River Tiber, Trastevere has it all. The place to be!
Great for food. Great place to go for a meal at night or just wonder the cobblestone streets. We went for a meal and sat outside people watching.
visited during the day. interesting old part of Rome across the bridge...lots and lots of eateries and coffee shops bars etc...goo for a visit but don't stay here

A great section of Rome to explore.. A different side of Rome that you must spend time visiting. Just walking around and exploring the side streets. It is on the other side of the Tiber river (across from the ruins), but some fascinating shopping and just feeling like a native of rome as you explore.

Trastevere nights are the greatest. The greatest nights are in Trastevere. Especially when you having vacation times in the middle of summer. So many locals and non-tourist tourists having fun while drinking alcohol gellato :)

Favorite Zone in Roma. I visit Rome often - at least 2 times a year, and I make sure on each and every trip I cross (tra) the Tiber (tevere) - to Trastevere. It's a tiny bit gritty but more cool. There are so many little boutiques that sell unique one of a kind items - it's great for shopping. Almost every restaurant we've eaten at has been great - lot's of outdoor dining. The piazza is a great place to sit, enjoy the sun, people watch and watch the street performers. There is also a section which has a lot of small bars where people spill over into the street - always a fun time visiting Trastevere.

Cute little neighbourhood!. This area was beautiful to walk through and provided a great way to spend the afternoon. We went from one little cafe/aperitivo bar to another all while soaking up the afternoon sun and watching the street traffic!

Cafe Abreggo in Trastevere.. What a great restaurant! Service by the owner was impeccable and the chef was also so friendly. We had a delicious meal and it did not break the bank...when you first walk in you would think it would be average. Lo and behold it was delicious! My Italian cousin was with me and she was also impressed by how delicious it was.

Charming neighborhood on the other side of the river!. Take the bus! Spend the day wandering the narrow streets. Go to the churches! Eat fabulous, authentic food in tiny little restaurants!Experience an authentic neighborhood. Not at all commercial. You can walk there easily after a Sunday AM visit to the Porta Portese Market.

Definitely a must. Beautiful, charming part of the city. Come Here and just explore, each street and corner is more beautiful than the last. Come hungry - loads of Great restaurants and gelaterias! You should visit both at day and night time - bussing regardless of the hour.
Cozy. Cozy area, with a lot of restaurants. The area is lively but not to crowded, great place to have dinner or lunch.

Away from the crowd. A side of Rome that offers a more authentic experience. The streets and alleys are not swarmed by tourists, and whatever groups of people here are mostly Romans. The food here is a unique blend and offers an experience that is a memorable culinary experience. The churches, villas and other architectural sites should not be missed, as they are stunning. Be prepared to spend an entire day here, and feel that there is so much more that needs to be seen.

Food, Drink, Entertainment, Trastevere is the place to be in Rome. In merely our second trip to Rome, we have always found the food to be spectacular. The reality is that Trastevere offers economical venues with high quality food and beverages (also reviewed by vein leisure), the perfect environment for a group of ex-pat friends to gather, and opportunity for people watching or pub crawl. Trastevere is easy to get to by taxi. The narrow streets of this neighborhood offer a quaint walk day or night. It is the night time that brings the younger crowd, bars on every corner, clubs for dance, and restaurants everywhere.If you are visiting Rome as a group of friends, group of college students, or as a couple, Trastevere will have venues to match your culinary or social preferences. Visit later in the evening and appreciate a large local presence as well.

Lovely area of Rome. This is a nice place to visit once you have seen all the main sites in the centre of Rome. Spent time just wandering the streets which was very enjoyable. Lots of nice shops & restaurants to visit, especially around the main square

Nice place to stay. We stayed at an apartment in Trastevere which we really enjoyed. There were plenty of places to eat from restaurants to pizza places and lovely gelati shop. We were close to a local milk bar, which was great when in an apartment, as we could buy our wine and cheese from them. We also found a laundromat close buy which was handy. We loved walking the cobblestone streets and exploring the churches which were plain from the outside but absolutely amazing inside. We also walked to the Botanic Gardens which were ok but nothing compared to the gardens we have in Australia. We were happy to walk everywhere and managed to walk to our tour at the Vatican and our tour of the Colosseum. The only down side is that lots of younger people come to Trastevere for drinks in the evenings on weekends, so it can be noisy depending on where you stay.

Cozy, lively and friendly atmosphere neighbourhood. We stayed in a hotel on Via della Lungaretti, just by Piazza Di Santa Maria in Trastevere, and within a good 500 metres there were probably hundreds of restaurants and bars, loads of small interesting shops. Family friendly and safe, perfect for strolling around and enjoying urban life, day or evening.

Food food food!. A nice little neighborhood to go during evening/ night. Filled with restaurants and bars in almost every corner, the ambience overall is good. I enjoyed the walk along the Tiber river before reaching Trastevere.

Wonderful section of Rome reminiscent of Venice. Great area of Rome in which to wander. Many alleys that reminded us of Venice. Tons of restaurants and cafes. This was our fourth visit to Rome but the first to this section of Rome. Really enjoyed our afternoon there.

Our favorite neighborhood. Quaint neighborhood across the Tiber that we fell in love with. It's less crowded and great for strolling. Santa Maria in Trastevere has some beautiful mosaics as well. This area feels like authentic Rome and we wandered aimlessly down one narrow cobblestoned alley after another. Walking back across Tiber Island and through the Jewish Ghetto makes for a terrific walk.
Beautiful. When u get there at first u think "is this what everybody are talking about?" But then, you stroll down the streets and see how peaceful and beautiful it is there.
Cosy, local hangout. A very nice locality where the locals live and eat. We didn't spend much time for sightseeing, just had our dinner. I would surely recommend others to explore the place.

Don't miss this area. We spent several hours in the area and enjoyed the streets, shops, and cafes. It is old Rome and the narrow streets wind around the piazza, which is large and rimmed with cafes. It is quintessential Europe and reminded me of the square in Tallin, Estonia. It was not so crowded and we enjoyed just wandering the streets and seeing the sights. The Tiber is nearby as well. It was more like being with the locals,than the via del Corso area and the Piazza del Popolo.

Trastevere Stroll with Exclusive Private Dinner (City Wonders Tour). This was fun!We met our tour guide in Trastevere and our small group proceeded to have a mini-informational tour of the area that ended at a private, well-to-do home (City Wonders' website describes it as a villa), drinking wine and eating a 4 course meal prepared by a chef who would come out into the dining area and talk to us about what we were eating. Our hostess was very visible, accommodating, and hospitable, and our guide, Roberto, was very personable.We learned that this is a new tour and we were the third group to experience it.I hope this tour can remain available, as it was definitely a worthwhile experience for those who love wine, good food, and excellent company,

Great place to wander around, nosh on snack and do light shopping. We spent an evening here wandering around, nibbling on chocolates and getting pizza. Artistic things for sale; we didn't buy much as everything was quite expensive, but we enjoyed looking.

Love Trastevere beautiful area! Romantic and quaint. We walked acros the bridge from the Mouth of truth past the Tiber Island to Trastevere a beautiful spot on the opposite side of the river. Full of colour and culture we immediately loved this place. We had lunch at Camparone where Bruno and his colleagues made us and our children feel extremely welcome. A very traditional trattoria with a good selection of food and great atmosphere. Recommended!

Best place to chill out and to eat and drink. The downtown part of Rome- Its safe with the normal precautions of keeping bags/wallets safe. Many small restaurants and bars to enjoy in this traffic free area.
Great location. Lovely part of Rome. We stayed in a quiet part of Trastevere, but was in easy walking distance of buzzing bars & restaurants. Walkable to the Colosseum etc, at c.30mins.

A step back in time.... We took a stroll through this area early in the evening and it was alive with people. So many beautiful buildings, small tucked away cafes, side streets and everything you imagine Rome to be.

The ideal hangout place in the evening esp on weekends!. Trastevere is very interesting with it's many pop up shops with people selling their creative handmade wares, many many cafes n pizzerias. We loved 'Ombre Rosse' esp on a Thursday with Live music - Francesca's powerful singing and some super guitaring - sorry forgot the guy's name. There are street performers, musicians, loud groups of tourists hanging around and the atmosphere is lively. On a weekday things start to wind up ny 12 midnight weekends longer.We took the No. 8 tram from Piazza Venezia to get to Trastevere and on the way back at night took a taxi which was easily available ( we stayed near the spanish steps)
Peaceful and Romantic Place for Dating. It's nice to walk around the town and explore all sorts of shop and restaurant. We dine at a Italian shop which serve delicious pizza and spaghetti.

Stumbled Upon. We stumbled upon this quaint neighborhood while walking the streets of Rome. This is not to be missed, as it is the essence of Rome. We ate at Trattoria de Teo and wish we had found it sooner. Shopping, socializing, drinking, and eating is what the area is about. Very quaint. Very unique!

Excellent Area. Proper old Italy, with lovely old buildings, and lots and lots of places to eat. Not expensive to eat at all. The best restaurants are the ones down the narrow alleyways. Very tiny places but excellent food. Best Gelato can be found in the area. There are also lots of little alleyways, and little open squares. Our hotel was located in this area and was very convenient and easy to get to all major tourist attractions. It is a very safe area to wander round no matter the time of day. Would definitely stay here again. Very central location.

Our favourite part of Rome. This neighbourhood of Rome is packed with sights, restaurants, cobblestone streets and the romantic picture you might have of Rome where you get the local feel of centuries past. Even though you'll get all this there is of course getting more and more touristy around the area surrounding the Basilica of Santa Maria in Trastevere. But this can be easily avoided if wished.

Lovely old area. Proper old Italy, with lovely old buildings, and many places to eat. Lots of little alleyways, and little open squares. I had a lovely lunch and a good wander round, and I may well stay in this area when I come again.
Great area on an evening. Good to walk around, have a drink and people watch. Lots of good restaurants. Good choice of small local shops.

Off the main track but interesting. Staying in this area enables you to distance yourself from the main attractions but still have access to them. Here you can experience local community activities and pay a reasonable price for a city.

Younger crowd here. We spent an afternoon and early evening exploring Trastevere on the recommendation of family members who love it. While there are lovely churches and beautiful sights, we were less enamoured of the area than others in Rome. There were more aggressive street vendors, and large crowds of drunk college-aged students. It wasn't our scene.

Beautiful place, amazing food!. It was such a beautiful place. Walked here from the Vatican. Had lunch and walked around, then walked back to the Vatican for our tour. Trastevere was a very calm, quiet place. So many restaurants to choose from, most being some of the best in Rome! The people were so friendly, many shops to look through. Lots of gelato shops.
A Happy Place. It was lovely to walk around this area with all of the Bars and Eateries. The shopkeepers and some locals were dressed in their traditional dress. It was definitely worth visiting.
Authentic. wonderful shops and restaurants. we had our first authentic Italian meal here. The area was great to walk around at anytime.

Great neighbourhood. A local recommended this neighbourhood to us for somewhere to eat and it's a really lovely area.
Mostly pedestrianised and with a great atmosphere in the evening with a mix of tourists and locals. Amazing bars and restaurants :-)
Amazing town!. Great for food and drinks! Lively at night with lots of music and bars! Friendly locals definatly felt like home!
Rick Steve's version. We went there to do Rick Steve's walking tour audio guide. It was interesing and the area was very charming. It wasn't my favorite place, but interesting to see.
Beautiful with Lots of Character. Loved Trastevere - the restaurants, shopping and entertainment were fabulous! Can't wait to visit again.

Great place to wander around or to sit and watch the world go by. This is the place to go if you want to immerse yourself in all that's great about Rome: the food, the atmosphere and things to see. The streets are narrow (some don't have footpaths which can be tricky if you are pushing a pram, especially given the improvised parking!).It has a great atmosphere: the place is buzzing, especially in the evenings. Lots of restaurants and cafes to choose from.It is also a good location to base yourself to see the sights, as many of the key sights are within walking distance.
Lovely.. Wonderful area looking the river Tiber. Variety of restaurants, bars and souvenirs shops. At night there is an artist playing the guitar on the street.

Lovely on a sunny day!. Everyone tells you to visit Trastevere for its pretty streets and lovely little restaurants and it doesn't disappoint. I went on a sunny Saturday afternoon when there were lots of Romans just out enjoying the weekend. And it makes a change from viewing ancient monuments!
Beautiful area. Lovely part of Rome, a bit of a walk from the main town but worth it with beautiful restaurants, piazza and general atmosphere.

So Cool!. We loved Trastevere! We walked from the Colosseum over the bridge into a more quiet neighbourhood. Streets were lined with various shops, restaurants and bars. We planked ourselves done at one and spent an afternoon sitting outside in the sun watching the world go by. Later we grabbed some food before making our way back to central Rome. Though still busy, was not as packed as central Rome and had a very chilled out vibe
I fell in love Trastevere. Wonderful place for walking . Very appropriate to have dinner in one of the fancy restaurants there. Authentic Italian atmosphere. I love this place.

Go see it. . In a modern European city one would not expect to be plunged into streets that seem more fitting to a Pasolini or Rossellini film but grab the chance before it is 'developed' . Tenements tower over narrow streets packed with street sellers and restaurants. Take a map because this is a maze of narrow alleys each one more interesting than the last. And all of it is only 10 or 20 minutes walking from all of Rome's main sites.

Cool place with best restaurants. We really enjoyed this area, despite it not linked quite so well by public transport as other areas over the river. Worth coming back in the evening as there are many restaurants to choose from.
An interesting area to explore. We walk around this area every visit. We find it charming and relaxing. There are some good places to stop for coffee or a meal, too.

Good vibe.... The name Trastevere literally means “across the Tiber” and it is a district across the river from the city center. The area was outside the city walls and was known for its artisan character during classical times. Nowadays, it is a very nice neighborhood, with charming narrow streets and closed squares, filled with restaurants, cafes and clubs, perfect for a nice evening stroll. It is, actually, a very good base for visiting the city, a short walk to the center, but quieter.

Wonderful Old Neighborhood. We had a great afternoon walking the streets of the old Roman neighborhood. This charming area is filled with sidewalk cafes and shops. The oldest Christian Church in Rome (Santa Maria in Trastevere) is located here, a great stop.
Lovely. We are here on holidays and are situated on Monteverde near Gianiccolo so every day we walk through Trastevere. It's a lovely part of town with pitoresque houses and streets.

Loved it. Such a lovely area full of shops, bars and restaurants. My partner and I stayed for 3 nights and we spent each evening strolling the streets of Trastevere. So much to see. Would definitely return.

Quaint. We went by taxi from Rome one day and wandered the back streets. The food was outstanding. In every little door way was gelato, pizza, jewellery and so much more. Was over joyed we found this jem and would go back in a heart beat

Nice part of Rome to wander around.. Our hotel manager called it "bohemian" and I guess that sums up Trastavere. Many vegan and vegetarian cafes, some vintage shops, small streets. Perfect to wander about for an hour or two.

An ideal base for a visit to Rome. If you want to live like a local during your stay in Rome then make your base here. Much quieter than Rome but only a short walk away, Trastevere offers an old world charm and a mch slower pace of life. The place really comes to life in evening with an abundance of places to eat and people watch. Would love to return one day.

Dinner in trastevere. Some interesting shops and stalls on way to dinner, good choice of restaurants, chose one slightly off the beaten track and weren't disappointed. Its an area with a nice eclectic feel.

Great atmosphere!. We rented an apartment for the week in this cozy, somewhat Bohemian part of Rome, and enjoyed it very much. The streets are largely pedestrian-only, and the place comes to life at night with locals and tourists alike walking, wining and dining. Grab a drink or a gelato after dinner and just people-watch in the Piazza Santa Maria Trastevere by the fountain.
A beautiful old part of Rome. This part of Rome should not be missed. An old part of the city, with narrow streets and lots to see.
Cute with lot of bars and pubs. Very cool neighbourhood with lot of things to see. Wander around in the little streets and get a cocktail in the tiniest bars.
Rome for the Romans. A charming area full of character; market, bars, restaurants, churches. Spend all day ambling around. Good place to stay as well.

Place to eat in Rome. It's great to get away from the centre and experience a slower pace of life in Trastevere. Huge choice of eateries. Our tour guide recommended The Jewish Quarter for good authentic food.

Do not expect to much.... We spend there about two hours what was just enough about it.The buildings were old and nice but this was a good part the rest of it is dirty and trashy.You can go there to see but do not expect to much...

Stay here if you can!. I had an Airbnb in this neighborhood and it was the best! It is the cutest area, not as crowded during the day of tourists. Beautiful piazza, church, and buildings of all colors. I always caught a fun street performer in the piazza. Super close to the center of the city by a short bus or tram ride (10 mins or less). Great night life and restaurants are amazing!

you must come here for the local food !!!. this is the perfect neighborhood to explore and try out authentic Roman food away from the tourists and crowds! DO NOT MISS IT!there's no subway access to this area of the city but you can take the bus or a taxi!
Best place to eat. There are tons of great places to eat in this area. You can choose from the typical cuisine all the way to the more exotic. The area is also lively to people watch

BEST part of Rome. Important to take a trip here while in Rome. Best authentic Italian food I have had in the entire city, and for a good price. After eating a great lunch and Il Ponentino, we sat in Piazza di Santa Maria for hours watching street performances varying from bands to clowns to a girl dancing with fire. Also, GREAT gelato
Cute little part of Rome!. I loved the adorable streets of Trastevere! They were filled with great places to eat and little local shops. Definitely check this area out for 2 hours.

Vibrant Piazzas and NIghtlife. It is best to go to Gianicolo a grassy knoll like area is a lovely place to get a panoramic view of the area before you decide where to go for the evening. Why not hang out on Piazza Santa Maria before you decide where to go. I didn't stay for the nightlife but I did enjoy a light bite at a cafe at the end of a busy day exploring Rome. I would love to go back and check it out a bit more next time. The area looked like everyone was ready for the night to begin.
Great nightlife.. Great Bars & Restaurants, area has a real buzz in the evening, beautiful Churches and Squares, great nightlife

Buzzing area of Rome!. Stayed at the San Francesco hotel a short walk away from the heart of Trastevere. Amazing variety of restaurants and bars for every taste and budget. Highly recommended and will return!

Fun!!!. Decided to meander with no plan for a change (spent several days being a tourist checking off boxes) and it was wonderful. This part of Rome is quaint, peaceful, and a great place to get lost. We parked down near John Cabot university which was a good location to just walk from. We stuck our head in Villa Farnesina which was serene and breath taking then had the best cappuccino of our trip at Caffe Settimiano. While enjoying the cappuccino we were entertained by authentic Romans who have earned the right to own this little corner of the world. Then we just walked and popped into random boutiques as we stumbled upon them.
The town within a town. Trastevere is the most intriguing and lively arw in Rome. Nice bars and good restaurants along with a relaxed beat. Go there or be square
Great people watching and fantastic food.. A fun area with wonderful restaurants and shopping.Lots of people coming and going, but a good mix of tourists and Italians.
Get lost in the small streets and absorb the atmosphere. Great place to explore, better in the late afternoon and evevening with plenty of places to eat and drink.
Old world charm. Great place to get lost in, food ,bakery's , atmosphere! Such great history. We visited 4 times and still could have come back for more.

Lovely bars, restaurants and shops. Great atmosphere. Cute little bars and restaurants, cool shops including a great second hand bookshop with books in English. It's really pretty here and it's perfect for an evening drink and stroll or a nice dinner or lunch.

a true taste of rome. When you have done all the classic sights - colloseum, forum etc - cross the Tiber to this fascinating area full of character, cobbled streets, local shops and numerous restaurants as well as many historic churches. You can also make the climb up the Janiculum Hill for breathtaking views over the city
Full of character. A little less high tone than some other parts of Rome but a charming and interesting district to wander through, particularly if you're looking for somewhere to eat.

Authentically Roman Experience, Not a Tourist Trap. Don’t miss this place if you are looking for unconventional, bohemian atmosphere. Once a place for working class, now preferred by artists, students or uncustomary people. It’s narrow and disorienting streets, old architecture and the way the old and the new are mixed make Trastevere a place unique in Rome.Before to "cross the river":Setup your expectations Have a GPS or map with youAlthough there are lot of options to eat in Trastevere, not all are equal so have a list done before going there.

You must take the time to visit here.. This is like a neighborhood you would find in any big city with its own feel. Plan on eating a good meal here as well as hearing some live music. It is a relaxing and fun place to stroll through while eating some delicious gelato.
based at hotel san francesca. lovely area , lots of small shops in winding small streets. Lots of lovely places to eat and small bars.

WOW. A true Roman experience. Most recommended - to take an early morning walk at the neighborhood when only locals are at the streets. All the little little streets inside are so lovely. At night, it is very crowded but happy. Many very-good places to eat & drink.

College Town. We were hoping for more...this would have been further down on our list of things to do in Rome. The town has a college feel. We would recommend walking down the river on the other side, next to the Ghetto, it is a much nicer area.
Cool cool neighborhood. This is the best area of Rome to stay in b/c you get a feel for the night life in this neighborhood. Its where the Romans really live!

A Village by The City. We found Trastevere almost by accident when we decided to cross the river. It's lively but styrangely tranquil. Yes there are tourists but lots of locals going about their daily life too. Excellent restaurants and bars with reasonable prices If in Rome, don't miss Trastevere

Trastevere a great neighborhood. We stayed for a week at the Santa Maria Hotel, an old convent turned into 20 rooms--great location-secured gate-great daily breakfast included-lovely garden setting-comfortable beds-use Rick Steve's book for discount or pay in Euros discount

Quaint neighborhood with great restaurants. Trastevere is just across the river and within walking distance, especially to the Piazza Navona area where we stayed. One of our favorite pizza restaurants, Dar Poeta, is in this neighborhood. This is an area where the locals go. Definitely worth a visit.

The most beautiful quarter of Rome. Impossible to describe, because you can only live Trastevere.
The air of the river, the wind in your hair, wonderful houses, taverns and inns where he lives the good and genuine Italian cuisine.
Great foodie area not to be missed!. A great place to visit if you are a foodie. We planned our own food tour based on reviews on trip advisor and spent 7 hours here!
Beautiful place. Best for night walk and drink. Good value try lazania! Nice piazza full of life until late night with music inthe streets!

Lovely to wander around, many good restaurants . This area reminds me of the Latin quarter in Paris. A bit touristy but still worth a visit. The area is full of restaurants where ever you look so get trip advisor out to see which are worth a visit or you could be disappointed. Nice to combine with a walk along the river.

Quartiere Caratteristico. Very Local Place , but at the Same time truistic, full of americans because the John Cabot Universit is just behind the corner with 2500 students, Very Cheap Restaurant and pubs

Great for wandering around exploring.... We spent lots of time walking along the Tiber, and in the neighborhood. It's definitely got a certain vibe to everything. We never did manage to take a tram, although we wanted to. Another time...

Little village in Rome. Trtastevere is the second oldest part of Rome... little village inside Rome. You can walk hours there. Have a glass of prosecco on many coffees in the courtguard. Many good and not overly expensive restaurants to choose from. Trastevere has got it's own great feeling about it. I just love it and go back there all the time.

Great little area in Rome. Our hotel recommended we go to this area for dinner one night, and we were very glad we did. Small streets lined with little shops and unique restaurants, very walkable, and quite lively after dinner hours with many people having drinks and hanging out. I love this little area!

Lovely area. Lots and lots of restaurants, bars and cafés, musicians playing on squares, artists showing their skills... The area has very good atmosphere and it's best enjoyed by walking around the small streets or sitting down in one of the multiple restaurants.

Live in the action. We chose to stay in this neighborhood cause it's close close enough to the sites but far enough to be in a hood that has got some local pulse. Lots of great restaurants and I recommend staying in a home.
Rabbits Den!. The couple of bars we found were great but we ended up getting a taxi back to the central rome because the street signs were useless and it was too dark for the tourist maps!

So Italian. This is a lovely part of Rome lots of cafes, independent shops and restaurants . Stroll round the lovely streets and soak up the true Italian atmosphere felt safe and would like to of gone back at night but ran out of time, oh well will have to go back!!!!

Unrivalled beauty and history. Trastevere is an unspoilt area of an increasingly touristic city. If you're looking for a place where you can relax and enjoy the most beautiful streets and piazzas in Rome - without being pestered by street vendors or 'tour guides' - Trastevere is for you. When next visiting Rome, I will definitely be staying in this wonderful part of the city.

Great Location. Close (walking distance) to Old Roma and Vatican but a little quieter with lots of small eateries and churches off the main path. Highly recommend staying in this area if you visit Rome.

Great location to stay and to eat while in Rome.. We loved staying in this neighborhood. Very cool piazzas, fantastic restaurants, a very pretty church, and good walking to most of the typical Roman sights.

stay here when you are in rome. find an air bnb in this area because you will eventually end up here late at night. that way you will be in you neighborhood when you are ready to go home. it is walking distance or quick public transit everywhere else.
The little village in Rome. Nice spot a bit aside the typical tourist areas. Its a nice place to hang out at night. Many little restaurants and bars
A must see. We loved it so much we went back a second time. The shopping is great and walking along the cobblestone streets took you back in time.

Trastevere and Isola make a tremendous one two hop over the river walking half day. There's a pace and tone in these two neighborhoods unlike anywhere else in Rome. It's almost going paese village style as in parts of Umbria, Campania, Salerno or Puglia. Yes, it's not so "authentic" as it was. Time changes everything, especially in terms of the influence of mass media. Where laundry actually hangs in Naples or Catania, one gets th feeling it's put out as window dressing for the tourists to admire, though that sounds a bit smug even to myself.Less frivolously, Trastevere offers nice eating, more interesting shops and visual walking bonuses in every direction. It's best quality is its psychological juxtaposition or counterpoint to the rest of Rome that demands attention and concentrated energy, yet the layback Trestevere/Isola experience lies conveniently within a quick bus ride of the Vatican area.All roads may well have once lead to Rome, but thankfully this corner involves a road gratefully --- a bit less traveled and that --- makes all the difference.

Wonderful. The most charming neighborhood in all of Rome is Trastevere! We went there two night's. It's really a wonderful place to loose your self and walk around. Drink wine eat pizza take your ice cream everything its so cool. Late at night walk next to Tiber river !

Great Dining!. Meaning across the Travere, or Tiber in Latin, it is worth a walk across the river. On our Foodie Tour, we walked past Food Trucks set up in piazza selling a variety of foods. We enjoyed wonderful Roman Pizza, cacio e pepe and gelato and the other side of the Tiber too!

Awesome place!. I do consider Trastevere one of the most romantic places on Earth..Besides the fact that the whole place, the surroundings, the buildings look surrealistic, kind of a dream or an old theme location built for an original Italian movie, it's always full of cosy restaurants offering authentic cuisine where you can spend an unforgettable night..

a must!. Your trip to Rome is not complete until you've lost yourself in the streets of Trastevere, one of the oldest neighborhoods in Rome. It's romantic, old, hip, amuzing, amazing, surprising and delicious! just go and take a walk! and a gelato...

Good for foodies. This area, across the Tiber, is a great area for cafes, restaurants and specialty small food shops. The best way to get to know Trastevere is to book a "foodie tour". Do it early in your trip and you will learn where to get the best pizza, snacks and pastries in Rome.
Hidden fun. I was walking to vatican through exploring this district, really enjoyed it and saw some places can't remember their names but i hope, if any one can tell me plz comment

Right place to meet local people.. I took a trip just last week to Rome and I've found a nice airbnb place in Trastevere. The place amazed me as I thought it would very crowded with tourists as the place is very close to tourists places in the central city of Rome. In fact the Trastevere is much quieter place at night except you can heared sometimes people walking while talking in English loud probably because some people have been intoxicated from enjoying out but all are part of the life of people in Trastevere. The place has so many things to offer like to meet local people by eating at the local restaurants and coffee shops in the area which serves real authentic Italian food and latte machiatto. The lovely Piazza Santa Maria must a place to visit. Anybody heading to Rome has to visit Trastevere, the place where if you are in Rome do what the Romans do. Go to eat, walk, watch around and enjoy the Italian ice cream.
Great bars!. We spent the evening here hopping from lovely bar to lovely bar watching the world go by! Most are reasonable priced & offer great food, this is where the locals eat & drink!

Romantic side of Rome. Trstevere is such a romantic area in Rome. The restaurants and cafes along the side streets are all well decorated and picturesque. It's not as crowded as the other areas. The cobble stoned streets and overall ambiance makes a perfect area for strolling both during the day and at night.Piazza Santa Maria is the heart of the district with the church in the square.Via del Moro is the shopping street that has cute stores.Definitely worth your time.

nice area. I thought Rome hasn't night life until I went there.Too many restaurants,bars and etc cheap and worth it.There is a panic in the streets because of many people waiting to sit at the restaurants.trastevere is just amazing area for all kind of people!

Nooks in Rom not for tourists only. Trastevere is worth a visit anytime, but I liked mostly just rambling around this district in twilight whilst listening to the whisper of the old town lit by dimly glowing street laterns. Somehow almost a creepy feeling, were it not so beautiful and engulfing.
BEST FOOD in ROMA!. This area is hands down the best for real Italian food. We made the mistake of not coming to this area sooner. Less crowded, less tourist driven menus.

A little disappointing. With Trastevere being considered the 'real' Rome, I wasn't prepared for how unauthentic it felt. While the winding streets and alleys had character there was too much of the same starched tablecloth restaurants and gifts shops everywhere else in Rome.Given the odd glimpse of a local craftsmen, or a locals coffee bar, you see what it was, but as conversations with a few locals revealed, the area is being gentrified and there is a lot of tension about it.A real shame.
To see . It's not easy to travel with a stroller and the baby in it in Rome, but the place is really nice and worth to be seen for its unique Roman style and atmosphere

Left for last, but so glad we made it.. Wasn't really in my top 10 things to do, since we had been to the for dinner one night and it seemed OK. On our last free morning in Rome we headed over to Trastevere for a little walk and some breakfast. Totally different experience in the daytime. This is a true historic neighborhood. Regular folks involved in daily life. People are setting up cafes, opening stores, buying groceries, alongside famous artwork, next to medieval fountains, and in the shadow ancient churches, and it's no big deal. Unreal. The little area is quaint and vivacious, and I am so glad we got back. Bring some kind of walking guidebook with you, there are so many nice things to see.

My favourite district of the city. Out of all the places I visited in Rome, this area was my favourite. It has a great ambience and looks like a photographers dream. People watch with a cocktail at a street side bar or enjoy a delicious evening meal. You won't regret taking the time to explore this neighbourhood.
If you just want to wander. Wandering around the streets taking it all in. Dropping in for a glass of wine and generally watching the world go by, then this is the place

Best nightlife in Rome. Great part of the city with so much to do. Delicious restaurants, bars, and clubs. Several Airbnb homes to rent as well as hotels. If you are a young professional traveling by yourself, or with 1-5 people, Trastevere is definitely the best place to launch from. The area is full of locals and not overrun by tourists.

My favorite neighborhood in Rome. Some may find it touristy but I especially enjoy the quiet mornings before any establishments open.There are a lot of hole in the wall restaurants and local designer shops you can check out. As a yuppie, I find the neighborhood so charming. We walked to most of the sites from this neighborhood especially enjoying the Tiber river while eating a bag of fresh cherries! Would love to stay here again in my next visit :)

Restaurants Galore!. We had 3 dinners in Trastevere and they each improved upon the previous one, with all three being decent up to terrific! It can be a challenge to get around unless you have good cell phone or paper maps. it is fun to explore and we loved the smells - couldn't believe the number of options before us! This area is easy to walk to from much of touristy Rome. Don't miss it!

THE place to visit. Wandering around the streets, looking at the market stalls, listening to the music played and eating well at one of the many restaurants. What more could one want in Rome. Much quieter than the Centro Storico di Roma.

Magical Roman Quartier. Trastevere is the most amusing place in Rome, full of bar, restaurants, shops and street artists, will surprise you every day of the year for the quantity of nice people around. There is always something to do, to see, to visit, to watch, to eat or to listen in Trastevere. You would never leaves his place!

Pittoresque roman place. It s a nice area for going out and having dinner or apero. This is close to the river Tevere and it is full of rests. During spring it s wonderful walking along the river and their pubs bar rests.

Fell in love with Trastevere. My husband and I stayed in a condo rental in Trastevere during our 3 nights in Rome. I have to say when our car pulled up late at night we were a little skeptical because of all of the graffiti on the buildings and wondered if we had made a mistake. That impression couldn't have been further from the truth. Trastevere is a lovely, lively area that allows visitors to experience some of the local's Rome. We were out late all 3 nights and felt safe and alive the entire time. When in Rome, roam around Trastevere.

Camera verloren/ lost photocamera. I have lost my photocamera on 22-03 or 23-03 in the centre of Rome, Trastevere or around the Colosseum/ Forum Romanum. It is a black panasonic photocamera in a pink bag with flowers. I've anyone found it please let me know, the photos are very important to us

perhaps more by reputation than for reality. Trastevere is an area that extends around the Trastevere Avenue, and consists of a myriad of narrow streets and tangled. in summer an incredible amount of small local one after another, with a welter of people crowded its streets, in a continuous noise of chatter, too much alcohol and too much traffic. go with the media is absolutely not recommended, parking spaces are very few, and the roads are a continuous crowd of machines that are desperately trying to stop. the locals are friendly, sometimes local, sometimes just tourist traps, which are attracted by the fame of the place but eventually find themselves sitting in uncomfortable chairs, dirty tables and poor food. if you want to go and see the place, it's fun, full of life and small road shows, but you must be careful of what you want and you get. attentive to the rooms where you stop, looking first seem like those who already are eating, if they are happy with what we have in the pot. if you want to instead just an ice cream or a drink, no problem, the ice cream thank goodness they do it well a little everywhere here in Rome. Also beware of the portfolios. not that there's anything in particular, but as in any place where people crowded, it's easy for someone to stretch your hand where you should not.

Nice place and excellent place to eat and very good prices. Visit trastevere for dinner and walk to the beautiful streets very romantic and relaxing way to have dinner there and drink wine after a long day
Great neighbour hood. Go go go there, you can not miss this. If you are in Rome, visit this area when you have seen all on your must do list, and take a time out while experiencing Trastevere

Alleys are the best. We had nice hotel in Trastevere and i must say that this part of Rome is full of nice small restaurants and shops. There is lot of alleys eith different shops and walking around these is taking lot's of time. Icecream, pizza, beer, coctails what else...
lovely saturday afternoon getting lost in the lanes. set aside a bit of time for just wandering about - keep away from the tourist restaurants and bars and find the little hidden places

Tiny streets, history and gelato!. Away from the hustle and bustle of central Rome, Trastevere is a network of streets with high-sided buildings which offer some respite from the hot Roman sun.
Be sure to try one of the many Gelato sellers and sit by the Tiber to recuperate.

The real Rome. If you want to feel the 'real Rome', you must visit Trastevere. You will find there old buildings with beautiful balconies, tiny streets, small tratorias and the beautiful church 'Santa Maria in Trastevere'.

Relaxed and romantic...and intense. Trastevere gives you the possibility to relax eand enjoy Rome: lots of cafees, restaurants, some nice music bars, and romantic streets and alleys to flirt with somone ;)
Foodie heaven!. A peaceful respite from the hectic city during the daytime, which comes alive in the evening. A plethora of great dining options.
Carlos mento restaurant for dinner. Rick Stevens suggests this area of Rome and we are so glad we walked from our hotel at night. Very safe and the restaurant was the best and extremely reasonable

A very popular area now. Years back, when first visiting Rome, this was a very quite area. Now it is full of wonderful music and eating and enjoying, especially in the evenings. Gelato on fountain stairs, yes!

Foood. Nicest restaurants very italian very friendly district.very good food
Jewish getto is quite close.
Must visit district!
Loved all the cobbled streets. Lovely area to wander around and we came across a photography Street Life exhibition which added to the pleasure.

Rome Untouched. Do not miss charming Trastevere and its narrow cobbled stoned streets. this part of town comes alive at night and is known for its many pubs, restaurants and small shops. Be sure to stop by one of the oldest basilicas the main square, Santa Maria in Trastevere.
great food and entertainment. amazing place,very artistic and bohemian. a lot of small shops, restaurants. amazing to walk and lost in the labyrinth

Quaint and charming. Trastevere is a quaint and charming little district on the opposite bank of the river Tiber, easily accessible via the Ponte Sisto or Ponte Sant'Angelo. There are far fewer tourists here and one can enjoy an easy and relaxed stroll.You could go up to the top of Janiculum Hill via Trastevere, for a wonderful panorama of the city of Rome.There is a very impressive fountain at the top of the hill as well.On the way, you would pass the mausoleum, that contains the remains of those who were killed, while defending Rome, under the leadership of Garibaldi.

My favourite area of Rome. Relaxed, friendly atmosphere - not as bustling as most areas - little stalls in the streets, some great places to eat freshly prepared food, bohemian atmosphere. Beautiful church in the piazza.

Different sort of Roman history. A great place to go to see older Rome that isn't Roman or Baroque. Very down to earth but with lots of great restaurants. For English speakers go to the Around the corner bookshop - owner is fab.
Our favorite district,. This area seems to have an monopoly on the good food of Rome. We did a eating tour of this area and it was the highlight of our trip.
A bit touristy but still lovely. We enjoyed wandering the tiny streets and looking at all the old buildings. The great thing was there were no selfie stick vendors!

Trastevere. Stroll through the busy streets, sit and have a drink at the bars, visit the churches, look at the wares from local artists. These streets change daily and just buzz with activity. Excellent restaurants in this area.
If in Trastevere, I recommend Villa Farnesina. Great neighborhood for a stroll; lots of character. My second favorite attraction in all of Rome is Villa Farnesina, which is in Trastevere.

A hidden gem. Not a very touristy locale, suggested by my italian friends, we had a romantic evening away from the hustle and bustle of the city along the River Tiber. The local stalls, food and sangria totally made our evening !

True heart of Rome!. Hungry? Thirsty? Don't look for any other places. Just go directly to Trastevere. Dozens of bistro, restaurants, cafes and bars serving real Lazio food! Once you try, you're not gonna like it anywhere else :) The essence of Lazio and Rome!

Charming Trastevere!. Loved this location just outside of Rome. From it's cobble stone streets to it's well-worn painted buildings, this area is filled with old world charm. Lots of good shopping and wonderful restaurants.
Perfect for couples. This place is perfect to getting out all the noise of Rome, is like a tiny village inside Rome where an atmosphere of peace and love is everywhere, food is cheaper and better.

Great neighbours. I stayed with a friend of mine on this very same street in the photo and we had very nice neighbours; quite friendly and the nightlife was not lacking either. Easy access to Termini and also scooter rentals. Definitely a place to stay again..

Great hotels & food... plenty of public transportation too !. This has gotten to be our favorite part of Rome... the "city" away from the "city" ! A quick cab ride to just about anywhere, plenty of hotels and great food... and terrific old and winding streets to meander through. This is not a priority destination of you've only got a day or two to spend in Rome... but if you can squeeze in some extra time it's worth the trip !
Charming!. This is just a lovely place to wander, eat and shop. Except for thestreets with cars, it seemed like I fell backwards in time!

Let yourself get lost!. I loved Trastevere - I visited here on my first afternoon in Rome. I wandered for ages in and out and down every little cobbled street past many tavernas, cafes and bars. It is a very beautiful but old neighbourhood and I felt like I had stepped back in time being here. Beautiful old buildings, painted in bright colours now warn down, with washing hangings out the windows and flowers on the window ledges and cats sleeping on old moped seats. Give yourself time, take of your watch and just wander. Many great photo opportunities here if you are into it.

True Spirit of Rome. This predominantly residential neighborhood is away from the crowds and exudes a more authentic Roman vibe. The cobbled streets, narrow alleys, and steep hills are what comes to when one thinks of a historic European town, which Trastevere still preserves. It's located west of the city center and Palatine Hill across the Tiber, and south of the Vatican City. The best way to get here is by walking across Rome's many adorned bridges, but if you want to take the metro, buy a BIT Standard Ticket at any station for 1.50 euros, which allows you a 1-way trip of any distance (100-minute time limit is enforced if you're using the bus). Take Line B to Piramide, which then requires a 10-minute walk uphill to reach this district; Rome has the simplest public transit system in Europe because there are only 2 metro lines that run like an "X" through the city.
Quaint area to visit. Quaint area to walk around with many bars and restaurants and some interesting shops. We had a lovely meal there.

best place to stay. this is the old working district of Rome it retains the old world charm, all the streets are cobbled and buildings old without much signage or modern additions - best area for food, and to sit outside with a glass of wine in the evening

The Hidden Oasis of Trastevere - VedaVita Yoga Art Studio. We travelled many cities in Italy to say without doubt Rome is our favorite. And within Rome, Trastevere is our favorite neighbor, there you can find anything: amazing restaurants, theaters, culture, and because we love to explore the city we were amazed by VedaVita Yoga Art Studio. It's definitely our favorite place there. So hidden that is still not listed here in TripAdvisor, that makes even more special. They are in the heart of Trastevere (Via San Michele, 12) and they have yoga, Aikido classes for all ages, in different styles. I tried Iyengar and was super nice. My husband tried one open class of Aikido as he likes martial arts. We loved the teacher and the owners, super friendly from Milano, they have a lot of experience with Asian arts - inclusive Culinary. They invited us for a dinner and oh my god, the best food I ever had in Italy, I mean, really, in my life. They are vegetarian and vegan chefs back in Milan and they ministry cooking classes once a month in that place. We did one class one saturday and was soooo nice, funny and delicious. At the and we realized we became addicted to there... Such a nice environment, nice people from all over the world. To culminate our experience, I comented that I had a backache (from the backpack traveling) and they suggested us to do a massage in the little spa area they just inaugurated. I had a calm healing one and my husband had a shiatsu. We left the place floating... we are 'heavy users' of massage places specially in Asia and they are in the same level. You should consider visit them and discover the best place in Rome. We visit many places in Italy following their suggestion and was amazing. We were super amazed and in love with Krishna Kanta and Munindra and their amazing staff...

A wonderful, charming area of Rome. We love Trastevere. It is close (walking distance) to so much of Rome. It's adjacent to he Tiber River with numerous picturesque bridges, one, the Ponte Fabrico, is the oldest in Rome, built in 62 BC and still in service. The streets for the most part are narrow, cobblestone, with barely room for vehicles and simultaneous pedestrians. Small shops, highly rated restaurants, cafes line the majority of streets. There are historic churches, with amazing art and architecture seemingly around every corner. We rented an apartment that was in a building built in the 14th Century (the interior had, of course, been updated/renovated numerous times). The area reminds me of some older areas of New York's Greenwich Village but is much, much more genuine, charming and inviting.When we return to Rome, it will be to Trastevere as our "headquarters".

Don't leave Rome without spending an evening at Trasevere!. You don't go to Trastevere for museum, expositions or any other world famous attraction you may find in Roma. No, you go there to get lost in typical roman streets, eat in good tratorria at a decent price and enjoy the roman night life. Just great!

Rome 2016. You must find this small town- the food was so much cheaper than in city centre- a meal for 2 including coffees & a soft drink was 28 Euros! It was excellent too!!! lots to see around the town
A "to get away from Tourists". Where the real Roman live. Not worth the trip in the off season unless you have great weather! Bus 75 from Termini!

Wonderful neighborhood that takes you back in time with its cobbled/narrow streets and plazas, shopping and restaurants!. A friend had recommend going here during my first visit and it didn't disappoint. We enjoyed walking around and exploring this neighborhood but it was rainy so we didn't explore as much as we wanted to. It's very active/popular at night.

Must walk around Trastevere. especially for night time dining.. wonderful neighborhood that you shouldn't miss. great restaurants. Don't miss the church and you go there by one bridge and leave by another.

Trastevere by night. If one has some time to spend in Rome, a trip to the lively enclave of Trastevere (meaning "across/beyond the Tiber") is strongly encouraged. Stroll through the narrow streets of this ancient multicultural section of Rome and dine at one of the many restaurants. Be sure to allot ample time afterward for a gelati and lengthy stroll. Trastevere is a place see people and be seen by others and the casual "passegiata" is not only a great way to burn off a few calories from a substantial meal, but it provides a window into Italian culture and diversity.

Best area in Rome!. After being recommended by our hotel we decided to venture into the area. So glad we did! So many great restaurants, cafes, bars, shops and the area is just buzzing! Small cobbled streets make it feel so authentic. Would definitely recommend a visit!

Less crowded & still interesting.. We walked through this area across the river from our hotel.There are many narrow, winding cobblestone streets with small shops and restaurants. We visited a number of churches, including Santa Cecilia, San Francesco a Ripa, Basilica Santa Maria in Trastevere. In one, a nun was playing the organ- quite special. There were very few tourists on the streets, so it was easy to enjoy this pleasant walk.

Don't worry if you miss it. We went to check out this place, as we had time to kill in Rome and Rick Steves has an audio guide for it. Sadly that audio guide isn’t very interesting—at least it wasn’t to us. (I believe this was the only one we listened to it that we didn’t enjoy on our trip to Venice, Florence, and Rome aside from the pasta one, which doesn’t tell you much new information if you’ve been raised by a family who emigrated from Italy not too many generations back.) However, we did enjoy the free views from Piazza Garibaldi at the top of the hill and we were lured into Cajo & Gajo, which was a lot of fun—great staff, music, free snacks (pizza and fries) & Wi-Fi. We sat outside under an awning with a nice heater—it was the perfect temperature on this March night to watch a storm pass by. (They also have fleece blankets on the chairs should you want one during your visit to the restaurant.)If you’re into churches, there are two of note here. One was closed the day we visited but the other wasn’t. (The open one was Santa Maria.)We were a bit surprised just how many tourists were her in early March given how easy it was to get in to the Colosseum and other attractions.

Rome restaurant bonanza . Excellent number of places to eat and survey the passers by. The cobblestone streets can be a bit tricky to walk over, but if you ignore the beggars and don't fixate on the graffiti you can find great restaurants. Don't get pulled into the more "touristy" places.

Lovely neighbourhood. This area comes alive at night with little bars and restaurants opening up. A short stroll into the centre of Rome makes it the perfect place to stay. We wouldn't hesitate to stay in Trastevere again.
Little Italy in Rome?. At least if you remember the feel of Little Italy, NY from years gone by. Food, shops, strolling through outdoor markets. Go back in time!
Enjojable. Take your time to discover the many streets and fantastic buildings of this quarter. It's amazing, and worth more than one visit.
Another must see. No matter at what time you stroll around in Trastevere, it is always very lively with nice cafes, restaurants, bars, galleries and beautiful Piazzas!
Lots of action here. In this neighborhood you will find a lot of action in the night. Lots of good restaurants in the area too. It is a really tourist friendly place in Rome.
Great area in Rome . .. There are numerous great restaurants and places to stroll in this great area in Rome. At night it also turns into a great night spot. . . ..This is worth the visit.
Lovely place. Nice town just a walk across the bridge it's nice too see the other side of the bridge and glad we did little streets and bars you have too visit.

Peaceful area. Oh, this is the perfect area in Rome to just wander, explore all the narrow streets and try to get lost. Suddenly you will find a nice little place, some strange houses or shops to visit. Trastevere is nice and quiet, and a great place to stress down from the busy streets of Rome. Find yourself a little cafe, have some lunch and watch other tourists walk by - enjoy.

Away from the oodles. Well, Rome got many nice and cozy streets but in this neighborhood it is a bit quieter and easy to find a fine place to eat or to rest. If you find it interesting the synagogue and Jewish museum is worth a visit, the Jewish community in Rome is the most ancient in Europe.
Medievall Wonder. What a charming place. Close your eyes and you go back in time. Narrow streets, little shops and charming cafes. You can spend several hours here

Very pretty. I wandered these narrow little streets in the afternoon and thought they were very quaint and pretty, I could imagine myself here in the evening in a little restaurant sipping wine or an espresso having something wonderful to eat!
The area for food and drink. This is definitely THE area to head to for food and drink when in Rome. Lots of lovely restaurants and bars etc. Nice and lively and a great atmosphere.
Cosy neighbourhood. Be sure to spend time here, cosy streets, Squares, cafes, restaurants and shops. Also try some of the side streets, where there are a lot of authentic life.

Fascinating district. A quirky neighbourhood of lanes,piazzas and alleyways. The Church of Maria has a spectacular mosaic facade and a glorious internal dome. Lots of restaurants and cafes and we found an amazing tiny pizza shop, heaving with locals buying lunch. The pizza was divine! A short walk across the bridge takes you back to the Pantheon.
Relaxing and quiet. The place to go to get away from the hustle of the city. Lots of cafes and restaurants. The climb up the hill is worth it for the view.

authentic Italy. This was my favourite place on my trip to Rome a beautiful area with authentic Italian traditional restaurants and quirky bars little also street stalls !! The Comedy man with a box of tricks in the main square was hilarious !!!!

Hidden Delights. A small food walking tour revealed local culinary treasures around every corner with local artisans, producers and even residents eager to help; what, where, when and how to shop and eat; definitely the highlight of this trip. Can't wait to return; but I'll make more time on my next visit!!
A great neighborhood. This is a great neighborhood to walk around with good bars and restaurants. Trendy like Soho in NYC. Good night life

The more relaxed part of Rome. Cross the river and it's almost like you're in another city. This is the more relaxed area of Rome, lots of students, and therefore cheaper restaurants and accommodations. Still plenty to see, but I love sitting outside enjoying a coffee or wine, or taking photographs down the side streets.

Hidden Treasure. A bit off the beaten track, we found this area by accident, but felt the half hour walk from our hotel was well worth the effort. We went back that evening and subsequent evening for evening meal as prices and variety much better than in the main tourist areas. Well worth a visit.

Quaint streets!!. We loved this area of Rome it is what you expect old Rome to be like.
It has lovely little streets and piazzas which are very cute and picturesque.
We found a lovely bar/restaurant in San Callisto piazza called cajo and gojo's a must!

Great for food. This is a great area for food in Rome, the area is very safe at night and full of good trattorias and small pizza cafes, it is lovely to amble around the little narrow winding streets, finding something different round each corner.we really like the area.

Traditional old area. Trastevere is one of the oldest area in Rome, it's full of restaurants and bars... it's were the local hang out after an hectic day. i went there in my food tour...it's a hidden gem in Rome.
You can visit Santa Maria Trastevere church while walking in the area as well pass by the tiber river

Great bars and restaurants...for the younger crowd. This place has some lovely restaurants and bars, just wander round and you'll find one no problem. But the main draw here is the atmosphere...it's where the locals go, there's street performers and people stood outside bars drinking and generally having a good night. Don't come here for a quiet sophisticated night though...it's more of a younger crowd/students.

step back in time. we wondered around the side streets of this area and just admired the original old style buildings people are friendly and in a small square we stopped at for drinks just watched the people casually going about their business great place to get lost for a day well worth a visit

Lovely area with narrow streets, good restaurants and great atmosphere. Have been coming to Rome every 2 years since 2000 ( for the six nations rugby) and didn't know this area existed.Our hotel receptionist recommended we eat there. She said it used to be a very poor area of Rome but is now known for its numerous restaurants. She also stressed that it is a vey safe area to wander around, even very late at night.We ate at the restaurant La Miraggio a Trastevere on the Via Della Lungara which is on the edge of the area.When we return to Rome we will definitely eat here again. The atmosphere was fabulous, typical noisy Italian restaurant with lovely helpful staff. The food was great, we had deep fried stuffed zucchini flowers and fried baby squid for starters followed by seafood tagliatelle and suckling pig with sautéed potatoes for mains washed down with a carafe of nice red house wine - absolutely delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed it but don't come here if you want a quiet romantic meal in an expensive setting.

A special place away from the crowds of Rome. It was a quick trip (can walk from central Rome) across the Tiber River where the ancient streets meet and the crowds disappear. This is a great place to "get away" from it all. We loved walking the ancient streets. There is a OMG great restaurant called Sette oche in Altalena which you have to try. It was AMAZING! Try the Gnocchi, Tiramisu and the homemade wine. The staff were great with recommendations. Very casual, laid back feel. It is a special place.

narrow streets and small restaurants. We visited this area during the day and at first I couldn't see what the fuss was with regarding visiting during the evening, however after walking around I can see what the appeal was and I would love to have seen it at night.
afternoon and night delight!. beautiful typical Roman place , you shouldn't miss it , lots of personality , nice place to walk around , good restaurants , locals enjoy it , really a must in Rome

Beautiful neighborhood. Gorgeous area of Rome with pedestrian-only streets and wonderful restaurants and bars. Much more intimate than other areas of the city, although I love all of Rome. Will definitely come back here on my next weekend trip to Rome!

Excellent food & very reasonable. Loads of great restaurants and a really lovely atmosphere . shopping in the evenings. If you go past the square take the first turning to right there is a small restaurant which has really lovely food

The coolest and cheaper neighbor to eat & drink!. Amazing places to eat at a fair price and lovely bars to drink and meet people.
We had a really great time over there.

Fell in love with Trastevere. Some neighborhoods just give you a good vibe. This was the case in Montmartre and now in Trastevere. We fell in love with this lovely neighborhood of Rome. The hustle and bustle of the streets in the evening, the smiles on people's faces, the wonderful food you get to eat here, the lovely gelato, the streets, the architecture, everything is perfect. Take a stroll down it's streets in the evening, choose a restaurant and enjoy some delicious pasta and wine. We only meant to visit Trastevere on one evening, but we came back for some more Roman atmosphere and food.

Lunchtime pleasure. Great area to stop and people watch whilst having a beer/coffee/whatever you want! We went at lunchtime so it was calm and leisurely. I'm sure once the sun goes down, the restaurants and bars would be heaving. Fun little streets where there's always a place to stop to eat or drink.

Great neighborhood with restaurants that locals love. The front desk folks at our hotel recommended we check out this neighborhood. Really good restaurants, gelato shops and bars inhabited mainly by locals. Highly recommend visitors to check this area out!
Greate village. If you want to have a sense of what is really living in Rome you have to go there it has a beautiful environment and good shoppings and cafes
Great place to wander around. Just walk, look up and look around so much to see and do here. Little alleyways, beautiful old buildings and squares where you can sit and people watch

Definitely go here . This was just a short taxi trip from the city centre (cost us between €8-12, some will try to charge you up to €25 but just try another taxi). It's very picturesque; cobbled streets lined with quaint bars & restaurants. There's also a more busy area of bars which fills up with people at night so it's a good mixture of the two. Went to some lovely places here, definitely worth a visit.

Historic favourite, and now a developing hipster area - slow food, artisanal produce, rustic look. Very pretty in spring and summer! The Campo dei Fiori is a wonderful place to go shopping, wine-tasting, and to have lunch, and the nightlife in Trastevere is also great.
great restaurants. Avoid the tourist traps and hit the small restaurants and enjoy great dining. We had four meals in this area that were all very good.

Very touristy but worth seeing. Trastevere is a very touristic place, in which you hear English than Italian. But of course there is a reason :) It's a magical place with narrow streets, little bar/cafes and surprising monuments. There are many tourist traps but still it's possible to find decent restaurants and authentic shops.

A great neighborhood, amazing selection of restaurants. If you're looking for a historic neighborhood in Rome with top-notch restaurants where locals like to go, Trastevere is the neighborhood for you! The #8 tram streetcar connects the Trastevere train station with the historic center.

Favorite area in Rome. This is my favorite neighborhood in Rome. It has it all - piazzas, fountains, bars, restaurants, churches, beautiful side streets and riverside views. Highly recommend an afternoon and evening here!

Trastevere. My friend and her family actually stayed in Trastevere ( I think it was a VBRO), in any case we only spent an afternoon here. I would definitely recommend going here and spending some time ! The church is lovely and when we came out there was a fabulous group ( local small band) that set up and played near the fountain! Really great music ( I bought their CD). Go to the local restaurants ( there are many to choose from ) and definitely wander the streets! Great neighborhood!

Great Area for Foodies. We stayed right in the heart of Trestevere on Piazza del Mercanti. Within a minutes walk there are tons of shops, markets and most importantly, top notch Italian restaurants with great authentic food. We didn't have any issues speaking English at the restaurants.This area is also a short distance from the colosseum, circus Maximus, and Vatican City.Strongly recommended for travelers.

Charming!. We stayed in this lovely part of Rome and were so glad we did. Charming cobble stone streets, great restaurants and lively night life. And a very easy walk to all the historic sites in Rome.

Heart and Soul of Rome. Every local I spoke to said this was the place to go in Rome. We spent half a day wandering the streets and alleys. Bits of ancient Rome were literally imbedded in the medieval facades of the buildings. It was like a treasure hunt finding a frieze of the she-wolf with Romulus and Remus, or a random column exposed in another wall, or a profile of some long-forgotten Roman in another.

The best place for bars and restaurants. No end of great bars and restaurants, really lovely to walk around. Actually never seemed to get too busy or noisy. Go and have a stroll around and see what you find.
Best food selection in concentrated area. We enjoyed wandering the streets and people watching and eating at several different establishments in Trastevere. One of our favorite evening activities.

Beautiful area . Great little spot for the foodies out there! We popped down to check out the old small streets and picked up a few treats on the way around! Just wish we had time to come back in the evening for a nice meal at one of the many greats restaurants!
A lovely area. Walked into this area whilst doing a walk along the Tiber We particullarly liked the little narrow streets with the cafe's. there was also a bit more greenery here.

Lovely, quiet side of Rome where the real folks live.. Nice neighborhood area. Some lovely churches to wander through. BE FORWARNED restaurants will be closed after you take that great Vatican tour and start your walk back into central Rome. Taxis will be hard to find. We are well travelled and walked until we nearly dropped and starved. Sorry Rick Steves!

Lovely area of Rome . Spent hours walking and looking around this area. Think it's my fav as so interesting and lots of little shops and bars. We ate in one of the Piazza and even in Feb with a garden heater on we enjoyed sitting outside.

You can get lost so easily - great place to explore.. We stayed at a hotel in Trastevere for a week, and the restaurants around us served the most amazing food. The narrow streets and wide piazzas are beautiful, and there is nowhere else quite like it in Rome.

A Charming Part of Rome With Lots of Restaurants. This is the area you want to go to for an afternoon and evening stroll. There are a lot of restaurants, some little local shops and it is a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours in the city.

Real Rome. One of the best quarters of Rome where you will still find genuine restaurants where locals go. At the weekend is buzzing with tourists but you will still be able to have a Roman taste of Italy

Charming. Outstanding, breathtaking, lovely neighborhood full of narrow streets,great buskers and a wide variety of restaurants...it might be considered the most charming area in Rome so as to have some drinks, have dinner or simply have a walk through its street.

A Nice, Off the Beaten Track Section of Rome.. We spent a day or so exploring Trastevere, partly on a food tasting tour and subsequently under our own steam. It's a lot more relaxed than the main sections of Rome and offers the opportunity to amble in the old neighbourhood ot the Etruscan forbears of the Roman empire. There is enough to see to while away several hours and to enjoy a relaxed coffee of meal in the decent range of restaurants of all shapes and sizes.

Great for walking...drinking...eating and enjoying Rome. What a place! Great little Italian streets with musicians and little caffes and gelarte... bars... everything you could want! You just have to wish for a sunny day.....

If you are visiting Rome, go here!. Just a change of atmosphere and vibe from central Rome - the food is great and there seemed to be better nightlife here. really lovely cobbled streets to wander around and restaurants & bars to eat and drink in.

lively, beautiful neighborhood. I'll need to explore it more but I had a great time watching the Real Madrid vs Roma soccer game in a bar that had plenty of locals... Though touristy at the time, I still felt like I was getting a taste of real Rome.
Get the real taste of Rome. The best place in Rome to get the chance to eat the real Italian dishes, it is cheaper, tastier and delicious. You must visit Trastevere for a lunch or dinner.
Beautiful area. Beautiful area with lots of narrow streets and a more authentic atmosphere. We did not have too much time to wander around but it was enough for us to want to come back.

Nice but a bit overrated. We found this a pleasant place to stroll and a cheap area for food and drink but I think the "off the beaten track" is a little overdone as it's just as touristy as the rest of the city.

Authentic neighborhood worth exploring. Though Trastevere is loosing a bit of its local neighborhood feeling, it is well worth taking the time to explore. Many local authentic dining spots as well. I recommend walking across the bridges connecting Trastevere with Isola Tiberina for interesting views of the Tiber River on your way to and/or from Trastevere.

Another side of Rome. This is a favourite location for us in Rome and a great place to visit or stay. When you have had enough sightseeing and the hussle and bussle of the city you can walk across the bridge to this delightful historic area and wander the narrow streets to see another side of Rome. There are a huge number of bars and restaurants and you can just relax and people watch or enjoy a great meal.

A picturesque neighborhood!. If you want to visit a place pircturesque yet really lively, do not miss Trastevere neighborhood. It 's not that hard to reach, and you will really enjoy walking around or sitting at a nice trattoria for cheese and pepper spaghetti!
Fell the real Italian Mood. Must See Italian Neighborhood.Enjoy your stay there while drinking a cappuccino and observing the italian people walking by =)
historical part of Rome. a must visit part of Rome, this is one of the older more affordable areas especially in the evening for dinner at one of the many restaurants.
Charming old town with many good restaurants. We ate at La Scala restaurant which is highly recommended. The food was lovely amd the service attentive but we weren't rushed.
