Great place to visit . If you are in Rome take a stroll across the river to trastevere, this area has loads of restaurants and bars and is very lively. We ate at Gino51 and the food was excellent. All very reasonable priced makes a pleasant change from the Rome restaurants .

Very good at night. Young people, lots of music, and good spirit! we had dinner there, and a couple of drinks at different bars and loved the atmosphere in that neighborhood (at night). Also visited the Church of St Maria in Trastevere, it has beautiful ceilings

Wonderful old part of Rome. Friendly people good food excellent location. If you are having just a weekend or a week in Rome this is a good location to choose. Close to the services to get around or by walking. Late night eating is always possible here, so after a heavy day doing the tourist part stop find a Trattoria to rest up & have a good meal to finish the day off. THere is no shortage of shops as well around, duck into some of the smaller alleys to find hidden little shops & architecture.

Worth the stroll across the river. Worth the stroll across the river for an hour or so wandering around. Some interesting shops and bars, but do make sure that you find a nice ice cream bar and take in the surroundings.
Delicious Food. This town has great food with friendly locals. They have open markets/booths where they sell handmade one of a kind items. Go at night...its beautiful!

10 days in Rome. We are in Rome for business/ pleasure and needed a central location. This is the perfect area.Trastevere is like a small Italian town. Lots of shops and restaurants, cobble stone streets, and an easy walk to a lot of the major attractions. Parking can be an issue if your renting. I would stay here again.
Awesome atmosphere. Trastevere never sleeps. You can get there awsome lunch/dinner for accetable prices and enjoy there afternoon chill in cafes or party hard in crowded streets in the night!

Great place to explore. If you've exhausted all the sites and want to explore and wonder where the locals live, head to Trastevere. Lots of restaurants, arts and crafts, windy roads, great atmosphere and architecture too.

beautiful. walking through the streets of trastevere is really a must if you ever visit rome. the narrow streets and the 1800s buildings are beautiful.there r lots of restaurants and its nightlife is very vibrant

Great neighbourhood to explore!!!. I walked here from Termini-it is a bit of a walk but totally doable, and you can stop at other attractions along the way! Beautiful neighbourhood to explore. Locals, travelers, restaurants, cafe's, bright coloured apartments. Just loved walking, getting a little lost and people watching here!

The best base in Rome . Rome has so much to offer ; culture , history , art, great bars and restaurants and some outstanding hotels. But where to stay?Our preference is Trastevere , an authentic quarter with its cobbled streets, individualistic boutiques and a fabulous choice of dining.It is an easy walk to the city highlights ,like St Peters, the Vatican, the Forum, the Colosseum Piazza Navona and the Trevi Fountain but a world away from the touristic hustle and bustle .We have found a delightful boutique hotel - Le Clarisse - with just 18 rooms and that typifies this locale. It is more personal , accessible and rewarding than being amongst the bright lights of the city - and as a popular area with Romans is much better value than the central tourist zones.If you want the real Rome then discover Trastevere.

Beautiful. We just strolled through the streets without anything special in mind. There are lots of lovely shops and you find everything from hand-painted converse shoes to upmarket antiques. Not to forget all these lovely cafes and bakeries. We took lots of typical Italian photographs and enjoyed the lovely sunshine.

Pretty good.... We took a walk over the bridge and into the neighbourhood of Trastevere. It was good for photos as there were some nice backstreets and alleys but it wasn't anything special...There was some small, quaint shops and some nice looking restaurants but overall, nothing out of the ordinary...maybe it's better in the summer...

Our favourite area for restaurants. A fun buzzing area with quaint cobbled lanes and artisan feel. Easy to get to on tram direct from Piazza Venezia. Lots of young people but us oldies also made to feel welcome. We liked Baylon bar for cocktails and Ristorante Popi popi for pizzas.

BEAUTIFUL OLD ROME. We've been back to this part of Rome several times, and love it each time. It is a wonderful place to walk in the evenings, and have dinner or drinks. There's lots of activity, and many good restaurants in the area. The streets are a true picture of old Rome, and what most of us picture when we think of Rome.

Old Roman Village. Love this area with it's great restaurants, deli's, wine bars and bakerys. Visit here for the true Roman experience. Always something new to discover. Lots of locals and students here at night so there's a fabulous atmosphere. In summer there's lots of market sellers and usually street entertainers in the square. A great way to see the area is doing a wine and food tour in the day or night.
Special and different, worth a walking tour. We discovered for the first time this special quarter in Rome. Small streets, fool of Tabernas and Pubs. Worth for a short visit, by day and by night.
My favourite spot. Trastevere is just an amazing part of Rome! Very accessible via either tram or bus. Amazing restaurants and bars. It has an amazing Italian feel to it.

A must visit area visiting Rome. We went for a long walk after lunch and we really had a good sightseeing getting there. So much to experience in a few hours but we enjoyed the scene, the people, gelato, arts and crafts, souvenirs, music and walked through all these streets that are very cozy. And of course we had to end by eating at one of the many restaurants with good wine and service. ....we left with good memories and hope to go back again soon!!
Nice walk. This is a neighbourhood for the locals, so my suggestion is to go there for a quiet walk along the river and for lunch or dinner in one of the many restaurants there.
quiet visit with your parter. A very quiet and nice area across the river Tevere, and please don't miss giving a look to the Ponte Sisto (Sisto Bridge) where the latest James Bond movie was shot :)

AMAZING little part of the Motherland!. It is the place I think of when I think of my trip. I loved the cobblestone streets. I loved the mom and pop places to eat. I enjoyed scattering threw arrears with locals. I enjoyed capturing the days events with my camera. I loved KMZero...great cheap eats. I look forward to my next vacation and spending a week in this burb!

What a find. This was our second visit to Rome and Our first staying in Trastevere. What an amazing place. Quite easy to get lost in all the little streets and piazzas but then this when you find off the beaten track bars and restaurants... Going back in May woudnt stay anywhere else now. Trastevere every time.

Great area. We made the mistake of getting off the bus just over the Tiber, wondering what on earth all the fuss was about for this part of town. It certainly didn't look like it was going to be worth the bother.A short walk brought us into the sights sounds and smells of trastevere proper though and everything changed. It was by far the best area in Rome and the bars, restaurants and general vibe were excellent. Make sure you come here, it's not to be missed-just be certain to get off the bus in the heart of trastevere rather than at the very edge.

Charming!. Trastevere is one of my personal favorite parts of Rome. If you are looking to get away from some of the more busy parts of Rome, it is the perfect place to stroll around in the evening, perhaps grab a bite to eat in a local cafe, and enjoy street musicians and performers in their prime. Yes, the neighborhood can be at times a bit sketchy, but as long as you are around of your surroundings, it is perfectly fine. If you are looking for some place to hang out with friends or somewhere to take that special someone, here would be the place!

Pleasant, quiet local area. Heading over the old bridge over the Tiber, you enter into almost a different world. Quiet streets, with many small shops and bars, apparently peopled by locals rather than hordes of tourists. Magnificent church, sorry can't remember the name, straight up the Main Street, in a pleasant piazza.Well worth the walk over the river but please don't tell everyone!

Charming bohemian neighbourhood. This is a lovely area, full of restaurants, bars and narrow streets that are just so charming! Yes, it is a bit touristic, but try to explore a bit, and you may find some great places that locals also go to for good food!

Loved Trastevere. We stayed in an apartment here lots of little restaurants and shops close by. Lots of history in the area you can wander the cobblestone streets for hours and come across markets, old churches lots of lovely Piazza's, close to the river and the Vatican it's well worth a visit or the stay in the area. We loved it

A great area for food and bars at night and in the day. Eat in this area most evenings and enjoyed coffee here also the streets are magical and you soon stroll in to different parts all equally pretty

Fantastic Time. A group of us met up in Rome for a few days and what a great time. We stayed in the City of Trastevere. This city is full of history and some great attractions.
We stayed at the Hip hotel which centrally located and very clean. The people here are friendly and lots of great sights to see.

Fun neighborhood, good people-watching and food. This part of Rome is crowded but the crowds have a different feel. Definitely more local people and people on a range of budgets. The church is lovely to see.

Lively and lovely part of Rome!. We stayed in Trastevere and were so glad we did! We had so many wonderful restaurants available right at our doorstep & loved the feel of the lively neighbourhood. It comes alive at night!It was within walking distance of most major attractions without feeling like a 'touristy' area. Highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Rome, or to at least make sure you visit in the evening if you're staying elsewhere!
Lovely little district.. Lots of hidden treasures awaiting around the corner. Loads of little churches and piazzas to explore

A nice area to wonder around. Like almost everywhere in Italy, I think the food in Trastevere is great. Any number of local places can be enjoyed and the tight streets and little shops can be enjoyed. Nothing spectacular but simply good fun.
Cute. Good cute shops. For a feel of old Rome this is good spot to come look at, markets and shops are ideal of souvenirs.
A good spot to be. We rented a home for a couple of days on Trastevere Street. It's just a couple of minutes from the grocery store, several restaurants, bus, and train.
Beautiful Neighborhood. Tons of option for coffee, lunch, dinner, wine, beer, shops, galleries local business, churches, beautiful people, etc. it's just charming.
The live zone of Rome - ambiente and restaurants. Very busy zone, a light atmosphere with numerous restaurants with local specialities in a good suurounding
Amazing!. Trastevere was a short walk from our Hotel in Rome..a nice, colourful and buzzing area! We even went there in the night..a nice place to chill, eat and get a few drinks!

One or the most colorful neighborhood in Rome, for walk, see and EAT !. One or the most colorful neighborhood in Rome, for walk, see and EAT ! Just Magig and wonderful, amazing streets, shops and restaurant and coffees !

Fantastic area. It was a very pleasant short trip from piazza venecia to trastevere with tram number 8 .The area is very near to Tiveris river .Very beautiful atmosphere reminding us some of Plaka area nice small narrow streets and a nice church .Finally we have a suggestion for lunch _Mario's _restaurant with local food extremely tasty and very cheap!! Really a surprise for us

Lunch in trastevere. Daughter who went to college in Rome told us we " must visit trastevere" glad we did! Lunch was much cheaper than the hotel we stayed at - near piazza del popolo. Very nice town, fewer tourists and much better prices!!!!
A trend setter. Great place for a long walk. Great trendy restaurants and fantastic traditional places to eat. Try the Proscutteria. Small cozy place with fantastic antipasto.

must get here - this is the "students quarter" sort of place. wow ... this is great if you want alively evening that is not so expensive. Great atmosphere, lots of street entertainers and restaurants - all at reasonable prices. go
Enjoyable at nights. Great options, restaurants and bars. every sunday there is a market and could be a great experience.
Wonderful neighborhood. Lovely neighborhood to take a walking tour. We took a food tour and really explored the area. There is so much to see and enjoy.

a bit of 'home' in the heart of Rome. I don't remember the exact number of times I took a walk around Trastevere, but I recall that I took at least one for each time of the day. This neighbourhood is truly breathtaking, considering its diversity, liveliness and sheer normalcy, something that may seem hard to find when you're in a foreign country/city. I enjoyed walking around and exploring it very much. If you have the time and the inclination, don't pass it on your way to/from the standard city centre sights. There are a ton of cafes, restaurants, pubs and shops you can visit.

real traditional italian neighborhood. if you visit the colosseum or Roman forum and you like to walk , just continue going towards one of the small bridges that crosses over the Tiber river and you are in Trastevere, great to walk around with all these small streets full scooters , small fiat cars and klocals, you can see St Maria church and many stores, flower shops, many many trattorias with authentic Italian foot ( not the turist kind of foot ) , walk around, get lost , people are friendly

walking tour in Trastevere. You cannot visit Rome , even if just for one day, without dinning and walking in Trastevere .It has a special feeling and at same time many tourists traps which need avoiding .Walk on your own , if you get lost people will be friendly and helpful and there is no need for a guide which will try to take you to " his family " places . Try to see where you see locals eating and not tourists groups at long tables . Enjoy !
Beautiful. I love this part of rome. So quiet and quaint. The streets are what you would expect of old time Rome, apart from all the Vespas parked along the wall.
Real Italian atmosphere!. Highly recommended to visit this area in Rome - it was very cozy and less crowded. The area is full of bars and restaurants. You would not regret!

A must see in Rome. Trastevere is home for quaint restaurants and artistic street scenes that are a must for travelers who love to explore behind the scene venues in Rome. I even found a yoga studio which is accessible by bus. This is a time to relax, sip an expresso and absorb the ancient magical quality of Rome.

Lovely Area of Rome. On our way to Santa Maria church in Trastevere, we explored this part of town over the course of a day. Beautiful, old buildings in a safe part of town, I recommend that you get off the beaten track and explore this hidden gem in Rome. This ranks as one of my favorite areas in the city

it was my favourite part of rome.. when the popes modernised the city in the 16th century the part they left was the area across the river tiber in trastevere and it is a lovely, charming part of the town full of graet little trattorias and old fashioned rome. this is were you see old rome away from tourist traps
fantastic neighbourhood worth exploring. Slightly out of the way of central Rome, this neighbourhood is still worth exploring (easily reachable by Tram).

When in Rome it's a must to visit this neighbourhood. This is one of the most enjoyable places to visit in Rome. The small streets and beautiful architecture. The taverns with menus for tourists are super.
Beautiful dostrict. It feels like you're in a painting when you walk around Trastevere. Try and stay there for a few hours without wanting to stay for a few weeks.

Did we miss something?. We were told by more than one Roman to go here to see the "real" Rome. Well, if this is the real Rome we will stick to the fake one, thanks. We didn't go out of our way to go to this area as we were already visiting something nearby and decided to take a look on the way back. Frankly, don't bother. It's horrible. It's run down, rubbish everywhere you look, graffiti on everything, beggars in every street, tourist-led over-expensive restaurants and cheesy bars. It just felt dirty and horrible. We followed our phone's map to the botanical garden but didn't bother paying the very steep price to go in (when we saw how run down that looked too, and checked the reviews here!).In all, stick to the other parts of Rome. This just feels horrible.

Interesting Rome neighborhood. Download the Rick Steves walking tour, get on your headset, and learn all about Trastevere. It's a short tour but interesting to learn about the Jewish neighborhood. Stop by to get the best fried artichokes (you can get it cheaper to go if you don't want to sit at the fancy restaurant) - look for Anthony Bourdain's picture. Then further down the street is a bakery selling an italian fruit bread fresh out of the oven (a denser pannetone), and few steps away is a shop selling groceries and really fresh foccacia by the ounce... yum. Nice little detour from the usual Piazzas and with Rick's commentary - you learn a bit about the area.

Interesting, picturesque. Trastevere, meaning "across the Tiber" is a really special part of Rome. If you like to walk down the narrow streets and discover little miracles behind the corner - a church, piazza, green market, street vendors, tiny restaurants with excellent food and peculiar basements, or a memorial plaque dedicated to director Sergio Leone, who used to live in the neighborhood, then you are on the right place. You can easily and deliberately get lost in Trastevere... All it takes is to cross some of the beautiful bridges across the Tiber, Ponte Garibaldi for example...(after visiting Largo di Torre Argentina or Piazza Venezia)

A bit disappointing . The area is being blown up to something very special by a lot of articles etc. In my opinion it's not that amazing compared to other places in Rome. It has great restaurants and some highlights but that's it. So we were a bit disappointed. We don't need to get back here agsin. Other places in the city deserves our time more than here.

Not much. There are only a few streets to walk that's it, you can go to have a meal over there is not expensive. It's cheaper than the other side of the river. There's nothing to visit over there though. But if you want to go partying you it's perfect;)

a special place where you need to visit Rome. Trastevere is the only place in Rome that survived the medieval period and which still preserves a strong local identity . It is the most authentic neighborhood in Rome in my opinion. This neighborhood has a lot to offer, from comfortable accommodations , charming restaurants , cultural attractions , shops of all kinds and intense nightlife .If you want to visit the sights are scattered sure and you need a good map if you do not want to miss out through labyrinthine streets .I saw houses typical of italinilor , some covered with grape vines and flowers, a lot of restaurants and taverns , bars and pubs
Great place for a stroll and a meal. Has a different vibe from the rest of Rome. Very relaxed and fun, great food and gelato, streets reminiscent of Venice.

love it. Trastevere is a medieval area in Rome that is separated from the central city by the river Tiber. Despite of its narrow lanes, many tourists are attracted by its charm visiting the area. It is the only place in Rome that survived the medieval period. While maintaining a strong local identity.Trastevere has lots to offer from accommodations, tourist attractions, entertainment, shopping and sports. Getting into the Trastevere is possible through trains, tram and busI love to lost myself in the streets..shops cafes and my rental place.. I feel lucky..

Loveliest district in Rome!. The best place to live and to eat in Rome, a lot of bars and pizza places - you can choose what to do every night! What is more, it's cheaper than the other part of the old city. It's lovely even in winter. I totally recommend you visiting Trastevere.
What a wonderful little neighborhood!. We stayed in Trastevere over the summer and fell in love! We loved wandering the streets and finding new places to eat. We had an incredible time!

Go to Trastevere!!!. Best Day by far. After Colosseo Palatino and Foro Romano take a walk around circo massimo Santa Maria Cosmedin and Piazza la Bocca della Verita and then straight to the small island isola via ponte Cestio and across the Street towards Trastevere
Such a beautiful and interesting area!. Loved walking around this area of Rome, so beautiful and interesting, filled with little shops and restaurants that were very quaint.

Worth A Visit. We visited Trastevere whilst in Rome, although there are lovely places to eat and shop it wasn't the highlight of our tour, worth a visit though if you have a couple of hours to spare.
Make sure you also visit Santa Maria in Trastevere

Great Area to Walk Around, Eat, Shop. This is a nice area of Rome with many nice places to eat. We strolled here a couple of times because it was so pleasant, and ate here once as well. Lot of fun shops too.

Great spot for 20-somethings on weekend nights!. Although we were staying by Piazza Navona, one Saturday night we went over to Trastevere for a drink. We walked over Ponte Sisto and we could not believe how many people our age (20-somethings) were hanging out in Piazza Trilussa... they were everywhere! As we wandered, some of the streets outside the bars were so packed with people that we had to push our way through. Although we did run into some other Americans, it seems to be a mostly local flavor on weekends. I'd strongly recommend it!
Best place for getting food. This are has amazing restaurants and pizzerias, will not be dissappointed if jump into any restaurant.

Stay here. This is a great area, a little out but easy to access the city centre and the vatican. The prices reflect it being out of the city centre, it is great value, the food is delicious and the wine is flowing. Very relaxed restaurants and great service, Could not be more charming if it tried

Colorful City Village!. This popular neighborhood on the west bank of Rome used to be a multicultural working- class area of mostly Jewish, Roman and Greek descent. They were known for speaking their own dialects. It's also famous for its narrow and winding cobble stoned streets lined with old houses. These unique characteristics attracted artists, expats and many prominent people in the 60's and 70's. Sergio Leone, of Spaghetti Western fame, grew up in this area and went to a Catholic private school here. Tastevere is also home to a few foreign academic institutions like the American University of Rome and John Cabot University.The whole area around the Santa Maria Basilica and St. Cecilia church has become a vibrant going out area because of its many pizzeria's, trattorie and bars.Other important places of interest incl. St. Francesco a Ripa, Villa Farnesina and the Villa Lante & Gardens past the Piazza Garibaldi with its scenic views.

interesting fun area to experience. we enjoyed this fun area of the city and it has quirky shops and fun photography opportunties. yes its is a tourist area but the old building and the tasty food makes this area interesting to visit.
Nice neighborhood. Little shops and typical italian restaurants. Here you can spend your time in the evening with people all ages.

Its ok. I had read tons about Trastevere, so we decided to spend a mornign there. Yes, it´s nice. Yes, there are nice food niches. But... no biggie. It´s a hip neighbohood with graffitti all over, and some overprized bars and restaurants. Lliked the churches, and if you have the time, go, but it is not a must...

Late night delight. Our tour guide, Annette, took us here as part of our Jewish Ghetto tour. Lots of history and hidden jewels here, as well as interesting shops and restaurants where the locals hang out. Doesn't start hopping until 8pm. We went back again and again.
Lively!. This promenade along the river is the main hub for restaurants and pubs. The place is really alive at night and the revelry goes on till late.

Wonderful Place to Visit and Live. Trastevere is a beautiful and surprisingly quiet area of Rome. While it has wonderful nightlife and a flood of friendly people, it is also brimming with history and idilic, classical Rome. I have the opportunity to live here at the moment and can safely say it is the best area to live in in Rome. With a 20 mins walk in all directions you can reach the Vatican, Colosseum and the Pantheon, Trastevere is the heart of Rome.
Nice place!!. You should visit this place for food and drinks !! very good prices and excellent food!! Lots of cafes and bars and shops with good prices as well...

Let's go for a walk. I came upon this area while walking without a specific destination and I am glad I did. I went by three more time because I felt a connection to the narrow streets, as if I were a part of a movie set. Instead, I was in what is real and I enjoyed it so much. A must while in Rome.

Go in the evening. Great place to visit and go for dinner. Two pieces of advice. Download the app from RIck Stevens to hear a guided visit of the trastevere and have dinner at a restaurant called l Ducca. Awesome food!

Great place to get lost!. As I've told before on my reviews... Just get lost there! Rome Is an amazing place to get lost and find hidden treasures. Trastevere Is a great place to stay, near all the main attractions and a beautiful place as well.

Enjoyed this side of the river. We wandered over to this side of the river on numerous occasions during our 10 days in Rome. For me, it had a different feel to it. I would explain it in my words as more Roman. Lots of locals eating, drinking and socialising. Maybe being the holiday season made it more lively? We visited at night too when the streets really came alive with little bars open that you dont notice during the day light hours.

Great part of town to walk narrow streets. This area of town should be on your list of places in Rome...the city has so many districts, that it can't all be taken in during one visit, so make sure to see it.

Local neighborhood that has lots of shops and restaurants and churches. This is a fun area to visit while in Rome. It is feels local an you will find many shops to visit and restaurants too. Go see Basilica Santa Maria while in Trastevere!
Pizza and Capuccino. I loved this neighborhood. You can walk there with little to no Italian. Get some food, drink and enjoy walks along the historical buildings and alley way.

Best area to stay and eat in with easy walking distance to main spots.. We stayed in this area and it was the best decision. Driving up to our place at night it didn't look like e best choice because of preconceived ideas. The area was very safe and we walked pretty much everywhere at all times of the day. We ate almost all our meals in the area and never ran out of great food choices. Of course eating all that great food we needed to walk it off. We discovered a great general market on Sunday morning in Trastevere and that kept us occupied haggling and people watching for a morning. We would stay in this area again. There was a park near the children's hospital that was less than 3/4 of a mile and it gave us a great view of the whole city.

A place to bar hop!. Great place to bar hop like your supposed to without walking miles to find the next place. Loved the piazza where everyone hangs out outside, good vibe there. Easily best area for a night out in the city.

Beautiful Neighbourhood !!. We visit Saint Cecilia Church, it was magnificent. The neighbourhood is an authentic pleasure. Full of trattorias, cafes and gelateria as well as places to shop. Very charm. Easy to walk and near to the Food Market Plaza and plaza Navona.

Stole my heart. My review is from a few years back but I am planning to travel back here again as I had the most amazing time. I absolutely loved this place. It was busy during certain hours and quite and quaint during others. Always something to do here, I had many amazing meals here and enjoyed walking around in and out of little shops. Walks along the Tiber river were by far my favorite. There were many cafes, bars, shisha bars, little markets selling scarves and other different knick knacks etc which made for an amazing setting, an amazing night life during the summer months. An old neighborhood with lots of charm I would highly recommend this place.

Hip Village. A great little village just a quick walk across The Tiber River. Shops, restaurants, street vendors, musicians and artists. A wonderful area that is a must to spend a relaxing evening enjoying a bite to eat, cocktails, music and some shopping. We Loved the area.

Great area to spend an evening. What a lovely area! Full of small, cosy restaurants and "real" shops, nothing to do with franchises. I recommend to have the "aperitivo" in one of the bars that offer it, together with the locals. It is served in the evening and it consists of an alcoholic drink and some delicious snacks served to you at the table. It costs around 8€.
Cool place to visit. we came back here a few times. lots of small stores and nice cafes / restaurants to visit. Just tour the streets.

Don't miss the free audio walking tour podcast of Trastevere neighborhood . I missed this area of Rome the first time I visited, and I wouldn't list it as a necessity for a first or even second trip to Rome, but it's worth seeing at some point.My fiancé and I had tried to rent the audio tour headsets at the Roman Forum the day before and they were out, so we ended up downloading a free podcast walking tour of the Forum by Rick Steves. We saw that he also had a walking tour of the Trastevere area, so we decided to check it out.I'm not sure I would have enjoyed the area so much if I hadn't listed to the audio and had just walked around. Yes, there is infinite charm and so many gorgeous, colorful buildings, but the tour gave some pretty cool information. It took us down back roads that we wouldn't have normally walked through and showed neat historical markers like a restaurant building (one that we would have walked past without a second glance) that had unnoticeable Hebrew markings above the columns and was actually a synagogue 1000 years ago.The podcast refers to Trastevere as a seedier part of Rome, but I didn't notice that it seemed ghetto or scary. Yes, it was a little more run down than other areas, but still full of charm and beautiful in it's own way. It's so full of history that you would miss just walking through, so make sure you google some info, grab a guidebook or tour guide, or download a podcast!
Best food. Beautiful quaint streets with tall colourful houses and amazing restaurants. Best travelled in the afternoon and evening on foot.
Typical quarter. Typical and historical quarter of Rome. However sometimes a bit touristic.You can find there shops and typical restaurants.Particularly suggested for dinner and a night walk.
don't miss it!. Very different from the rest of the historical center of Rome. Small streets with an own flair. And yes you can walk up the hill and have a nice view of the city !

The little neighborhood of trastevere. Nice, picturesque, photo opportunity. Many shops, restaurants, and lots of walking. Had really great fried artichoke, salad, and pizza. Was too stuffed for dessert. You keep walking and you end up at Trevi fountain which is very crowded but you need to walk off all the food.

I heart Trastevere!. If you have ever been to Montmartre in Paris and loved it... then you will LOVE Trastevere in Rome! If you have never been to Montmartre then I will explain. Trastevere is a quaint area on the "other" side of the Tiber with narrow, cobbled streets and a trendy, but local, nightlife. Trastevere is not a touristy area and, as such, you will find great local restaurants (hidden gems) as opposed to tourist trap restaurants that display pictures of their food on a sign by the door. Trastevere can definitely get busy in the evenings, but you won't find street performers and kiosks selling snow globes. Piazza Navona will have all that - as well as pictures of the food :-). Personally, we found Piazza Navona crazy and left pretty immediately to get back to Trastevere.I stayed in Trastevere just last week with my husband and children (ages 8 and 11). We stayed on a quiet street and enjoyed getting lost in the streets and discovering small cafes, restaurants and shops. We are the kind of family who gets up and out early, gets our touring done, and then comes back to our local area around 5pm to chill for a few hours before a late meal. If you enjoy having that kind of downtime at the end of a long day, without all the tourist hubbub, then stay in Trastevere. And, with all the restaurants in the area, we found great places to eat right near our apartment each night. We were able to stay out late with the kids because, whenever they got tired, we only had to stumble a couple of minutes to get home.One thing people asked me when I said we would be staying in Trastevere is, "Don't you want to be closer to everything?" My answer is no. I don't think it's worth it. The closer to "everything" you stay the more touristy it is. Not to mention that nothing is really that far from anything else. I believe the Colosseum was less than 2 miles away from our apartment. It took us 35 minutes to walk there with 2 children.... which is nothing. Isn't part of the fun, walking around and taking it all in? If you don't like to walk then take a 5 minute taxi ride. Whatever suits you, but I'd rather go "out there" during the day to see all the sites but then come back to spend all my other free time in a place like Trastevere.I could go on and on about Trastevere. Highly recommend if you want a taste of real Roman culture. Feel free to ask about restaurant recommendations too - we found some awesome places!

what an amzing night!!. I took my partner to Rome for her 30th birthday and we took the hop on hop off boat trip which goes down to Trastevere where we come across loads of tents all set up across the river front. We decided we would head back down that evening and wow im so glad we did. It was full of themed bars, market stalls restaurant. We had such an amazing time. If your planning a trip I would plan it around this event.

Awesome place to stay. We stayed in Trastevere during our time in Rome. We loved the area! It's full of lively restaurants and bars, we enjoyed walking the streets looking for new places to eat at. It's quite close to the other attractions, we walked everywhere and had no troubles at all. When I come back to Rome I'll definitely stay at Trastevere again!
Lively area of Rome. We stayed in a quaint hotel in Trastevere. This is a lively part of Rome with plenty of bars and Restuarants along the narrow back streets.

best street. he walking tour in Trastevera is the best one in Rome if you really want to appreciate the Roman culture and their way of living. There are so much to see in this area: old restaurants, gift shops, candy and pastry shops, local apartments and buildings, churches, and public squares. We felt safe to walk there, taking pictures,

Hip and Trendy. Nice area with lots of bars and trattorias, worth to spend sometime walking around, mixing with the crowds of tourists and young people.. Avoid touristic menus though, most of them are not worth it..

Great nightlife!. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed walking around Trastevere on a Friday night. There were so many restaurants and bars open offering happy hour specials and it was very calm but busy. Great place to visit.
Best of food, full of sights. This area has everything. Lots of places to eat, full of photo opportunities. and very romantic on a night
Very good food and romantic streets. If you wanna stay away from luxurious shops and breathe a more Daily life and much more friendly environment, please go to Trastevere.

Did we missed something?. It was according to the guide (from 2006) supposed to be cool street with lot of restaurants. We had feeling that we are in average neighborhood street with nothing special to offer.

Best Walking Tour In Rome. The walking tour in Trastevera is the best one in Rome if you really want to appreciate the Roman culture and their way of living. There are so much to see in this area: old restaurants, gift shops, candy and pastry shops, local apartments and buildings, churches, and public squares. We felt safe to walk there, taking pictures, peeking at the window displays of candy shops, having lunch at an old restaurant, listening to a street musician performing, and really feeling and touching the daily life of Romans.
Abundance of restaurants and shops. A great place to grab a drink, some food, or to shop. We walked here from our hotel near the Pantheon at night.
Foodie Heaven. Did a food tour round the area and it was great, we did the tour from 10am-2pm Well worth the money and didn't feel the need to eat until about 10pm.

Best area to eat in Rome. Trastevere is probably the best area if you are looking to eat good local food - 'the real thing'. Best to do your research before you go as the best cheese, ham and pasta places are mere 'hole in the wall' kind of places. Take line H from Termini station which will drop u off at a junction in Trastevere, then walk along the narrow streets. Look for local cheese shops (Antica cIciara), local supermarket selling porchetta (la noralnelia - picture attached), and wine shops (Ristorante Spirita di vino- picture attached, a heritage winery). Awesome overall and cheap!

Beautiful old restaraunt district. Beautifully lit streets full of restaraunts with people milling around and great atmosphere. We went to a tiny restaraunt off the beaten track a little which was fantastic. Recommended place to soend at least one evening in Rome, if not more.
Must go. One of the best places in Rome to go at night, with lot of beautiful people, hapiness and very good restaurants and bars.
Fabulous foodie neighborhood. Winding narrow streets, beautiful church, and great food shops. A wonderful way to spend a day.We explored the area with an Eating Rome tour and loved it.
Gourmet delight. Just wandering around makes you hungry as you experience the flavours of Italy, Every place seems enticing, and a greta area to walk around in.
Fun place to visit. A somewhat different part of Rome, across the river. Climb to the top of the hill and get a fabulous view of the city. Lots of good places to shop and eat.

The best place to stay in Rome. We rented an apartment in Trastevere at the suggestion of a friend who lived in Rome for three years. It was the perfect place to stay. Convenient to lots of key sites in Rome, an active street life, lots of shops and restaurants and some great churches to see.
relaxed and comfortable. A must wander. Take your time. Soak in the buildings, the people, the history. Just walk and walk. Allow yourself to become lost. You won't regret it.
The Ultimate Roman Experience. Just like roman holiday, gelato and shopping, and cafes, and the eternal city wonderfully stacked on top of each other.
Sweet street. Street is full of restaurants which are usually full. If you want to go to a good one, reserve seats. Small street, typically Italian.

Lovely area. Like this very nice area in Rome. Small narrow streets with small Piazzas. Nice shops and restaurants, some of which are not tourist traps! On one of the Piazzas we saw a small choir singing, very nice.

Beautiful neighborhood. This neighborhood is a grate place to walk, eat out or just have a piece of pizza from the pizzaiollo or a coffee. Old buildings, a young crowd and a romantic air makes the place an absolute must visit. Take time and enjoy!

Wonderful region of Rome. Having visited Rome in June of this year I was blown away by the charm and character of Trastevere with its small streets and peaceful it contrast sharply from the busy areas such as St Peter's and the trevi fountain whilst being within a stones throw of the river.

Where the locals eat. The best real Italian Restaurants can be found here in the Trastevere!Lots of shops around here too! At Christmas, around the corner we were surprised by 15 priests and a lady cellist singing Christmas carols!

Nightlife and restaurants. Lots of back streets to explore and discover different bars and restaurants. Many squares and a great atmosphere, the area is so compact it if east to explore on foot in one evening

Shady, walkable streets for shopping and restaurants; also for historical buildings.. Nice area lined with shade trees, walkable and was very quiet in May of 2015. My rental was near Piazza Navona, and one day we walked all the way south to the big market south of Trastevere, then back north through Trastevere to the Jewish Ghetto then to Campo diFiori. The quietest and shakiest area was through Trastevre, where we stopped at many botiques along the way. My knowledge of the area is not in depth, but I can say it's a wonderful walk through Trastevere.

Edgy part of Rome, not to be missed. Many tourists will skip this part of Rome which would be a huge mistake. This is a great spot for bargains in terms of food and gifts. The graffiti may put you off but don't let that fool you, it is really the heart and soul of Rome. Great restaurants and reasonable prices.
Well worth the visit. A well worth while area to visit when staying in Rome. Lots of little streets with great little shops and places to eat. A lovely chilled atmosphere with a shabby chic feel.

Once incredible now just full of tourists. Ten years ago this was the best place to eat and visit in Rome - you could go to a nice restaurant and hear very few English voices but sadly now the tourists have discovered Trastevere and now it's hard to find somewhere to eat that has limited tourists.I still like Popi Popi but struggle to find other spots in the area.The church is incredible but I am sad to say all the restaurant and bar staff outside trying to pull you in has really put me off!Sad times ...
Different Rome. Charming atmosphere of a small European town. Can walk those lovely streets for hours and never get tired! Here you can find some great places to eat.
Lovely place. Lovely place to have dinner and have a walk. The restaurantes have medium prices, nice food. Very romantic place

My favorite neighborhood to wander around .... On the other side of the river from the Center of Rome, it is relief from all the gigantic piazzas and churches. Just stroll around the streets and taste the delicious pizzas and gelato and cappuccino. Very worthwhile first to take the bus up to Gianicolo Hill for great views of the entire city and then walk down to Trastevere. Super LOVELY!

Very nice and authentic street tour. If you are hungry and plan to eat something in this area, be sure to pick 'lunch time' Italian way. I was accompanied by a friend who explained me in the end that there's no way restaurant will serve you food if it's not 'time for a food'. And that was mine initial experience with Trastevere - bunch of open restaurants totally empty. Otherwise, very nice architecture, very nice streets to take easy walk through, and also possible to find couple of 'tourist places' where you can eat something and get a coffee even outside 'normal' Italian time for that.

The best place to stay for a Rome visit. We loved staying in this part of Rome. The feel is truly neighborhood, with great restaurants and bars within walking distance of all the major Rome sights. We walked to St. Peter's, Janiculum Hill, The Forum and other ancient sites like Circus Maximus, plus Ponte SIsto, Campo Fiore neighborhood, and all up and down the Tiber.
Nice Street Tour. With small bars and cafes, this discrict is a nice pleace to have a street tour. No monuments or attractions. Best to spend the time in bars at night

A must by day or by night!. Smile-making, delightful, charming, romantic, mesmerising, sparkly and pretty. And every corner you turn you're stunned anew....and on the first visit you'll likely end up walking around with your mouth open :-)And then there is the wonderful array of bars and restaurants!On your own, or with others, you'll have a fabulous time. Hot tip, wear comfortable shoes good for walking on cobbles (heels will be a problem...wedges are fine, but not if more than tipsy!).

Charm of old Rome. Here I find the streets, the shops, the restaurants and especially church of Santa Maria in Trastevere extremely attractive. Buy your cheese in via San Francesco. This part of Rome has spirit!

Fantastic area to just visit. Piazza Santa Maria was interesting. But we followed Rick Steve's Tour which started at the Hospital on the Island on the Tiber River which was very interesting. It took us to St. Cecelia's Church and through the streets of Trastevere which is just across the river from the Jewish Ghetto (meaning cast out). If you have extra time in a day from another venue that you have seen, such as St. Angelo's Castle, then this is an excellent venue to see as it is just down the river within walking distance to see.
Life in Roma. If you wish to experience street life in Rome, lively streets and entertainers, you should walk on Trastevere. I wish you tome here again and again ...

My Favorite Neighborhood. Don't miss this area. It's cute and quaint and absolutely has some of the best pizza joints around. Its a nice walk from the Vatican along the river. Wish we could have stayed here for a longer period of time.
Enjoy. This part of Rome offers vivid night life, and this is the place where everyone goes when sun goes down. You can find a wide choice of Italian taverns and spend your evening here.

The Best place In Rome. Worth to eat, relax, explore. Best area In town you can have a Lunch for 30-40 Eur for 4 persons with 4-5 dishes. You can walk for hours to explore very old and unicue area. I recomend to stay at Tratevere as well.

Gives you an authentic old-world feel. A great way to spend a few hours experiencing Rome away from the main visitor attractions, it's even better at night! Plenty of top class restaurants and bars. Make sure you visit the Church of Santa Maria in Trastevere while here.

The West Village of Roma. The Trastevere is not to be missed if you have enough time in Rome to branch out from the historical landmarks and tourist must-stops. The Trastevere is bohemian and a place where real Romans live their lives. It is urban and artsy and not flashy. Some of the best and most interesting restaurants in Rome are here - as are the best apartments for short-term rentals.

Like monmarte in paris!. Great place for night or for a relaxing walk in sunday. Although it is touristic the neighbourhood manage to keep the authentic italian style. Thats why you can see many Romans among the tourists. It is like monmarte in Paris or Ortaquoi in Instanbul. Dont miss it!

One of the "Find it" areas for toursts. Fantastic night time area of Rome situated across the river. Streets full of shops, bars and restaurants.
A cinema with an open roof during the summer months with films shown in English. Always loved going to this area as it was so vibrant and full of life.

Evening visit. We went to this area on our last night (which was a Sunday) and the taxi driver dropped us off and gave us the general direction to go in, we actually just followed the crowd lolWas really nice, busy, vibrant, and the restaurants was much bigger here than in the center of Rome, we literally followed the crowds through and then just picked a restaurant that appealed to us the most and we wasn't disappointed (turned out the restaurant was actually originally a church!) and to be honest with the sheer choice that's what I'd suggest for everyone to do.We made our way back to the area that the taxi dropped us off and on the opposite side of the road there was a taxi rank which was perfect :)
Great neighborhood!. Great for people watching, numerous place to eat and drink and more churches than you can count. Talk a stroll and get lost in the many piazzas of Trastevere.

Old, serene place. It's a fun place to be around. You get to see and feel authentic Rome culture around. Food (that's there though throughout Rome) is something u will see at every corner. We incidentally visited this place on Sunday, so we enjoyed the flee market (available only on a Sunday till 3pm). You can get stuff from 50 cents to euro 50! It was fun. Quality of the stuff is good!

Don't Miss A Saturday Night Out In Trastevere. We were in Rome in August and staying at the Spanish Steps. It was Saturday night. You know the saying "when in Rome, do as the Romans do." We decided to explore the night in Rome. You feel safe walking the cobblestoned streets of Rome. It was August and the streets were full of people. I thought it would be deserted because Italians vacation and go to the beach in August. I guess these are tourists like us! And as we kept walking, we were in Trastevere. It looked familiar because we stayed here in one of our trips and enjoyed the area. I remember a local recommended Sor' Eva restaurant and after that, it was our favorite place to eat even if we no longer stayed there the years after we visited. While walking, we heard some live music from a band. We moved in the direction of the sound and we came across the bridge and the music became louder. When we looked down, we saw that there was a nightlife down there and there were lots of people going down and going up. We both screamed in glee 'Yey! We gotta see this." And down we went under the bridge. Wanna feel like a local and do what locals do. Come here! It will be the best Saturday night out you can have during your stay. Enjoy the river, the music, the drinks, the people you meet, the nice server. Take it all in and when you're no longer there and back in your own city, remember the memories that you have filed in your heart. And then you will want to come back again...and again...and again.
Local Neighborhood.. Great restaurants, lively nightlife. Safe and compact. We ate in this neighborhood several times and were not disappointed.

Worths to visit for whole day. It took all our day to visit day. Narrow streets, very nice cafes, boutique stores make you feel at the past. The restaurants are very nice and not very expensive. I higly recomend this region if you visit Roma.
Not impressed. We were sitting on bus so we did not see the small gates but we have expected a more charming part of Rome. Perhaps we missed that.
It's a labyrinth.... The place is akin to a labyrinth... You'd better know where you are and where you're heading... Finding a taxi in late hours is near impossible.
Charming neighbourhood. This is a charming neighbourhood, especially at night with many restaurants, bakeries, pizza houses and other food options. Nice to visit at night.

OK. Used Trip Advisor to seek out restaurants in area and was disappointed in our choices. Recommend you walk around and find one that strikes your fancy vs relying on other's comments on restaurants.

Must do when in Rome!. Very romantic place, where walking around is without doubt the way to get acquainted on this lovely neiborhood. Is a great area to find a lovely restaurant, to enjoy the most tasty plates helped in the world. I strongly recommend to visit Trastevere!
Interesting neighbourhood. We visited this area because of its winding streets, varied small shops and many restaurants. Just across the river.

fabulous area to stay in. we enjoyed this area so much when we were in rome.stayed at a small b&b on via natal del grande, 51.we were there for 5 days and traveled all over rome fromthere.walked to the vatican.....which was probably 30-40 min.a nice walk.may great restaurants to choose from.so much to see in this area.even though there were a lot of peopleit never felt overcrowded.would return there in a minute.

Love! Charming Area of Rome. Also known as the Jewish Ghetto during WWII, this area of Rome is a must see. Small winding streets loading with lots of inexpensive jewelry stores, shops, cafes and bars. This is one of my favorite areas of Rome. Lots of vendors on the streets. Found a fantastic Prosciutto and wine bar! Visited the area the last 3 times I was in Rome. Brought my children and husband this time and they also loved the afternoon we spent there. Less hectic than old historic Rome area because it is foot traffic only.

Great place to eat. Thank to the suggestion of our guide we went to Trastevere. It is an amazing ancient district with many little alleys , there are many typical local restaurants and local traditions . We loved it

Trastevere is the best neighborhood in Rome!. This is where I keep coming back to every time I visit Rome. You can roam for hours and will never tire of Trastevere. Amazing restaurants abound with more funky and local spots that are less geared to tourists. A lot of students live in this neighborhood so it has a young, hip vibe. Wander in and out of churches, museums and sweet small businesses. Great way to spend a day.

Great food half the price from Romeos central restaurants. By walking or getting metro or bus or tram to this area of the city you will save a fortune on great restaurants. You will get to eat in charming local restaurants and bars with fantastic local produce cooked fresh. There are plenty of little alleys brimming with bars, restaurants and shops to make it worth your while to visit more than once. Great area to find

Take the time to walk Trastevere. Colorful neighborhood, winding paths around homes, this is where there are limited if any tourists. Great piazzas and vistas here. We walked all the way through and ended up at Vatican City. That took about an hour and a half.
Go around. Go around with no destine. Does not matter. The place is a walk in a cenerium that will probably will like. A bunch of places to eat.
Lovely area. We stayed in Trastevere and it was lovely. Loads of small cobbled streets with many great restaurants. No hassling which is great!

Is This still Rome. The charm of this area is not to be missed. We wandered around here for quite some time, it was in the morning but I could imagine that evenings would be vibrant with all the restaurants around. Take a walk down the side streets, and soak up the atmosphere, it is very different to the central part of Rome. We walked over and it wasn't that far, we visited the Church of St Maria Sopra Minerva to look at the Michael Angelo sculpture while we were there. If you have time you must go

Real Rome with esprit. Trastevere is a must when you are in Rome for more than one day. Less big attractions, less Antique and Baroque art can be found here but real esprit is on narrow streets between Botanical Garden and San Francesco a Ripa. You can find fine places to eat, nice shops, secondhand bookshops for the local people. You can choose Santa Maria in Trastevere for a mass or just for a visit. Don’t skip this real church with mosaics and interior of old basilica. It is better place than some bigger churches.

A wonderful collection of specific Roman old houses, buildings, streets. Just getting lost in Trastevere is a feat. I took advantage of a visit to Villa Farnesina in the neighborhood and got lost for few hours strolling and admiring the neighborhood. Old buildings, roman streets, wonderful cuisine, churches not to be missed, piazzas chock full of character. I highly recommend spending few hours in this under-appreciated Roman district.

Congested Suburb across the Tiber with a Big Secret. Lots of Tourist restaurants, some nice churches, too much traffic, and very hilly suburb with high-rise canyons as far as one can see. Here's a big secret discovery for tourists - Villa Doria Pamphili park in Trastevere. 445 acres of walking trails, a splendid villa and garden, beautiful views and fresh air in the midst of Rome. If you can find it, you will never forget it.

Real Rome. Great to get away from the busier streets of Rome. Quiet and relaxing, feeling more like an authentic residential area, with narrow streets opening up into Squares. Easy to get to andwalk around. A great day to unwind a little from the main sites, and take in a lunch at a local cafe.

Excekkent and Authentic.... Did a food tour in this entire neighborhood. It's still very italian..not many english speakers. People are nice and the food is awesome. Go have a walk through their little hood.
nice atmosphere. Looks like a small town inside Rome. Nice restaurants everywhere. Easy to access with metro A (stazione circo massimo)

This is Rome. A true sense of Rome in this neighborhood. Bars, cafes, shops, boutiques, people--all in this historic neighborhood. Some sites and old churches, too, that are worth seeing. The vendors on the bridge at night make the bridge to Trastevere crowded, but don't be put off by that. Cross the bridge and walk through the neighborhood. Spending a day there won't disappoint either.

Beautiful Quarter of Rome. Food, music, wine, beer, chocolate shots, shops and stalls. If you're looking for something in the city, you're pretty much guaranteed to find it here. It is a massive tourist attraction so expect to hear more foreign accents than Italian, but the food and drink options are fantastic. Check out Da Augusto for dinner, but get there early as you can't book and people are queuing outside the door from 20 minutes to opening time. If you can't get a seat, why not try Carlo Menta just around the corner! €13 for the 'tourist menu' and the food is better than you find is some of the more pricey 'authentic' Italian restaurants in the city. La Prosciutteria for an unbeatable lunch of cured meats and cheeses and there's Freni e Frizioni near Piazza Trilussa for cocktails by the Tevere!
Great area. Not always the most popular area you hear about when reading or discussing Rome, but it is riddled with nice boutique cafes and restaurants and is the perfect place for late arvo food.

Cajo and Gajo. Perfect neighborhood restaurant that also has a perfect server..Jazmin ! A fun,happy,packed restaurant that had far more customers than other places... Always a good sign and usually an unspoken recommendation.... All became obvious during our meal.Fabulous calamari... Wonderful thin crust pizza and everyone's meals looked top notch as they were delivered....and did I mention ..they also have Jazmin !..... Every server was friendly and all seemed genuinely concerned that all was well and that their customers were happy.... When we finally reluctantly left we felt like old friends parting.My wife and I are not easily impressed..after a lifetime of constant world travel we have eaten in hundreds (probably thousands) of restaurants...Cajo and Gajo will remain memorable..... Did I mention Jazmin ?
Walk by night. Great neighbourhood for a night stroll and especially for a night out since the area has a lot of bars that get full over the weekend.

Best setting to explore rome. Trastevere is a beautiful neighbourhood with cobbled streets, Packed with local restaurants trattorias, pubs, tiny shops, kiosks and the remarkable square of Santa Maria. Beautiful by day, entertaining by night.
Lovely place. Went there via the Spanish steps which were closed due to refurbishment which was a bit disappointing still it made up for it in the Gothic part of Rome

A fun spot to wander. Trastevere is charming and has a lot of character. There are a number of great restaurants around (but do your research first to avoid a tourist trap). It was a great place to stroll around during the evening.

Superb Rome Location. Loved staying in this part of Rome. Cobbled streets, beautiful Italian architecture, little boutiques, buskers in the main square and oh my... the food and wine is amazing. So well priced and make sure you are not on a diet to properly enjoy the Italian cuisine. Loved how some shops closed for a few hours in the afternoon but where open to all hours. Just love the cafe culture! We didn't need to use any public transport to key attractions as they were all within walking distance (30 minutes). I didn't see one chain store which was nice. Would stay in this area again!
Picturesque part of Rome. A little more quite than the center of touristic Rome, some very good restaurants- and the prices lower after you cross the river:), plenty of shops as well

Kool and Alive. As a senior traveler I loved this area...it has the best vibe..lots of young people with lots of action. Just across the Tiber River you are in the new Rome. Just go for dinner. The restaurants offer good food a nice prices.

Trastevere. We had a pleasant stay in Trastevere which was our starting point 4 days in Oct 2015 and end up with another 3 days moreon Nov 2015 Nice little alleys and many good restaurants .Give a good picture of the old times. Is a must to visit during a visit to Rome! ,and Don't miss every Sunday antik and another stuff Market there
Another must in Rome. Across the river this neighbourhood offers possibilites for beautiful walks, hidden little taverns and some amusing tourist trap. Rome is not Rome without Trastevere

Ti amo. Trastevere is a lovely part of Rome, across the Tiber River, where you can find reasonable lodging, meals, wonderful wine, and the best colazione for only 2 Euro! But, best of all are the lovely local people, winding cobblestone streets, beautiful Basilica and hidden frescos you can find during our explorations. The Vatican is a short bus ride or mid-sized walk away. Traditional Roman sightseeing is just across the river. It's all there right at your fingertips! Enjoy! Ciao!
Great place to visit early evening. We arrived there late afternoon and scrolled around for some hoursWe had great dinner, an espresso at one of the bars

Fun, exciting neighborhood. Packed with restaurants and bars, gelato, and people watching. Tiny twisty streets make getting lost easy, but it is here is a real treat because around every corner is something new and fun. Good people watching. Nicely lit for the Christmas season too.

Sick of Rome? Go to Trastevere. I honestly had about enough of Rome by the end of our first day. Considering how many Americans we were around, I might as well have just been in Little Italy in NYC. If you want a real Roman experience, come to Trastevere! Best best food and you'll get a much more local experience - not to say that you still won't be around American's, but less so.

for a breath of fresh air(turist free). If you want to see Rome in the eyes of locals and escape a litt;le from the hoards of turists that seem to be everywhere, this is the best place! The prices are much better, you can also buy beer from the kiosk and drink it in the "plaza" while watching the locals meet their friends :)
Buzzing!. We visited this neighborhood in the night and it was worth the long walk across the river! The pace is buzzing with cafes and nightlife! The place has a great vibe and some lovely bars!
The best neighborhood for food and drink.. The best neighborhood for food and drink at day and at night. Nice cafeterias and restaurants, both cheap and expensive choices, very beautiful streets.

Great part of Roma!!!. First off my title would most likely get the people from Trastevere slightly flustered since they do not believe that they are really part of Rome and I have to admit that they are completely right. Trastevere is very unique; everything there is done differently and there is an atmosphere in that part of Rome that is simply hard to explain; it can only be felt!!! It sounds a bit cheezy saying that but it is true. The people are so nice and firendly, the restaurants are tiny BUT truly inviting, the streets are warm and inviting. Everything in Trastevere is great! It is like being in a city inside of Rome...!It is highly recommended to go there and visit that part of the city.

Trastevere. Small neighbourhood across the river has many restaurants and provides a different face of the otherwise historic Rome. It also has famous churches such as St. Cecelia and Santa Maria. Take a tram through the heart of Trastevere or walk in its maze like street.
Very quaint and now trendy. Excellent place to walk at night and go for dinner or drinks... many, many places to choose from....

Walk around over a couple of hours. Great place for a mid morning, afternoon or early evening stroll, take in the sights, smells and sounds.
There are some great restaurants, bars and even a nice stroll along the banks of the River Tiber - well worth it.

Old Rome at its best. This is a must see little town. Walk around the old cobble stone streets and choose from many restaurants. Trip Advisor gives some very accurate eating preferences and they are on the spot.
Nice area to stroll!. This is a nice section to stroll to see a part of Rome that is less crowded and gives you a different perspective. The Jewish ghetto section was also interesting to see.
Italy's New Orleans. Amazing restuarants, street performers, entertainment everywhere! Trastevere is a must for foodies! Definetely one of our favorite parts of Rome!

Don't skip this area. Our family really enjoyed touring this area after spending a few days in the other very busy areas of Rome. Much more laid back and relaxed feel to this very old, very unique part of the city.
Cool place, Great food. We ate in Trastevere twice on our recent visit to Rome. It was fun and different from the usual sites.

Don't miss this area, so local !. Santa Maria church is dating rom 340, not o be missed to see th inside...so much more beautiful than any other church in Rome. A very local part of the city ..good restaurants.

Picturesque. Picturesque area, narrow streets, small shops, plenty of restaurants. Santa Maria in Trastevere is a beautiful church to take a break. You can also walk from Trastevere all the way to Giancolo hill to see great view over Rome.

Full of people!. We went to Trastevere after a friend recomended it we should go for drinks. It was full of people! It was great! It had restaurants and bars and even it was 10:00 p.m. some shops were open too. It had a really warm environment.
Very nice. Very nice "Borgata"...at night it's full of life with its typical restaurants and "Osterie"...if you go to Rome you have to see almost once in your life :-)

when in Rome, do like the Romans do. Nice blend of tourists and locals. Confusing maze of streets and each lane seems to have a pizzeria or taverna that is probably a better choice than those on the major piazza. Tons of accommodation if you book early. We loved Hotel Santa Maria.
Cool and trendy district. We walked here one evening for dinner, it has a great vibe. The shops and restaurants are all pretty and the roads are narrow and all different.
Pizza in the Piazza. Had a pizza from a small take out place and ate sitting on the steps of the fountain in the piazza. The best pizza we had in Italy! Wish I could remember the name of the place.

The Left Bank of Rome. A much quieter Rome. Little vehicular traffic, cafes, restaurants and shops in tree and vine lined streets give it a very romantic feel and make for a pleasant place to spend an afternoon
Many restaurants to choose from. Go to the trastevere area for the choice of many restaurants and atmosphere where you can stroll along the streets, better at night more atmosphere.
Great neighborhood for strolling & eating. Felt like a find -- a little bit of early Soho in Rome. Winding streets, unique shops and restaurant, a very pleasant vibe.

The best place to eat. A hidden gem across the river ,worth getting a taxi as the food and drink is half the price you will pay in the centre of Rome ,lots of choice and sit in the main square listening to music eating delicious ice cream .

its a town to see ,we walked all along the river from the vatican and vuola we were in trastevere. i found trastevere while surfing on the net before going on holiday to ROME.so i made sure we visit.we found a very good restaurant which is good value for money ,really good food and wine .we loved it so much that sometimes we purposely travelled by bus at nyt time to have dinner at RISTORANTE CARLO MENTA .

For me, this is the most charming section of Rome. Great to stay in, it is next to the Tiber and has so much going on!. The food is delighful, and the old buildings a delight for the eyes. Peaceful accomodations are very close to public transportation. My favorie base to explore the city from.
Different Part of Rome. Nice narrow streets and fine and maybe the best resraurants. Lovely and lively atmosphere. Worth passing through and sit to eat if you are hungry.

Second hand stalls. I lost my time here reading others reviews.There are stalls with second hand clothes and few others "first hand" but low quality.You can find few stores too but the prices are "romans" .

Good place to eat. I think this is the best place to eat near Varican.There are a lot of restaurants with local foods and also the prices are smaller than in the other part of the city.You can go and enjoy a nice meal or few drinks in a nice and old neighbourhood.It's about 15 minutes walk from Varican

Typical and cute litte street. Trastevere is a nice area. Older Rome with little street, restaurants and market to visit. I had one of my best "Carciofi alla Romana" there.
Totally worth going, but you might have to walk a bit...

Very buzzy and cool. Stumbled into Trastavere whilst looking for a specific bar (which we never found!) and loved this area. We came back here 2 nights in a row - it is very lively and great fun for dinner and a few drinks. Very crowded even in November - even at midnight. Everywhere we ate had excellent food.

A day at Trastevere. A day in the Rome district Trastevere is a day well spent. I would advise to plan the Trastevere visit on Sunday, so you can start with a visit to the giant Sunday Market behind the Porta Portese city gate, overflowing in the parallel streets with the flee market. Furthermore, returning from the market and entering the historic part of Trastevere through the city wall, the charming atmosphere of Trastevere with the narrow cobble-stoned streets will strike you immediately. One drawback: You are not alone, for Trastevere is a tourist magnet, individual tourists and tour groups alike. Trastevere is awash with bars, restaurants, artists shops etc. Be careful when sitting down in a bar or restaurant for a drink or a snack. Like other tourist hot spots in Italy, there is a large difference in price having your consumption standing at the bar or sitting at a table ("Bar" or "Tavolo" prices). Fortunately, in Italy it is compulsory to display the prices. Don't forget to visit the main square, Piazza di Santa Maria in Trastevere, and the beautiful church, Basilica di Santa Maria in Trastevere. A day well spent.

Great night. Had diner at Trastevere, this place is colourful and full of life with lots of restaurants to pick from and lots of small shops to buy that special gift for someone or for yourself. We had fun and definitely would go back.

Old Rome, beautiful little alleys and shops - a must-see. Cross the river coming from the center and just enjoy. Many restaurants, little shops, craftsmanship, old houses, galleries, etc. Just go for a stroll, have a coffee and watch people. Enjoy.
Off the beaten track. Great area! Lovely place with lots of restaurants. authentic Italian food. You won't find any touts that offer you are rose. Calm and romantic atmosphere.

Great food on every corner. We stayed at an airbnb in Trastevere and were not disappointed! This is a great part of old Rome, fantastic restaurants await you on every corner and back Vicolo, and there is shopping, music, and sights. Highly recommend visiting here to get out of the tourist area.

Great place but.... ...it quite easily gets too much. Though the settings, with narrow streets, small shops, cafes and so on, is there, there is too much focus on tourists. There are a number of great restaurants, worth a visit, but most of the others are mere tourist traps - red checkered table cloth, huge menu sign and annoying waiters pulling you in from the street. if you wait til 8pm it gets a little better.
Cobbled Streets. lots of little lanes, cafe's and cobbled streets, was a really nice part of Rome that was much quieter than the majority of the City
Greta area to enjoy Rome and all it has to offer. Lots of winding alleyways and cobbled streets, great bars and restaurants and always something going on, best place to stay when in Rome
Feast of Food. Italian cooking at it's best. Vast number of restaurants providing high quality cuisine at sensible prices
Incredible neighbourhood. We went several times during our visit to Rome, the neighbourhood is eclectic and comes alive at night, beautiful restaurants and shops.

Picturesque. This area is on the same side of the River Tiber and is a maze of busy narrow cobbled streets with nice restaurants and boutique style shops. Very good for a stroll during the day or at night.

Trastevere - last remnants of Italians in Rome. Trastevere is one of the last close neighborhoods in Rome where you run into Romans, The area has many charming cafes and restaurants. The smaller markets are very friendly and don't sell spice packets for foreigners trying to make pasta.There are many places to eat from high end seafood to .80 euro espressos. Easy Access to Central Rome, about 5 min by tram, and if you are out to late only about 8 euro to get back from the Nova piazza area. Renting a flat in this area is good, just remember that the infrastructure is old and a hair dryer can turn your place off from electricity so find out where the fuse box and the main fuse box are.

Delightful fun crowds in Trastevere.. Want to spend.an evening walking along narrow streets lined with cozy restaurants and outdoor tables...where the people watching is almost as good as the food. Listen to the ancient church bells echo off the cobblestone passageways and drift back into a simpler time. Each place has their unique spaghetti carbonara...all delicious. But skip desert because they have the best gelato stands in Rome.

Perfect Evening. Trastvere tucked in a quaint neighbourhood across river Tiber is a charming medieval corner of Rome, a must see for a pleasant evening. Piazza de Danta Maria is the central attraction of this labyrinthine district sorrounded by shops and cafes. One may relax on the steps of the fountain watching some street shows if in progress. Then walk into any of the narrow cobblestones streets to lead you to your chosen restaurant. The dining experience has a wide spectrum from pizzerias, trattoria and fine dining to choose from.

A very different feel to other parts of Rome. A little off the tourist trail. Worth a visit. Many narrow charming roads leading to a steep hillside walk ending in great views of Rome by the Garibali monument. The Botanical Gardens looked like they were worth a visit but sadly the entrance was closed at the upper entrance near the Garibaldi monument.

A slower pace of life and immensely pretty. With its winding streets and cobbled pathways this is quite by far and away the prettiest of Rome. Bustling cafes, shops and market stalls are a great way to immerse yourself into Roman life. And the best Pizza in Rome I'd say from the slice we bought from a bustling shop full of Romans. Yum

Gritty ghetto gathers gawkers. We spent a week in Trastavere and found everything we needed within a few footsteps: a great grocery, a corner coffee shop, and the delicious Osteria Antica Giovanni. We were but a few steps to the palace museums of the Corsini and Borgia families, ancient churches, and small plazas opening off winding streets. But don't go there, it's getting crowded! :)
picturesque neighborhood. picturesque neighborhood! nice shops and nice priced food! I would go back, I love it!!!!!And YOU must go!!!
Nice walk. We walked around. It was pretty much as all the guidebooks tell you. If your a photographer there are many nice shot awaiting you in this area.
Great for dinner. Entertainment such as musicians, dancers and fire dancers by the fountain. Come for dinner and enjoy the entertainment after! Lively nightlife area!
Busy and bustling. Loved the hustle bustle of the place. Lots of people with the Trevi fountain being the main attraction. Avoid even looking at street vendors selling selfie sticks!

The good, the not so bad and the never ugly of Trastevere. We were in Trastevere 20 years ago just for a visit. We stayed elsewhere in Rome. This time we rented an apartment in Trastevere for 3 weeks. What a great idea!Of course Trastevere has changed in 20 years. On our first day we walked down to the local nearest square to our apt. San Cosimoto where there is a market Monday through Saturday. We were charmed and delighted at the friendliness and the good produce, cheese, pasta, meat, fish and bread. The next day we were out going to a museum and walked back early evening through the main square which is Santa Maria Di Trastevere and were shocked to see scads of visitors, hawkers ((who had identical items). The charming little workshops, artist studios and stores of our memory were gone.Well we discovered not exactly gone but relocated to the other side of Lungaterra Trastevere which is the big street that cuts across Trastevere. On the "non touristy" side, there are small trattorias, workshops, bookstores, bakeries and quiet streets. We found our old Trastevere at last.

An interesting area of Rome. As our accommodation was in Trastevere (La Duchessa a Roma, we inadvertently discovered this wonderful area. We were particularly thrilled to view the Pietro Cavallini frescos in the convent next to the Church of St Cecilia.

Nice place to stay. My family and I stayed in Trastevere during our recent trip to Rome, and, while the neighborhood itself was fairly nice, there wasn't much to do in Trastevere itself. Also, it was quite loud at night, but in fairness, our apartment was next door to a late hours bar. As far as location, Trastevere was perfect!

Wonderful neighborhood for wondering. This was my favorite neighborhood in Rome. The winding streets lead to some amazing finds, and I could really feel like I was in a community where neighbors know each other. If you plan on walking through, I highly recommend eating at Ai Marmi for dinner. It is a traditional Roman pizza place on the main road a few blocks in after crossing the bridge. The pizza was one of the best things I ate the entire trip.

What a fantastic vibrant area. We had a lovely meal & bottle of wine in a restaurant in a Piazza and it was so good to watch the locals as they walked by. Service was great and everybody very friendly . We would definitely recommend a visit to this area.

RIck Steves walking tour of Trastevere. We took a walking tour of Trastevere with Rick Steves free app and it was very interesting.
