We went on to later visit Trastevere during the day time (See other reviews!) and I still reccomend you go to the summer night markets, but be prepared to not be overwhelmed. Just enjoy the atmosphere.
Take a stroll through here. A lovely part of Rome to stroll around and grab a meal, just make sure you bring a map because it's easy to get lost amongst the small side streets.

Best neighbourhood in Rome. Very nice neighbourhood on the right bank of the Tiber river with tiny streets and piazzas dotted with small restaurants and shops at affordable prices. Buy your drinks at a local shop and enjoy the atmosphere at Piazza Trilussa.

Beautiful part of Rome. This is a beautiful neighbourhood in Rome and can be a pleasant change to some of the frentic activity of so many quarters of this wonderful city. Take your time, wander the alleys, visit the churches and find a little eatery to rest your weary bones!
Best place for eating out. Beautiful neighborhood with the best restaurants at moderate prices. Awesome small streets and piazzas with nice ambiente, especially at night

Get your evening walk and dinner here!. A nice roman experience for seeing the beauty of nightlife and where the young students spend their time. Charming streets to get lost and many wonderful choices for an evening aperitivo and dinner.
Must visit. Must visit area of rome to get a feel of a little bit less touristy areas. I recommend you walk up the hill to get a breathtaking view of rome, and end it in the main square.
Beatiful neighbourhood..worth the walk,. Charming and beatiful neighbourhood.Not as busy as other touristic places.Find a palce to emjoy a gelato or a beer!

First Time. While this was my fifth stay in Rome, for some unknown reason I had never ventured to the Trastevere. So one Friday evening we crossed the river by the Ponte Fabbricio. What magic awaited us! Excited crowds thronged the streets. Walking through this enchanting district district was amazing: narrow streets and alleys, lovely little squares, often with foliage tumbling down the walls, and everywhere trattorias spilling across the pavements and piazzas. There are some notable sights : Santa Maria in Trastevere,being one of them. We spent the entire evening eating, drinking and people watching. Before going back to our apartment, we descended steps to the bank of the river where there were literally more than a kilometer of markets housed under white tentlike structures,selling everything from jewellery to foodstuffs. Here, too, hundreds and hundreds of people were sitting at various eateries strung along the river. What a buzz!

When in Rome, do as the Romans do!!. We are just back from Rome and this area is a must if you visit. We discovered the area on our first night by accident as we had hired a vespa (bici & baci can't go wrong with those guys). We quickly parked up and took a stroll through the small narrow streets lined with brick(cobble). There are many great places to eat in this area for the most original Roman experience. Wonder down here any evening over the weekend and the place is crazy busy. The bigger the line for a table the better the food obviously but don't be fooled by the guys trying to drag you in with menus in their hands. A great place for a romantic meal for two when in gets dark it's a different place.
Best neighborhood in Rome. We rented an apartment in Trastevere and loved the central location to everywhere we wanted to go and all the great restaurants and bars in the area.
The Best of Rome. The best of Rome!! Excelent neighbordhood to stay and visit, feeling like an authentic roman. A must go!!!

Centrally located and lots to see and do. A really interesting, well positioned place to stay in Rome. Should you choose to walk around, you have relatively easy access to most of the attractions Rome has to offer. I would stay here again next trip to Rome, and again after that!

To view the local life of the people in Rome. If you want to view the other side of river Tiber and look into the life of a local Roman, then Trastevere is the place to be in. The place turns party like post sun set with river side cafeterias and restaurants filled with tourists and locals alike. The tiny streets of Trastevere are absolutely scenic. The food offered by the roadside restaurants inside the narrow lanes of Trastevere are delicious and a must try for tourists. In one word it is the place to visit if you want to feel the pulse of local life.

Do not miss this area. Trastevere comes alive at night and you will find many great restaurants that are fairly priced. We ate at four different restaurants and were never disappointed. At times some of the piazzas are overcrowded with sidewalk vendors and you are expected to bargain.
Must be neighborhood in italy. I loved the stoned walkways and simply loved the fountains and the bistros. Definitely a place to go when you're in Italy.

Lovely area with good food spots. Trastevere is my favourite area in Rome, especially in the evening. You find lots of good restaurants, some of them not too touristy. Trastevere is so charming because of it's small streets and alleys, old houses and just the real Italian way of live!

Where?. This area was recommended by a family member and was quite a long walk from where we were staying at Piazza Navona. Wasn't particularly impressed when we got there, found some of the shops mentioned in the guide book so knew we were in the right which I was wondering about given the amount of graffiti in the area........maybe we were wandering the wrong streets??

The calmer part of the downtown area.. Trastevere always gets great reviews from people - I don't know what the fuss is really about, except that it's less busy and less dodgy than the rest of downtown Rome. It was winding alleys you're not afraid to walk down, and some great restaurants, but the area itself didn't thrill me. It was just 'nice', if that helps!

Don't forget to visit here.... This was a great place to visit to get away from the hectic crowds of the Ancient Rome ruins area. We walked from our hotel in the Piazza Navona section and it was a very nice 20 minute walk. We specifically went to Trastevere to visit the Santa Maria Church which is not to be missed.

Trestevere - lovely Roman neighborhood. To see Rome like a Roman, you must get off the tourist track and see "The Eternal City" as its residents do. Trestevere is an enclosed, ancient neighborhood just "across the Tiber." You'll find churches, squares, restaurants, cafes, bakeries, gelato stands, etc. with far more locals than you'll see at the major attractions. In one of the squares, have some wine, and watch the street traffic and performers. You'll see Rome as a livable city and not just a tourist destination.

Local colour and beat. Quaint and seemingly more authentic than some of the quarters of Rome, Trastevere has narrower streets and smaller churches but plenty of character. Well worth the walk across the Tiber, this is an interesting place to see young Romans (probably mainly students) and the prices are more affordable for those on tighter budgets.

trastevere great place to stay in rome. Great place to stay in Rome near all amenites full of life at night if that is what you want but as we had young children with us it still did not matter as our accomadiation was right. In the middle of everything and did not bother us it was great

Trastevere - The Last Roman Vestige. I worry writing this, as I hope tourists do not go here, but I am unable not to write a review. Trastevere is actual Rome, with actual Romans, with the best prices for everything, beautiful homes and roads, etc... The food is the best here, the prices for food are the best here, and the area has Santa Caecilia in Trastevere, which is my favorite Roman church. To enjoy Rome truly, is to enjoy Trastevere.

Get away from the city in this fabulous little district. I remembered this place from visiting years ago and it has always stuck in my mind as it was such a lovely experience I wanted my friends to see it. We got of the bus at the Piazza Venezia and walked over the bridge to Trastavere. After the hustle and bustle of the city this is a little quaint higgledy piggledy area and very quiet even in July. We had lunch at a fantastic cafe just before the main church (Maria?) in the square - there are several little churches but this one is spectacular inside. The pizzeria where we ate was one of the best meals we had, and the cheapest! Proper authentic freshly cooked Italian fare and very pleasant, comical young men waiting on. There is the occasional little workshop and the whole feel is bohemian. We got a taxi to the Vatican from there and it was only 10€ for the four of us which saved our poor feet. You must visit Trastevere when you go to Rome.

Best atmosphere beautiful place to return to a spend a few days!. We returned here for another visit just loved it las time and we were not disappointed! We really enjoyed the evenings wandering around people waiting, loved the market on Sunday, just went on and on and on such fun, even in 35'. It's also easy to walk into the city and seeing so many wonderful historical sights .
Awesome place to stay!. Awesome place to stay! Nice ambiance, city centre is within 5 min. Cabs are all over the place. Especially at nighttime it's really good. Lots of nice restaurants!
Lovely area. This is such a nice area to walk around. We stopped in several churches. Cafes dot the streets. If touring anything in the area, please take the time to walk around Trastevere.

Beautiful, specially when the sun set. Interesting part of Rome. Very recomendable going there for a dinner. Walk along its narrow stoned streets, admire its buidings, its churches, chose one of its charming restaurants. By the way, pictures are just amazing from any ot the bridges crossing the Tevere

Real Rome. This place is frequented by the locals so its the real Rome. We had dinner, walked around and loved it. Parking is difficult as in all of Rome. My teen son and 9 year old daughter loved it. Not a dull moment.
Best barrio in Roma.. Most interesting and bohemian district of Roma. Lots of narrow streets hiding excellent cafes. Walk and lose yourself.

Great district for a walking tour of real Rome. We often take the long way back from St Peters, through Trastevere, and then crossing the Tiber near the Isola Tiberna. It's a beautiful walk, day or night, throughout winding cobblestone streets that remain a neighborhood. Beautiful area with lots of little pubs, shops, eateries. Great place to just relax and enjoy the people & the streets of old Rome.
lovely. nice cute little neighborhood with lovely restaurants, churches and galleries ideal for an afternoon walk since almost all restaurants worked from 2 to 7 pm

What a beautiful area ! Trastevere is the alternative area. We discovered the Trastevere one day before we left. So sad !!
Trastevere is a very nice place to eat, drink or relax. It is a very place for shopping as well. All these small shops with rings, earrings, .... my wife definitely loved it !!!

Get a little lost. Trastevere is a walking neighborhood and the best way to see it is on foot. Walk back through all the windy roads of the "old neighborhood," and get lost a little bit. The area is worth a little walk around but there are not attractions that would keep you there all day.

Trastevere AMORE MIO!!!!!! AMAZINGGGGG!!!!. I am in love with Trastevere it is one of the most amazing places in the whole of roma!!!! It is such a quaint and beautiful place with an atmosphere like you have never experienced! It's so beautiful and breathtaking that it is deserving of all the praise it gets. This is not like the rest of roma there is less tourists here and more affordable food. However, nothing exceeds it's beauty.

Super District to Stay. spent 12 days in Casa de Tinea apartment Trastevere in January and could not have been more pleased with the accomodation and the area.Far enough away from central but close walk to all sites, trams in the next street, next to lots of great restaurants, the river, and feeling like you were living as a local.Able to buy daily needs at local market or grocer or patisserie, Cook if we needed to and venture home during the day to put our feet up before embarking on more massive walks.Definitely stay here again and particularly at Casa de Tinea ( not on TA because advertised on competitors site)

Walking around. Trastevere is a part if the old city. Here you can relax, eat, drink, and watch the street artists. You can buy things from the small table sellers. Or you can just sit by the fountain and watch it all happen.
Underwhelming. During our visit we found the streets littered with rubbish and a lot of graffiti . It was disappointing ,we don't understand how the reviews can be so different to what we saw.
Best by night. Been there twice at night and once at day. It was the most pleasant way/place to pass the night. Full of little street "stores", restaurants and bars.
Touristy. It IS beautiful but feels very crowded and touristy. There was also a sense of people watching you who felt like they might be pickpockets.

Bustling place in Rome!. Bustling place in Rome! Either by day or by night, Trastevere is an enchanting dictrict to walk around and have a drink or meal. Located "behind the Tevere river", it offers a nice experience.
Great experience. A ton of restaurants, shops, street shows, and more. A must visit. Have comfy shoes on!!!! Parking is difficult to find, so cab it if you can. The place is always packed.....

Great quirky place to visit. We stayed a couple of stops further down the no 8 Tran Line and decided to have a look round the area. Small quirky streets with little café bars etc. A few souvenirs shops. There were less crowds than the centre of Rome and no beggars or crap sellers. We visited in the day but I'm guessing this is an area which would be best appreciated on an evening.

Quaint. Took bus route H from the Monti area across the river to Trastevere. Get off at the stop as soon as directly over the river and bear right down the lanes into the backstreets. There is no end of choice of restaurants and market stalls to browse. We went in the evening and it was very lively. Not just for tourists but locals too.

Meditarranean section in Rome. Trastevere is the place that you imagine when somebody is telling about meditarranean towns, but it's in Rome. You can take a romantic walk with your lover or just discover with your friends. Beautiful colours, little streets, drying clothes above you, enticing smells from small restaurants, and delicious ice cream. You can find little squuares where musicians entertain you.If you have time, visit Orto Botanico, where you can be far from the madding crowd.

Lost in travel. Absolutely lovely, having visited Rome before, I absolutely loved getting lost in the streets of Trastevere. It's abreath of fresh air, between all the turisty stuff the city offers. You feel like you can get away of masses.
Hipster area. Old part of town that used to be bohemians, but now there are only hipsters and small "alternative" shops. So if you se youreself in that then go have fun.

Great atmosphere. Loved this part of Rome. Lots going on and a great atmosphere. Choose your restaurant carefully as some places are considerably better value than others. A great place for dinner or drinks after spending the day sightseeing.

The best part of town. Rome is awesome. Its got a lot of great architecture, culture and history. But sometimes you need a break from all of the ancient Rome bits. Need a place to go? Go to Trastevere. Its not too far from everything and it is just amazing, small quiet streets with laundry hanging over your head, classic houses with vespa's parked in front of them overgrown with plants, This neigbourhood just gives you the classic Italian vibe

Great neighborhood. This was one of our favorite sections of Rome. We enjoyed walking around and exploring the different streets and alley ways. Spend a day or half day here if you to get out of the hot and noisy city center. This is a great place to relax and enjoy something at a local bar or cafe.

Stay Here!!!. Oh, what a perfect choice to stay in Trastevere!. We had heard a mixed bag of reviews on this wonderful town. Some said "don't go there, kinda dirty and can be dangerous." Oh please! I can't imagine staying anywhere else! We had a magnificent 3 bedroom apartment just down the street from the Cabot University and the prison that houses some of the Mafia. There is nightlife and more nightlife; restaurants and bars and gelato shops and mini-marts and cafes - did I mention nightlife? We walked everywhere while in Rome, day and night and never once felt threatened or unsafe. The town can get a little littered with bottles and general trash but it gets cleaned up (for the most part). Fantastic little restaurants, walk-up pizza places, fine dining, great cafes and wonderful food. The city of Rome (proper) is a walk over the Tiber River. When we would be out traveling the city via foot, we couldn't wait to come back to Trastevere to relax, people watch eat and drink. Highly recommend and don't let the reviews of pick-pockets or whatever else people are saying scare you off. Pick pockets are everywhere in the world. Just be an "aware tourist" and you will be fine. This is where you will experience the real "Roman" way of life. Also, if your apartment does not have laundry service, there is a coin operated laundry mat about 20-25 minute walk from Cabot University. Locals will be able to direct you.

Perfect place to stay when visiting rome. We had a brilliant apartment in the centre of Trastevere and found it to be convenient,y located to the rest of Rome. We were able to comfortably walk to the main attractions within Rome. There are many restaurants and convenience stores. Would definitely stay in this area on or next trip back to Rome.
Oldest and most Roman area of Rome. just wander the streets, go into the churches and eat in Trastevere to get a different feel of Rome.
Nice old rome to walk..avoid the restaurants though. Excellent area to relax and stroll around! Restaurants in the area although look good are very touristic oriented.

The main square is a great for lunch. Trastevere is a mix of fairly down market streets, plus a section that is old and has featured buildings. The main one of these is the Farsenina, a lovely building to walk around with attractive gardens. A visit to the Basilica Santa Maria in the main square is well worth it. Many people have lunch sitting on the steps of the statues in the centre. A walk over the Ponte Sisto gets you there and is a great place to view the river.
Bring a book and good shoes. Sit down on a cafe, read your book, drink coffee or wine. That is enough to feel relaxed. But bring good shoes, there is enough to see here as well..
excellent. beautiful area with its meandering streets,and renaissance buildings.its known for its unforgettable roman eateries,and bars.Must visit while in Rome

Tourist trap. Stay away from Trastevere. Unless accompanied by a local, the chances are high that you choose a fake-typical Roman restaurant, expensive, and with a poor ratio quality/price. There are tens af better things to do and to see in Rome, rather than wandering through Trastevere.

Very nice and authentic corner of Rome. One of the best corners in Rome. This area is small and very unique. Narrow streets, lots of restaurants, gift and souvenir shops - all this make the distric very authentic and interesting. Visit this place if even you have just 2-3 days in Rome. Spend several hours - just walk in the streets, visit the cathedral, have your lunch in one of the restaurants. Uswusally it takes 2-3 hours to have a nice feeling of this place.

Old city charm with relaxing sidewalks and many restaurants. My favourite place to hide from the crowd and heat of Rome in Jun. Sitting at the fountain, drinking beer under the stars, watching the various street performers, enjoying the feel and charm of the old city charm.

Fun day walking to this part of Rome. Great area full of restaurants and little shops. We spent a morning walking to this area from central Rome and enjoyed a great lunch and shopping all found on TA.

Great place !. My wife and my 13 months boy, went to Rome for a week stay. We couldn´t choose better neighborhood. We rented an apartment by AirBnB and had a wonderfull time in Trastevere. The place is really walk distance from all the main atractions, even if you are carry on a stroller as we were. When we return to Rome we gonna stay there again for sure.

This is a great place to have dinner and see the old streets. The choices of places to eat is almost limitless. You are in Italy-how can you go wrong. Two of the colleges for students visiting from the USA are in this neighborhood. Go and relax, eat and have some vino!

Charming Trastevere. If you have time, after all the sightseeing in Rome which is so exhausting try to plan at least one dinner and a walk over the bridge into Trastevere. Trastevere has a charm all on its own of amazing colourful little houses and coffee shops, boutique restaurants to modern up beat pizzerias that are very good value. There are other specialist restaurants that serve traditional dishes and lots of meat choice too. The atmosphere is relaxing although you can find some nightlife late. Taxis are easy to find if you are tired and want to get back to your accommodation.without walking the cobbled streets. Note, high heels are not advised.Highly recommend adding this to your list.

Trastevere is food paradise. Famous place for it's restaurants,home made ice cream and trattorias!Best place to eat real italian food in various prices but not expensive usually..Very italian neighborhood and very friendly people..20-30 min on foot from the center of Rome but worth walking there!Careful cause there are thousands of birds on some point close to Trastevere on the trees and sometimes accidents happen as the bird droppings fall from them usually but this happens between 18:00-21:00!
Specially during the evening. Nice, so nice and relaxing. Make a walk and visit some beautiful churches. You can feel the history.
loved it every time. small houses narrow streets bars resturants street shows. great place to visit at night . young beautyful people all around. a good place to end every day in rome

Charming neighborhood. Trastevere is a charming part of Rome with cobblestone streets and flowering vines clinging to buildings. Many buildings are topped by flowers and gardens. Cafes are everywhere, and this would be a great place to go for lunch or dinner. We didn't have a lot of time, but we enjoyed walking through the narrow streets and touring the Basilica of Santa Maria in Trastevere.

Nice, cozy and good eating places. A nice and interesting place with a lot of "hitten" places. You do find expensive tourist traps - but also a lot of good and fair priced restaurants. Place to find your dinner

Fantastic. If you want to know what Rome is all about, here is the place to be. Narrow streets, typical architecture, nice shops and flowers everywhere. We went there everyday during our trip to Rome and we liked it more that the city center. Do not miss, it's a must

Funky and authentic Roman neighborhood. Get away from the larger piazzas of central Rome, to this eclectic neighborhood on the rise. During the day it's bustling with young Romans on the move or having coffee; catch a peek of the 14th century synagogue-turned-restaurant; wander the alleys and take in the atmosphere of this across-the-river ancient neighborhood. Worth returning to at night for a stroll along the lower level of the river, if its open (june thru august or so) depending on the water level - funky food stands and shopping.

Lovely neighborhood. Lovely neighborhood with good wine and food away from the touristy places in Rome. We went there for anise, quiet dinner and to walk around away from all the craziness. Highly recommend.

Love this little slice of Rome!. Stayed in this part of Rome for a week, and I would do it again in a heartbeat. All tastes can be satisfied in this section of Rome, and it is an easy walk (for those who like to walk) to all of the historic sites around the city.

JUST ONE WORD - APSOLUTLY MUST SEE. I was visiting Rome with two small kids so I went to see Trastevere afternoon not in night. After we so all we need to see the rain start to fall and I was a little bit dissapointed with this part of Rome so famous. We decided to eat same pasta and pizza, and in the one our we are eating it was latter and darker and Trastevere transformed in crowded streets, restaurants full of people, musicians playing on the street. It all become alive like in fairy tall. So we stay in crowd and just walk in the streets enyoing the atmosfere. By the river Tevere there was also alive with lots of white tents and restaurants. All restaurants where full of people. I think it is possible cose prices are realy OK and everybody can aford it. Thanks God.
Cheerfull!. Wonderful quarter, really great Italian food and mood. We went there for dining some evenings, and it was just great!

The wonderfulness of Rome. Rome can be a tough city to navigate. Crazy taxis and mopeds everywhere, and the pickpockets make even the most cautious traveler ever alert not to be the next victim. But there are places in Rome where you can truly experience this wonderful and diverse city, and Trastevere is one of them. If you love art, love music and delicious food...this is the place to go. Make sure you walk along the water front as there are lots of local vendors that offer an array of wonderful finds. This is a must. A taxi to this area from most places in the center city will be about 15 euro. It's well worth it. There are wonderful restaurants everywhere, that offer wonderful authentic food. There are tourists here without feeling too touristy. This is a great place for families of all ages. Kids will love the scenery and the live entertainers that are in the squares and side streets.

Don't miss it!!!!. Wonderful neighbourhood! We were there during the night and it was a delightful walk. Too bad we were too tired from touring all day to stay even longer! The neighbourhood was alive and full of action: street performers in a piazza, all kind of business open, street vendors, patios and cafes, etc. Just walk around and you'll get lost into the streets that will never disappoint you! Lively area to enjoy a bite, gelato or a coffee. You can pick one of the many establishments and sit there to enjoy your night. In my personal opinion this area is the "Spirit of Rome" -like what the Barrio Gotico is to Barcelona

An afternoon in Trastevere is not enough!. You must make the effort to cross the river and wander around Trastevere there are many intriguing little shops and byways to explore. Don't miss Santa Maria Church in Trastevere.with its breathtaking mosaics. We only spent an afternoon exploring but there is much more to see!

Scenic and many eateries. After spending the late afternoon at Gianicolo hill we took the no 15 bus down into Trastevere dropping off near vis s Francesco. We walk up along this road to Piazza Santa Maria and visited the Basilica of lady of Trastevere .Many eateries along this road including Ivo famoius for Pizza located here. .As it was on a weekday with little crowd we dare not explore the narrow streets. After dinner we walked to Isola Tiberina and the river and Island and buildings were nice scenic photo backdrops after the lights were on. Tram 8 from here is a quick and convenient link to piazza Venezia being the last stop.

Rome, what more can be said is not said. Rome, what more can be said is not saidThe uniqueness of Europe, fountains, plazas good food and lots of Italian atmosphere.You can really feel the classic Europe at its best.
The place to eat. A fantastic little area full of laneways full of places to eat and lots of live. Great place to spend a few hours.

wonderful area in Rome. We stayed in the Trastevere area and it was wonderful. We always felt safe, the area is very quaint and lively, especially at night. It was the perfect location for getting to most if the sites on foot. We walked to Capitoline Hill area, Vatican, Spanish steps, Pantheon, Piazza Venezia and it was easy. A walk to jonculum hill is definitely worth it. The evenings in Trastevere are lively with street performances, people meandering and lots of great little restaurants.

A must in Rome...!. A small city,within a bigger one..!Narrow streets, small shops, bars and cafes. Within walking distance from Phanteon, Colloseum and the rest of the "must see" stuff..Try an icecream,or a Cafe Corretto at Bar Callisto...!

excellent. Wander at will around this area and leave at least 4 to 5 hours to explore the side roads. Bars and restaurants abound but eat off the main busy areas. Better value. Go early or in the evening

Best place to stay and hang out in Rome. Young, hip, lively, late night. It's a great hangout area with a ton of restaurants that are always packed! Very walkable and lots to see and do. Still a short walk over the river to the tourist sites.

Beautiful quant area away from the Tourist hoards. We were delighted to find this area west of the river, below garibaldi park. For some reason it's not mentioned in the travel maps and is better for it. This used to be the old port area of Rome, and just before the bend in the river you can still see a few signs of this, I believe that up until the 1930's there were bullocks towing ships up to the port.Now it's a great area to wander around and find trendy, and reasonable cost taverna's and restaurants.Lovely " chill out" area away from the crowds.

Love this place.... Well worth exploring this area in Rome which is on the other side of the Tiberius River and is full of little shops and lots of restaurants with good priced menus. Vibrant area in the evening with great atmosphere.

Pretty and Peaceful square,. This square was easy to find from station on the tram line 8, get off just before the bridge over the river. And wander through cobbled streets. Plenty of Beth reasonable and traditional restaurants and cafes. Ice cream to die for!! There was street stalls too.

Love you Trastevere !. four night stay at Via Del Moro, Trastevere, Rome will never forget in life. After midnight roaming in streets i feels that party start now and i am leaving for sleep."Abhi to party shuru hui hai "credit goes to my son who suggest to stay here while at Rome. Wonderful gathering of world tourist and awesome food and wine whole night and safe.I will come again rome !

Wonderfully situated. Great place to be when visiting all the key sites in the city, but away from the hustle and bustle of the centre. A bit of old Rome, blessed with great restaurants, where the locals go.

Love!. This place is for people in love, and for people who like to feel loved. Everyone is friendly, fun, warm. It is a little town full of tall building like a maze, and full of little restaurants, bars, and mini stores. The party starts after dark, but it is also full of life during the day. Oh and the fountains and small churches are everywhere.

Great Location!. We stayed a week here in a lovely apartment. Trastevere is ideally located within half an hour walk of most of Romes major Attractions. There are some great restaurants in the area and always lots of activity in the evenings.Highly recommend!

Felt like home. While it's a 'thrilling' experience to visit Trastevere on a bicycle, the cobblestones are unforgiving and given the chance I would love to explore the area more on foot. My visions of old Rome are here, the tiny winding lanes and alleys, bustling with life and colour, tiny shopfronts, GELATO!, bistros, gorgeous houses and the hum of history, it's so close to the big name landmarks, and yet feels like home. A delightful part of any visit to Rome.

Surprises around every corner. What a great place to explore! We found wonderful,charming little restaurants and bars while lost in the streets of Trastevere. At night, the Piazza Santa Maria is crowded with locals and tourists enjoying their meals and watching the street performers. So much fun.

Most charming neighborhood . Walking through Trastevere, you get a glimpse of life immediately after ww2. Charming, colorful and bohemian, if you don't have enough time to also go the testaccio neighborhood, Trastevere is filled with excellent places to eat and sit absorbing life on the streets here.
Wonderful area worth a whole visit on its own.. Well worth a whole stay in Rome! Lovely area with great places to eat and visit. Do go to the Santa Maria in Trastevere church also.

One of the highlights of our trip. This is a MUST SEE neighborhood in Rome and is worthy of dedicating a few hours to explore. This area is on the other side of the Tiberius River and is full of little shops and lots of restaurants with good priced menus. If the powers that be permit, I will definitely be returning to Rome and coming back to Trastevere and spending more time.
Atmospheric. Well worth a stroll around due to the narrow winding streets, musicians and general ambience. Great choice of restaurants and bars too plus regular bus service

nice neighboorhood with small shops. brilliant for an evening stroll and some food in many of the restaurants aroundIf you want to buy fivefingers, yes they are available for the outdoorshop close to line 8
nice small streets. just have spend some hours going to these narrow streets full of people to meet with the heart of italy

An excellent walking tour. We followed the Rick Steve's podcast walking tour (about an hour long) and got a wonderful first-hand view of this old, working-class area of Rome. After walking several streets and visiting several churches, we ended at the Piazza di Santa Maria and wonderful dinner at the Sabatini restaurant right on the piazza. Be sure to step into the Basilica di Santa Maria in Trastevere, it was the most beautiful church we entered on our 12 day trip (and be sure to ask about the importance of oil in the church's past).Highly recommend the Rick Steves podcast tour but, even without it, a self-walking tour through Trastevere is a visit to authentic old Rome.

Great location, space and responsive owner!. We loved being in the artsy area of Rome! The unit was large and a great place for us to come home to. It is an easy walk to the center of Rome, Vatican etc. and only a 7 euro cab ride if you get tired. There is plenty to see on the walk with many squares to stop on and have a great glass of wine. The bed was big and comfortable, smoke free place and a great balcony!We loved staying here and would rent this one again for sure!

A favourite.. Trastevere was my favourite neighborhood in Rome. We were not staying there but I still wish I did. When visiting during the day is very pitoresque and beautiful. From the buildings to the atmosphere it all makes you want to stay there. Make sure you stop for an expresso or a piece of pizza in the manny places Trastevere offers.We also visited it during the night, you have several bars and during the summer everyone just stays outside in the Plaza enjoying their beer and so should you!!

Wonderful place to discover!. Trastevere is like a whole new world across the Tiber river from Rome, wonderful little picturesque streets and a very laid back atmosphere as well as a great selection of eating places to choose from. Very tranquil, yet bohemian feel with the delicious food and people of Rome. Loved this place and had a delicious meal at Pizzeria Otello of Roman specialties such as fried, artichokes and zucchini flowers as well as cod fish and salads.

Fairytale village. This is the place where you want to spend your evenings after a busy day in crowded Rome. The whole pedestrian area looks like an ancient town with outdoor restaurants, yellow lights and great food.

Disappointed in our quick walk through. I was expecting more of the area but I think it was due to the tour we took rather than the area itself. i had read such good things and was looking forward to going there, especially for the food. However we were rushed through, the area was extremely crowded and you struggled to move through the area. The tour was running late so we didn't even have time to stop to try the food or even see what was available should we have time to return. I'd like to visit again just to stroll through on our own. Don't believe our tour did justice to the area.

Worth a walk around. First visit to this neighbourhood....nice walk over the bridge from Circo Massimo. Not as busy and not quite so touristy as the main areas. Good for a couple of hours to just chill

Loved Trastevere. It has got to be the must see area of Rome with its numerous restaurants and bars, only spoilt by the excesive graphiti which seems to plague Italy particually Rome.We stayed right in the centre of Trastevere, which gave us all the sights of Rome either walking or short bus trips.

Wonderful slice of Italy. Great area.Best food we ate in Rome in here.Basilica a must-see along with a stroll through the area.Nice little shops to see and buy.Easy walk but also easily accessible by tram, bus.
Authentic Italy. There are lots of little alley's here with hidden fountains, amazing restaurants and cheap souvenir shopping, a must do while in Rome.

Great location. We stayed at the Hotel Santa Maria which is centrally located to the Vatican and the Pantheon area with a short amount of waking. The Trastevere area may not be worth visiting straightaway if you are staying in another area of Rome, but it is a great location to stay with its proximity to tourist attractions (without being on top of them) and the number of quant shops and restaurants that are all within a 10 minute walk.
Best area of Rome!. Perfect for a late night dinner or just a drink. It is the most charming part of the city, don't miss it!!!!
Great Area. Loved visiting Trastevere in the evening and during the day as well. Picturesque streets and houses and very good atsmosphere int this neighbourhood.

Beautiful Trastevere!. Our Vatican tour guide told us about the area of Trastevere, just across the Tiber river from Rome. This is a must see area. We went to Mass at St Bartholomew and walked across the bridge into this beautiful area that is a wonderful neighborhood with so many restaurants and shops. It was great to get out of the busy city and we were able to walk there from our hotel which was right near the Pantheon. We had good food in Rome but our best meal was there at Ristorante Arco Di S. Calisto. It is worth finding it among so many other choices. The Buffalo Mozzarella/Caprese salad was unbelievable. It is located a couple of streets off of Piazza Santa Maria. This was our favorite afternoon in Rome. Beautiful flowers and narrow streets! Cioa!

Quaint and pretty neighborhood. Still touristy, but not nearly as much so you can see Rome in its local form. There are lots of great restaurants. Love the cobble stone streets and general beauty of the neighborhood. We walked up the 8th hill to get a nice view of all of Rome, then down to find some gelatto!

Charm and the old ways. Trastevere - mostly working class neighborhoods - meaning Across the Water (in this case the Tiber). Go here for a taste of modern Italian life where almost no one speaks English, people are helpful and friendly, and street life quiets down after midnight. The tram, when it is running, gets you into Rome in 20 minutes; otherwise take the # 8 bus.

Lovely Trastevere. Trastevere is our favorite area in Rome. Although there are some obvious tourists, there is a strong sense of local community and neighborhood. Compared to Piazza Navona, it's less upscale, less expensive, and less touristy, but it has even greater charm and a very vibrant nightlife. Old buildings, many covered with bougainvillea, narrow winding streets, many really nice cafes/bars, restaurants and shops. The Piazza di Santa Maria in Trastevere (where the Basilica is located) is a fantastic place to sit and watch the world (priests, nuns, locals, tourists) go by. One morning, we watched as the local restaurants retrieved large trays of porcini mushrooms from the produce trucks, and chatted with an old man who sat in a doorway and cleaned them carefully. Trastevere is also within an easy walk of the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and other attractions. Few hotels, but many apartment rentals are possible. We strongly recommend this area for those who want to stay in a real neighborhood.

Best of Roma?!. One of the best area in Roma. Put you map away and wander the backstreets, you'll come upon markets, churches, and really incredible restaurants left and right! An incredibly romantic part of Roma, and delicious too! It is where Roma started, it began here.

Visiting the winding streets. We were lucky enough to meet a local artist that had some paintings of the Jewish Ghetto. How lucky was that! It made the walk so much more memorable! She was so pleased that we recognized the fountain!

If you want to live like a Roman..go to Trastevere!. Gorgeous area filled with restaurants and good atmosphere! This is where Roman people come and eat, and it's away from the city centre (10 minute drive from Castel Sant'Angelo). We had food at a restaurant near the street Via dei Fratteli da Trastevere, and there were tables outside. It is such a great feeling to have food outside, on a summer evening, and see the coloured sky due to the sunset. By 9 pm, Trastevere was filled with people having their meals, on-street entertainment, and lots of shops still open on a Sunday evening ! From Santa Maria in Trastevere it s so easy to cross the bridge towards Campo de Fiori and go to Punto Gelato, the 2nd best gelateria in Rome! They have loads of flavours and it's well worth it!
Where locals live!. If you want to feel real roman style like a local, you have to visit here today. A very peaceful, beautiful and safe area.

A must visit while in Rome. We had a great morning and lunch here. It is like a little bit of Tuscany in Rome and was nice to get away from the busy attractions. Stay away from the main areas and get to a quiet street for a nice meal.

Loved It. We were looking to escape the throngs of people around the tourist attractions in Rome so decided to spend an evening in this neighborhood. We loved the winding streets, little shops and restaurants. If we return to Rome we will try to stay in this neighborhood. It feels authentically Italian.

Walk and get lost in alleys full of history. Love walking Trastevere particularly late afternoon or early evening. The myriad of plazas, shops and restaurants never repeat themselves. Just walk and get immersed in the unique atmosphere until you get tired, then grab something to eat or enjoy home made gelato.

Trekking about Trastevere. Neat place to walk about and get a feel for what it would be like to live as an Italian. The churches are truly authentic and have masses in Latin. Restaurants are plentiful and I think fairly reasonable but do your research. We stayed for several days in Trastevere and felt quite safe walking about. Btw the water is phenomenal to drink - actually tastes sweet and pure. Go and enjoy

The pulse of Rome!. If you want to get a real taste of Roman life while being in the center of social activity, this is the neighborhood in which to stay when visiting Rome. Restaurants and cafe's are at your doorstep, and no major tourist destination is more than a 25 minute walk from the neighborhood. I think we enjoyed our trip so much because we really got to experience the local culture of Rome and not limit ourselves to the more commercialized areas. I'd fully recommend staying here for your Roman vacation,

The Food & beverage area of Rome. We stayed 7 nights in Trastevere, Via Luciano Manara - and No regrets.10 minutes to reach the center of rome by tramway or bus.The area is very animated, full of life & tasty restaurants. And most of all, it is cheaper than the center of Rome. Get away from the touristic restaurants & gelaterias of Rome center. Trastevere is the place to be, eat & stay.

Hustle and bustle.. A very busy area. Quite bohemian! The restaurants nearby are not very good value. You need to read reviews as some are quite expensive with poor quality food. The area is not very easy to get round in a mobility scooter!! We spent only a short time here as it is full of shops and restaurants. Too busy for us!! It was quite hectic for a Sunday evening.

Trastevere is the place to stay!. This was our first time visiting Rome. We opted to stay in Trastevere, because we wanted a to stay in a non-touristy area which would allow us to experience something of the "old" Rome in character. We were looking for quaint, narrow cobblestone streets, open air markets, cute sidewalk eateries, family run meat, cheese and bread shops, etc. We got more than we expected. Restaurants and trattorias abounding, shops around every corner, narrow ancient winding sreets to explore. We spent close to half of our time in Rome right in Trastevere - it was great to "go home" there aftter a hectic day of visiting Rome's tourist sights. The only consideration is that it takes about 15 minutes to walk to the city center, so you need to be willing to wak a little further, or take the accessible public tram or taxis. I wouldn't stay anywhere but Travestere when I return to Rome!
Traditional . If in Rome it is a place that you need to visit. Lovely and traditional Rome. Has some amazing food places as with the little walkways.

Fascinating walk in Trastevere. Trastevere is very interesting, there are some cultural sites, churches, tiny winding streets; it is, as a rule, somewhat less touristy (but not by much) than say Colosseum or central Rome's forums. Trastevere is filled with everyday activities, but we honestly failed to experience the much-touted authenticity or unique character of this Roman neighborhood. It is not exactly that the Centro Storico of the right bank of Rome doesn't have its real-city population, and real people living their real lives. The rest of historical Rome unequivocally has much more exciting sites, much more interesting architecture, a vast complex of museums and ancient Roman ruins. So Trastevere's appeal remains by and large a mystery for us.That is not to say that a walk of Trastevere is not going to be worth your time. It is positively different and without it, one's perception of Rome won't be complete. We would recommend to start your tour from Tiber Island (that is if you don't stay in Trastevere), cross Ponte Cestio and, walking under the arch of the picturesque Via dell’Arco de’ Tolomei, get to St Cecilia church. From there, head to Via della Lungaretta, lined with restaurants and little shops, and reach Piazza di Santa Maria in Trastevere. Go inside the church Santa Maria in Trastevere. Upon exiting the square's north side, follow Via della Scala to admire the ancient Porta Settimiana (a part of the Aurelian walls in Rome), and finish by magnificent Villa Farnesina. Do not combine a walk in Trastevere with climbing Gianicolo, for the latter requires a separate visit and touring both in one stretch would result in sensory overburden. Recommended.

Alive and Kicking.. Having never been to Rome before I was hoping that my choice of an area to stay in would be good and allow my wife and I to enjoy our visit. We were so impressed with this area that I dont think I could have made a better choice.Trastevere is buzzing with life,full of little bars, shops, Tavernas, its just so delightful every turn is just a delight of little picture perfect streets.Great for people watching sitting outside the little bars at night and something for everyone.We also found it was handy to base ourselves here as walking to all main sites was no problem and we went to the top of Giancolo hill to view the city on our first day.If and when we return this will be our base once again.We found all the tavernas/restaurants take pride in their house wines and my wife was impressed with all the wines she tried.

Wonderful part of the city. I only had time for two brief walks through here, and a great dinner, but would love to come back and stay in this part of town for a few days. Lovely little streets, beautiful cafes and bars and restaurants, and much quieter away from the tourist hub. Still within a short and easy walk to all of that, but plenty to see and do in this area. I felt like I was in old episodes of To Rome With Love..... Just great!

Very authentic. Trastavere was for me the nicest part of the city. During our 2,5-day long visit we came there three times because we just loved it - we had a pizza in one of the restaurants, ate ice cream. We also sit there with a bottle of wine chatting all night long...very authentic place and less touristic compared to other parts of Rome :)
Walk to Trastevere .... Cross the river Tiber and discover the quieter, more bohemian area, with fantastic restos ! A whole different feel to Rome...

LOVE TRASTERVERE!. Stayed there for 5 days a couple of years ago with 3 friends and fell in love with this great neighborhood! Lots of activity and wonderful restaurants. Easy walk to all of Rome highlights. Will be going back this year . . Can't wait!

Very nice. 2nd time in Rome. Over 5 day stay - 3 visits to this district. Cosy, live, smiley place.
The food is mutch better than on the other side of Tiber river (4 places were super out of 4, compared to 1 out of 10). Prices are also a lower.
Not much of interest to us. We visited and walked around but feel that we could have spent our time better elsewhere. Better parks and churches in other districts of Rome.

2- night stay in the neighborhood - Loved it!. Our family of 5 loved this neighborhood! We enjoyed some great food just steps from our apartment (Stop in Donkey Punch for a make your own Panini - it's a must!). The neighborhood has a great atmosphere with plenty of bars - many with live music to enjoy or you can simply pick up a bottle of wine and sit the around the fountain and partake in some people watching.

Away from tourists. A lovely neighborhood full of bar and restaurants... Just 2km from famous attractions of Rome... Not so many tourists, but Italians... There are many cheap solutions for good food...

A nice place to wander. We were fortunate to wander here one Saturday night amongst the locals out enjoying their weekend - it was vibrant and full of life and because there were less tourists there were nearly no vendors - very pleasant

Could be much better. Walking around dowtown Rome my girlfriend kept saying just wait until we make it to the Trastevere.She meant it is gonna be beautiful but it wasnt. I wont deny that the place has a vibe but I strongly belive the city does not know how to protect and enhance it.The while district is a numbernor narrow streets where a huge crowd of people is running away from the cars that barely fit the narrow passage anyways. And if it is not enough by itself the streets are packed with obstackles like chairs and tables of the million plus one ristorante and rugs immigrants display their fake junk on.Add to this equation that the walls of the buildings aren't aged nicely. They dont look like cool and ancient but rather run down and simply old.Other than this you can find a bit of a magic walking around. Once in a while you can stumble on a sweet little piazza to get a cold gelato and then it is kinda worth it.

The Only Area to Stay in when in Rome. This is my second time to Rome and the first time I've stayed in the Trastevere. After this last time, I'll never stay anywhere else. This area is close (walking distance) to all of the sights (Colosseum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Roman Forum etc) but is the best place to eat (it's where all the locals go to eat) and it is not completely overridden by tourists, so you can still move/walk about easily and its a quiet place to sleep (if you choose you accommodation well) We ate some GREAT meals in this area. The first time I was in Rome, I left feeling a little disappointed with the food, (found out later I ate in all the wrong areas at all the wrong places) but not this time around. If you don't like to walk, the tram line runs along the main street here and you can jump on and it will take you where you need to go....or close to it! If you don't stay here, make sure you come here to eat!! Trip advisor has some good recommendations for this area.

Fun for the whole family. Take the time to walk through this lovely village just across the river Tiber. We stopped for a drink in an outdoor cafe, bought street art for the kids (had no choice after they stood and watched for 20 minutes). Dinner at Spirito Desanti was also amazing.

Nice spot to unwind. This place...so glad we spent some time here. It's out of the city center and while there are still tourists around, it doesn't feel quite as crazy as the main city. Less dudes yelling selfie stick for sure. We came here and had a lovely lunch. Then we walked around the little streets just taking in the sights and enjoying the stroll. It's a great spot to see something a little more local. When we return to Rome I have a feeling we may spend more time in these types of spots than walking around the mayhem. I wish we had more time because it looked like there were a ton of cool little shops and trattorias to explore.
A must. This place of Rome is perfect. It is very enjoyable to walk through all the streets and having a meal somewhere. I totally recommend this place.

The very best part of Rome. This is definetely the best part of Rome, take your time stroll in the street, Watch the street artists at night. Listen to Music, go to the restaurants, pubs and enjoy the narrow streets. If you want to walk to the top of the hill and have a look over large parts of Rome, it is Worth it. A tough walk!

Beautiful. Beautiful part of Rome, with its narrow streets full of small, nice restaurants.Fantastic to just walk around, we did that in the evening, when it was a bit dark and that made area even more beautiful.

The most beautiful part of Rome. Trastevere lies on the left side of the river Tevere. It is the are full of restaurants, bars, tourists dining and having early breakfast in the morning. The architecture is beautiful. Perfect for morning walk but also for afternoon - evening joy!

Picture perfect! So romantic and with a great atmosphere, day and night!. Go for a stroll, to explore, for a night out, delicious Italian food, a date or ice cream, you name it. Loved this part of Rome!

We stayed here - loved it. Plenty of hotels to choose from, as well as B&Bs. Little restaurants tucked away everywhere, and plenty of curious little shops. Main street has dozens of eateries and places for a drink (I don't drink, however).Market stalls on the side of the road are not obstructive like they are in the town, and it boasts a fantastic Sunday market.All a half hour walk away from the main attractions of Rome.Personally, I'd recommend Arco dei Tolemei if you stay in the area. Brilliant place.

a district with narrow streets and a beautiful church of the same name. At the moment and during the day, many bars in the narrow streets are closed. It must be a very crowded place full of tourists certains months.We walked around for a short tim in the area. We didn't see anything outstanding, except the church of the same name.

Most romantic place ever!. If you want traditional, charming, romantic, real Italy then this is the place. My partner proposed here so it holds special memories but this really is a fantastic place to visit. It's so close to all the sights, yet tucked away to feel authentic and to see real Italy. You all must go!!!! Food is to die for. Xx

Charming place to eat and shop. We took a taxi to Trastevere from our hotel on the Via Veneto. It was a short and enjoyable trip. We were so taken by the charm of Trastevere. We shopped in unique shops for leather goods, clothing, art, and souvenirs. We finished the trip with a gelato stop at an outdoor cafe. I highly recommend taking the time to see this section of Rome.

love. This is my favourite area of Rome and I am drawn back here time and time again. Yes it's now full of tourists and places that will rip you off, and yes it's full of graffiti but I still love the place. They say that in the past this is where the real Romans lived. You can find some really nice places to eat and drink and I love santa Maria in trastevere and the piazza surrounding it. You must go here and see for yourself.
Such beautiful buildings!. Trastevere is a "must" when visiting Rome! The buildings are so impressive! It is such a beautiful area to visit, shop, eat or just leisurely stroll around and sight see.
small reall Italy. It was amazing place, small streets with real italian atmosphere. Not crowded in compare with other attractions in Rome...
The place to be. The in place in Rome for eating , drinking or just strolling -- throw in some fantastic churches , Palaces and Bridges and you have Italy in a nut shell !!

Beautiful area. Without being everywhere in Rome, I think this definitely has to be one of the nicest places in the city. Great atmosphere, nice neighborhood and a lot of great restaurants to visit. You should spend some time here!

Jewel of Rome. What an amazing neighbourhood of Rome. Just accross the river Tiberius from Jewish ghetto... Full of coffee shops, cosy restaurants, beautiful small piazzas, amazing churches, cobble stone small streets, beautiful buildings full of history. Enjoy relaxing walk from bustle and hustle of Central Rome. Superb.

Food and more food, then gelato. This is a very old section of town just across the river and somewhat near the Vatican. We walked there from there. The narrow streets are lined with shops of all kinds, but the star here is the food. There are many restaurants selling all sorts of really good food. I had a seafood pasta for only 10 Euro that would cost 25.00 minimum back home. The area is crowded but there are so many places to eat everyone can find what they like. Wear comfortable shoes and walk the streets to enjoy the beauty of this neighborhood.

WORST LITTER AND GRAFFITI I HAVE EVER SEEN . Where can I start .... Rome WAS beautiful .... I have travelled all over the world to over 60 countries over 5 continents .... I am a photographer and environmentalist ... This is the most disgustingly filthy city I have ever been to the buildings are amazing the history food people are incredible the appalling litter is honestly mind boggling every street in every part of Rome is carpeted in litter for people to defend this filth and say they didn't notice beggars belief I desperately wanted Rome to inspire me and it did but the litter ruined it completely there's not any council workers picking litter anywhere it's just all over the floor even around the amazing sites like the colosseum there's cigarette bits and plastic bottles everywhere it's really depressing

Fabulous neighborhood!. We were so excited to get an apt. In this neighborhood! Tons of restaurants, culture and great locale. We had a wonderful apt from airbnb trastervere Profumo de Roma (35). She was unbelievably responsive!

Great spot to stay. We loved the small streets, boutiques, great trattorias, bars, bakeries and local (slightly bohemian) vibe of this area which was also an excellent location from which to explore the whole of Rome.

Hectic and very touristy. This is where a lot of tourists have dinner. I did not like it. I love a buzzing athmosphere but this was too much. I would rather go to Campo di Fiori. Still a lot happening and food with higher quality.

I love it. Small narrow streets. Lot's of people - lots of restaurants - lots of life.
It it a great part of the town - and in general the food is a bit better and the prices a bit lower than in the old town center. We really enjoyed it

Nice spot. The place has it. Lovely bars and restaurant. Nice little cobbled streets. We went in April and had a great time here. It was a little expense and there were a few doggy characters but if you can handle this, you will love it here.

Love it. Amazing area with a vast majority of cafes and trattorias. Musicians play everywhere, cheap but fashion jewelry is sold by Africans. Not a typical touristic place, that's what makes it different from other parts of Rome.

Filthy, beggars and rip offs. Don't get me wrong, I'm not a tourist I live here. For a tourist it looks cute... but beware.The place is filthy and disgusting with typical rude arrogant Italians who actually have very little to be arrogant about.Most restaurants over charge for everything and prey on tourists with exceedingly average food. In fact Italian food is better in most other parts of the world.Beggars and street vendors are everywhere, be very careful around them and in crowds. Bear in mind most are crooks.There are lots of drop outs wandering around. Most of the steps up to the hiily areas are covered in broken bottles.Visit, but don't get sucked in the "old world charm" there is nothing genuine there, except the age of the buildings.
Lovely!. Trastevere is a lovely part of Rome if you want to feel the history, enjoy good food and beautiful buildings.

Beautiful!. Visited Trastevere as part of our holiday to Rome. I can see why this area is so loved. It's really pretty with narrow streets, quaint houses and unique little shops. The streets are lined with little market stalls selling things other than the usual Pope themed souvenirs. Lots of lovely restaurants and wine bars. As with the rest of Rome, there is umpteen churches to explore.There is no metro station serving this area but we used Circo Massimo station and walked up past the Circo Massimo and over the bridge. I look forward to going back to Trastevere next visit.

The authentic Rome which still has an unspoilt atmosphere. Lots of bars, restaurants and street theatre. Visited on last day of holiday and was impressed how peaceful the squares were away from the bustle of central Rome.

Great for Food. Bars, pubs and restaurants all next to each other in one area, also visit the Santa Maria church in the area, not very commercial but still beautiful and un commercialised like many other churches and basilicas. there are tons of food places so decide what you want and use trip advisor to assist or just go hoppinf form one to the other and experience the variety, beware there are are few prominently placed tourist traps though.

Stayed here and loved it. Stayed in an apartment on our visit here and loved it. Great area with places to eat pizza, pasta, ice creams , bakery stuff, drink and walk around. Great places to get quality or cheap groceries as you wish with daily open markets . Late nights are great too with bars and eating places open late into the night. Central Rome or Vatican is about 25-30 minutes walk from the market area where we stayed and well connected by the tram and bus network too.

Nightlife and Dolce Vita. If you want to have cocktails at night well... Trastevere is the place to be. Its lively narrow roads really take you in the Roman atmosphere and all you wish to do is finding a seat, relax and enjoy your drink while people watching. I went there with friends who live there and I couldn't ask for a better scenery for our reunion!

Wonderful area to stay in Rome. We were based in Trastevere during our ten day stay in Rome and felt almost like locals. Great bars and restaurants, the beautiful piazza, easy access to other areas of the city...we enjoyed a food tour, a cooking class and just walking about.

Lively, interesting And central. I loved trasevere, even though it across the river it iis a short (interesting) walk to the colosseum,forum and the Vatican. There are also buses and trams very close by to all areas of the city. You won't have to go looking for somewhere to eat in the evening all price ranges of restaurants bars and cafes are on the doorstep.This was my second visit to Rome. I stayed in a studio apartment with a garden on via dell scala on one of the main streets. There are only aFew local cars as the streets are so narrow, our apt. was tucked away down a gated and locked alley, very safe and quaint, apart from a few neighbours talking, which added to the atmosphere, we could'nt hear a thing considering trastevere is crammed with shops bars and cafes.Don't let people put you off by saying Rome is expensive ,we paid 54euro a night for the accommodation, had a sandwich at lunchtime for 3 euros, coffee about 2euros.cheaper than the uk. If you stay here you will experience local life.

I expected more.... Area near the Isola which is a bit of A ramshackle collection of shops and restaurants spread over quite an area. Couple of nice piazza areas, but plagued by sellers and graffiti everywhere I found. We picked badly for our choice of food instead of going on recommendations via TA which we normally do I think the area on the whole is missable and Covent Garden in London is 10 times better. However, if you are in the area probably worth getting your own opinion. I would not go out of my way or allocated precious time to this with what Rome has to offer elsewhere.

Nightlife in Rome. Many pizzerias and bars in this area (not really cheap, but Rome is expensive in general). Not THAT cool, for a European capital, but ok for a drink. Avoid it after 2:30 am though, just weird people around and if you're a girl the locals will start following you in a sleazy way.

The Covent Garden of Rome!. Lovely winding cobbled streets and an abundance of small authentic trattorias and bars. Couple of squares, one dominated by a beautiful church. Just perfect for sitting in the sunshine, listening to the live music often played there with a glass of prosecco or two! Just by the river. Really worth a trip!

Extra time in Rome... Its worth exploring. If you got some extra time in Rome, and you've experienced the main sites, then the Trastevere area is worth walking to and getting lost in the maze of streets throughout. Enjoy a lunch here, and continue your walk up the river to the Vatican Area. For photographers, there are a lot nice photo ops throughout the area.

Beautiful and lively, just how it should be!. There are bars and cafes and restaurants around every corner; there's so many you'll be spoilt for choice!We stayed in Trastevere Thursday - Sunday, it was lively in the evening and had a really calm friendly vibe in the morning. The architecture is incredibly Mediterranean and it's incredibly easy to wander the narrow cobbled streets for hours for no purpose other than to find an inviting cafe. Saturday night was the most vibrant, with people spilling into the streets after 9pm to enjoy vibrant discussions and a drink or two.You can quite easily bar hop given the variety, so don't settle in at one for too long or you'll miss out.

Best Neighborhood in Rome!. We stayed in Trastevere. I didn't particularly like our B & B, but I LOVED the neighborhood. There are tons of great coffee shops (called "bars" during the day, don't be dissuaded from going in). Lots of pizza joints, traditional Italian restaurants, inventive "foodie" type restaurants and even fine dining. Lots of wonderful shops, interesting churches and architecture. Wonderful people watching. Lots of taxi stands and a quick walk to the Jewish Ghetto, Campo di' Fiori.
The Best! Da Enzo AL 29. Great Food - Do your self a favor and book a reservation for Da Enzo Al 29 for 7:30PM and have the best italian food in the world.

Charming Trastevere. We almost didn't visit this area of Rome, but this is where Romans go to eat and shop, away from the more tourist heavy areas of Rome. We felt like we were in a small village inside a big city. Every turn more charming than the next. Great restaurants and definitely worth a visit.
Go here! One of our favorite parts of our Rome trip!. Absolutely adorable area! Had lunch in front of the fountain by the church. Budget some time here, you won't regret it!

Best area of Rome. This is the older area of Rome but actually is very crowded by young people every single day of the week. There are a lot of pubs, restaurants, opened till late in the night, where tourists and also italians come for having fun and enjoy some drinks with friends.

Incredible atmosphere!. From the moment you set foot on this neighborhood you'll feel a different vibe emanating from it, a vivid experience you should try while in Rome! Cobblestone streets, local fair, lovable buildings all around and lots of cafes and restaurants to choose from!

Walk the alleyways and along the river. It's almost impossible to miss the pretty alleyways in this neighbourhood, it's so worth visiting if you don't find a place to stay. At night the restaurants are spilling onto the streets with people. The service in the 2 restaurants we ate at were good and the meals were perfect. Be sure to try a salad of pear and Parmesan drizzled with honey. So simple but amazing! I was happy to see all restaurants we went to catered for coeliacs or 'sanza glutene'. During the summer months by the river there are night markets for craft and food, we enjoyed walking off our dinner each night but would've loved to eat at one of these places, we just couldn't decide which one we wanted to eat at!

Nice place for an afternoon family walk.... We put many miles on our shoes...or should I say kilometers..on our family trip to Italy...and a scenic walk through the Trastevere region was included...It's just past vatican city along the river. We walked along the water slipping in and out of the neighborhood streets...watch out for traffic along the water!  We actually didn't do anything but look around. It felt like a walk through any 'not quite the best part but still safe' area of a big city...Like walking in the Fenway area of Boston.

This is the Rome I like. A must to go, a lot of restaurants, coffee shops , Villa Farnesana to see the Raffaellos frescas, have a good coffee, ,live music on the piazzas, after all the famous monuments the real spirit of Roma,
Best part of Rome. Trastevere is the best part of Rome in my opinion. You can get the real feel, you feel like a local walking around the little streets. Elaborately loved it!!!

what a wonderful place!. Rome is a wonderful city full of charm, any place you can feel its magic!I recommend to all travelers to visit Trastevere which, I think, is the real soul of the most fascinating city in the world!
amaizing. Lovely area to walk the alleys , small streets and beautiful , lots of restaurants suitable for meals throughout the day .

The best place to stay in Rome... Beautiful cobbled streets, a lovely Italian feel about the area. You definitely need a good street map! We walked to all the sights from here, apart from one bus ride to the Vatican City as it was pouring with rain. I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else if I return to Rome.

"beyond the Tiber". Trastevere maintains its character thanks to its narrow cobbled streets lined by medieval houses. At night, natives and tourists alike flock to its many pubs and restaurants, but much of the original character of Trastevere remains. Trastevere is the 13th rione of Rome, on the west bank of the Tiber, south of Vatican City. Its name comes from the Latin trans Tiberim, meaning literally "beyond the Tiber".

Bohemian chic captured in time. Someone once said: "When you are in Rome, behave as Romans!" Following the citizens of Rome example, I set out for Trastevere, curious to explore how locals spend their leisure hours.This place is unusual for Rome, arouses bohemian sensitivity, gives you an impression of bygone centuries and invites you to experience charm of Trastevere's timelessness cafes. Here you will not find attractiveness of Piazza Navona, often used for commercial purposes, proud past of the ancient Rome, baroque richness of Roman fountains or trendy cafes. But, you will find comfort and shelter for tired tourist getting away from hustle and bustle of Rome during afternoon hours. You could connect visits to Vatican and Trastevere, because both are located in neighborhood. The good idea is combination of tourist bus on&off and walking. When you get at Vatican by tourist bus, visit it and make a break there, then you could continue to Trastevere on foot. The walk along river Tiber decorated with its charming bridges provides you a romantic pleasure, particularly in the spring. The chic cafes, remarkable by their character, offer drinks at reasonable prices and decorate narrow streets. The pricey shops will learn you very soon that bohemianism could be paid at high price. If you are woman/girl, you will see Trastevere offers numerous shopping opportunities and you will set your eyes on beautiful fashionable bags and shoes that you will make a wish to have!In any case, reward yourself with a visit to this part of the City, pick on some chic cafe as I did and enjoy bohemian mood! Because, when you are in Rome, behave as Romans!

Great flea market. This is the largest flea market I have ever walked thru, it must 20 square blocks. If you are looking for it you will find it here weather it be cheap electronics, clothing, knock off designer wear, food, antiques...anything. I got a three pack of great socks for 3 euros, a knife set and should have gotten more and the wife picked up some wonderful scarfs. Street musicians, artists are also to be found. All the information I found said it went until noon but no one seemed to be closing up shop at that time. There is also a playground with in for the kids to play around. Grab a cup of cafe and just walk and be sure to pick up some fresh porcetta. Trastevere is also of the tourist track so a great place to see where the natives live.

Quaint area. We enjoyed strolling around Trastevere during the late afternoon. We were looking for a bar to have a drink and found Bar San Calisto on Piazza San Calisto, which was excellent. There were numerous other places we could have had a drink, but they seemed touristy and pushy in selling meals.

Different. Don't miss this beautiful part of Rome, it's unique and it's fun to get lost between those narrow streets where you can find lovely restaurants packed with young people. Unfortunately I couldn't see it at night, they say it's more fun and vivid.

Bohemian. Fun. Feels real. In my book the least touristy part of Rome. And the most fun Restaurants seen to be full of Romans!!!And many great Restaurants too. Better value than elsewhere Architecture is interesting. Not classical but interesting real neighbourhood with local shops and dwellings

True Roman Neighbourhood. Tratevere is a stones throw from all the sites and sounds any tourist could want, but provides a better look at real Roman lifestyle. Excellent small shops for fresh pasta,bread, produce and wine. Fantastic restaurants and perfect little streets for a great evening stroll.

Excellent but beware. This is a pleasant place to stroll around with lots of interesting places to see.Our trip was marred by pickpockets on the bus back into the centre of Rome. It was an elaborate scam involving 5 people. We waited 15 minutes or so for a bus and when it came my (Chinese) father in law was separated from us by 2 people who pushed ahead of him and three behind. This was near the bus driver and the people stopped him moving forward while going through his shoulder bag and taking 100 euros. They jumped off at the next stop. This was quite an elaborate scam as we must have been seen waiting for the bus and then they targeted one member who was obviously older and not European.Worth being vigilant even getting on buses.

Night Walk In Trastevere. We chose to be part of a commercial night walking tour through the Jewish ghetto before crossing the Tiber and exploring Trastevere. We'd been on a night walking tour in Rome previously and really enjoyed our guide's background information. He pointed out little things we probably would not have noticed on our own. Local knowledge is a wonderful thing. Being with a small group also provided us with a sense of security as night time can be intimidating for those of us not as young as we once were. Having said that Trastevere lends itself to walking and exploring at one's own rate. Although off the main tourist track Trastevere offers much for the visitor to Rome and, though nowhere near as crowded as the hot spots across the Tiber or at the Vatican, there were quite a few people wandering the night we were there. It is a very picturesque old area with narrow laneways that open onto cobbled squares, gorgeous Renaissance buildings some almost completely covered in ivy. In one tiny laneway the ivy was draped across the walkway forming a green canopy overhead. There are many lovely shops, eateries and piazzas to explore. Many restaurants are frequented by the locals and there is a lovely "family" feel to the area. The beauty of walking at night is that it is much cooler and the lights bathe everything in a romantic glow. Crossing the Tiber just as the lights were coming on was magical. On our walk we visited Santa Cecilia, the 9th century monastic church and were there in time to listen to the nuns' singing evening Mass. Something very special. In Piazza Santa Maria a small band was playing and there was a carnival atmosphere.The mosaics inside the basilica Santa Maria were amazing. It is quite easy to get to Trastevere by public transport. It is about a 10 minute return trip to Palazza Venetia or by walking across Ponte Sublicio along Via Marmorata to metro Pyramide. From metro Circo Massimo walk along Via Del Circo Massimo towards the Tiber and cross into Trastevere over Ponte Palatino. You get a really good view of the ruined Ponte Rotto from this bridge. Or walk a little further beside the river on Lungotevere Aventino until you reach Ponte Cestio and explore Isola Tiberina before crossing into Trastevere.

a quieter area of Rome. Off the tourist track is the area of Trastevere. its well worth a visit as the streets are devoid of pushy street sellers and you can walk around with relative ease. the sleepy streets house quaint italian buildings, discreet coffee shops and nice restaurants. the coffee shop near the college is very reasonable. The fountain at the top of the hill is also worth the walk and the view from there over the city is stunning. The area is easily accessed via the tram and the return trip to the Palazza Venezia is about 10 minutes
Best part of Rome. this my favorite part of Rome. Classic restaurants and lovely shops not filled with throne of typical tourists.

Roaming in Trastevere, Rome. This neighborhood is a bit off the tourist-beaten track and a nice getaway from the main attractions of the city. Great small shops of divergent themes, small, friendly restaurants and a chance to wander without having to dodge a zillion people. This is a great place to have a quiet lunch or an intimate dinner. I was surprised at the lack of crowds!

My favorite spot in Eternal city. Yours may vary as there are plenty to choose from.... All city is nice but this alongside the Spanish stairs are my two all favorites... Special atmosphere, like a little village within a city.
Loving it!. Trastevere is in a way a town within the town of Roma with its own little twists and turns. restaurants, sightseeings, shops, cafes and so on are topclass
